Original: La gloria di colui che tutto move per l’universo penetra, e risplende in una parte più e meno altrove
Translate: The power of the One who moves everything spreads throughout the Universe and shines more in some parts, less in others

Original: Nel ciel che più de la sua luce prende fu’ io, e vidi cose che ridire né sa né può chi di là sù discende
Translate: I was in Heaven that is more enlightened by his light, and I saw things that those who descend from above do not know nor can report

Original: perché appressando sé al suo disire, nostro intelletto si profonda tanto, che dietro la memoria non può ire
Translate: in fact, approaching the object of his desire, our intellect penetrates so deeply that the memory cannot follow him

Original: Veramente quant’ io del regno santo ne la mia mente potei far tesoro, sarà ora materia del mio canto
Translate: However, the subject of my song will be what I was able to fix in my mind of the holy kingdom

Original: O buono Appollo, a l’ultimo lavoro fammi del tuo valor sì fatto vaso, come dimandi a dar l’amato alloro
Translate: O good Apollo, grant me your inspiration for the Last Song, as much as you ask to grant the longing poetic laurel

Original: Infino a qui l’un giogo di Parnaso assai mi fu
Translate: So far I have had enough of a single summit of Mount Parnaso

Original: ma or con amendue m’è uopo intrar ne l’aringo rimaso
Translate: But now I have to get to the remaining work with the help of both

Original: Entra nel petto mio, e spira tue sì come quando Marsïa traesti de la vagina de le membra sue
Translate: Get into my chest and inspire me, just like when you pulled Marsia out of the envelope of her limbs

Original: O divina virtù, se mi ti presti tanto che l’ombra del beato regno segnata nel mio capo io manifesti,
Translate: O divine virtue, if thou grant thee to me that long enough for me to express a trace of the kingdom of the blessed engraved in my mind,

Original: vedra’mi al piè del tuo diletto legno venire, e coronarmi de le foglie che la materia e tu mi farai degno
Translate: You will see me coming at the foot of your beloved tree, and crowning me with its leaves, of which you and the high subject of the poem will make me worthy.

Original: Sì rade volte, padre, se ne coglie per trïunfare o cesare o poeta, colpa e vergogna de l’umane voglie,
Translate: It happens so rarely, Father, that the laurel is seized for the triumph of a leader or a poet,

Original: che parturir letizia in su la lieta delfica deïtà dovria la fronda peneia, quando alcun di sé asseta
Translate: that the leaf of Peneo should give birth to joy in the happy divinity of Delphi, when desired by someone

Original: Poca favilla gran fiamma seconda
Translate: A big flame follows a faint spark

Original: forse di retro a me con miglior voci si pregherà perché Cirra risponda
Translate: Maybe after me others, with better voices, will pray for Cirra to answer

Original: Surge ai mortali per diverse foci la lucerna del mondo
Translate: The lantern of the world rises to mortals from different points of the horizon

Translate: but from that point where four circles intersect forming three crosses, it is born in conjunction with a milder season

Original: e la mondana cera più a suo modo tempera e suggella
Translate: and with a propitious star and exerts a more beneficial influence on the world

Original: Fatto avea di là mane e di qua sera tal foce, e quasi tutto era là bianco quello emisperio, e l’altra parte nera,
Translate: That spot had full day in Purgatory and night on Earth, and one hemisphere was all white and the other black,

Original: quando Beatrice in sul sinistro fianco vidi rivolta e riguardar nel sole
Translate: When I saw Beatrice turning left and staring at the sun

Original: aguglia sì non li s’affisse unquanco
Translate: An eagle never so stared at him

Original: E sì come secondo raggio suole uscir del primo e risalire in suso, pur come pelegrin che tornar vuole,
Translate: And as the reflected ray is usually moving away from that of incidence and climbing up at the same angle, like a pilgrim who wants to return home,

Original: così de l’atto suo, per li occhi infuso ne l’imagine mia, il mio si fece, e fissi li occhi al sole oltre nostr’ uso
Translate: So from his infused attitude into my imaginary faculty mine was born, and I stared at the sun beyond normal human abilities.

Original: Molto è licito là, che qui non lece a le nostre virtù, mercé del loco fatto per proprio de l’umana spece
Translate: There in Eden many things are permitted that are not on Earth, thanks to that place created as the proper place of the human species

Original: Io nol soffersi molto, né sì poco, ch’io nol vedessi sfavillar dintorno, com’ ferro che bogliente esce del foco
Translate: I couldn't stare at the sun for a long time, but I couldn't see it shining all around, like a glowing iron just came out of the fire.

Original: e di sùbito parve giorno a giorno essere aggiunto, come quei che puote avesse il ciel d’un altro sole addorno
Translate: And immediately it seemed that another was added to the day, as if God had adorned the heaven of a second sun.

Original: Beatrice tutta ne l’etterne rote fissa con li occhi stava
Translate: Beatrice stared at the heavenly wheels

Original: e io in lei le luci fissi, di là sù rimote
Translate: And I looked upon her, and turned her away from heaven.

Original: Nel suo aspetto tal dentro mi fei, qual si fé Glauco nel gustar de l’erba che ’l fé consorto in mar de li altri dèi
Translate: When I looked at her, I became such that she became Glaucus when she ate the grass, which turned her into a sea deity.

Original: Trasumanar significar per verba non si poria
Translate: Elevating beyond human limits could not be explained in words

Original: però l’essemplo basti a cui esperïenza grazia serba
Translate: Therefore the mythological example suffices to those to whom divine grace reserves direct experience

Original: S’i’ era sol di me quel che creasti novellamente, amor che ’l ciel governi, tu ’l sai, che col tuo lume mi levasti
Translate: If I was only what you, love that governs Heaven, created for last, you know that you lifted me up with your light

Original: Quando la rota che tu sempiterni desiderato,
Translate: When the rotating motion of Heaven, which you make eternal with the desire of the heavenly wheels to approach you,

Original: a sé mi fece atteso con l’armonia che temperi e discerni,
Translate: He drew my attention to the harmony that you set and establish,

Original: parvemi tanto allor del cielo acceso de la fiamma del sol, che pioggia o fiume lago non fece alcun tanto disteso
Translate: the sky seemed so bright to me by the light of the sun that rain or a river never created such a wide lake

Original: La novità del suono e ’l grande lume di lor cagion m’accesero un disio mai non sentito di cotanto acume
Translate: The novelty of sound and intense light kindled in me the desire to know its cause, so sharp as I never heard it

Original: Ond’ ella, che vedea me sì com’ io, a quïetarmi l’animo commosso, pria ch’io a dimandar, la bocca aprio e cominciò
Translate: Then she, who read in my mind as myself, before I asked her something opened her mouth to appease my troubled soul and said,

Original: «Tu stesso ti fai grosso col falso imaginar, sì che non vedi ciò che vedresti se l’avessi scosso
Translate: You yourself make yourself unable to comprehend with a false imagination, so that you do not see what you would see if you were freed

Original: Tu non se’ in terra, sì come tu credi
Translate: You're not on Earth, just as you think.

Original: ma folgore, fuggendo il proprio sito, non corse come tu ch’ad esso riedi»
Translate: but a lightning, leaving its natural home, did not run as fast as you that you return to the place that is really yours (Translated with Google Translate)

Original: S’io fui del primo dubbio disvestito per le sorrise parolette brevi, dentro ad un nuovo più fu’ inretito e dissi
Translate: If I was freed from the first doubt through those brief and smiling words, I was seized by another doubt, and I said,

Original: «Già contento requïevi di grande ammirazion
Translate: ♪ Now my great wonder has subsided

Original: ma ora ammiro com’ io trascenda questi corpi levi»
Translate: But now I am amazed how I can ascend beyond these light bodies.

Original: Ond’ ella, appresso d’un pïo sospiro, li occhi drizzò ver’ me con quel sembiante che madre fa sovra figlio deliro, e cominciò
Translate: Then she, after a devout sigh, looked at me with the appearance of a mother who turned to her son who said nonsense, and began

Original: «Le cose tutte quante hanno ordine tra loro, e questo è forma che l’universo a Dio fa simigliante
Translate: All created things are ordained among themselves, and this is the form that makes the Universe like God.

Original: Qui veggion l’alte creature l’orma de l’etterno valore, il qual è fine al quale è fatta la toccata norma
Translate: In this order rational creatures see the imprint of divine virtue, which is the ultimate goal of all order itself

Original: Ne l’ordine ch’io dico sono accline tutte nature, per diverse sorti, più al principio loro e men vicine
Translate: In this order that I say all natures receive their inclination, in different ways, more or less close to their creator principle

Original: onde si muovono a diversi porti per lo gran mar de l’essere, e ciascuna con istinto a lei dato che la porti
Translate: for which they tend to several goals in the breadth of the Universe, and each is driven by an instinct given to it

Original: Questi ne porta il foco inver’ la luna
Translate: This instinct brings fire to the moon

Original: questi ne’ cor mortali è permotore
Translate: It moves the hearts of irrational beings

Original: questi la terra in sé stringe e aduna
Translate: It tightens and makes the earth cohesive

Original: né pur le creature che son fore d’intelligenza quest’ arco saetta, ma quelle c’hanno intelletto e amore
Translate: This instinct moves not only the intelligent creatures, but also those with a rational soul.

Original: La provedenza, che cotanto assetta, del suo lume fa ’l ciel sempre quïeto nel qual si volge quel c’ha maggior fretta
Translate: Providence, which establishes all this, always makes quiet with its light the Heaven in which rotates the fastest

Original: e ora lì, come a sito decreto, cen porta la virtù di quella corda che ciò che scocca drizza in segno lieto
Translate: and brings us there, as to an established site, the strength of that natural instinct that directs every moving being to a successful end

Original: Vero è che, come forma non s’accorda molte fïate a l’intenzion de l’arte, perch’ a risponder la materia è sorda,
Translate: It is true that, as the form many times does not correspond to the intention of the artist, because matter does not respond as it should,

Original: così da questo corso si diparte talor la creatura, c’ha podere di piegar, così pinta, in altra parte
Translate: so sometimes the rational creature moves away from this course, having the power to bend in another direction, though so well directed

Original: e sì come veder si può cadere foco di nube, sì l’impeto primo l’atterra torto da falso piacere
Translate: and as you can see a lightning that falls from a cloud, so the natural instinct can make man stretch down, drawn by the false pleasure of earthly goods

Original: Non dei più ammirar, se bene stimo, lo tuo salir, se non come d’un rivo se d’alto monte scende giuso ad imo
Translate: And thou shalt not be astonished, if I judge correctly, that thou go up, except as a river flowing from the mountain to the valley.

Original: Maraviglia sarebbe in te se, privo d’impedimento, giù ti fossi assiso, com’ a terra quïete in foco vivo»
Translate: It would be astonishing if you, without impediments, had remained on the ground, just like a fire that remained quiet and did not rise upward.

Original: Quinci rivolse inver’ lo cielo il viso
Translate: After his words, Beatrice turned her eyes to Heaven

Original: O voi che siete in piccioletta barca, desiderosi d’ascoltar, seguiti dietro al mio legno che cantando varca,
Translate: O you readers who are in a small boat , eager to listen , who follow behind my ship singing on the sea ,

Original: tornate a riveder li vostri liti
Translate: Go back to the coast from which you started

Original: non vi mettete in pelago, ché forse, perdendo me, rimarreste smarriti
Translate: do not go out into the open sea, for perhaps by losing my wake, you will lose yourself.

Original: L’acqua ch’io prendo già mai non si corse
Translate: The water I go through was never crossed by anyone

Original: Minerva spira, e conducemi Appollo, e nove Muse mi dimostran l’Orse
Translate: Minerva blows the winds, and Apollos holds the rudder, and the nine Muses show me the right course.

Original: Voialtri pochi che drizzaste il collo per tempo al pan de li angeli, del quale vivesi qui ma non sen vien satollo,
Translate: You few, who have nourished yourselves in time with the bread of the angels of which here on Earth one lives but never gets satisfied,

Original: metter potete ben per l’alto sale vostro navigio, servando mio solco dinanzi a l’acqua che ritorna equale
Translate: You can go to the high sea with your boat, following my wake before the water that returns equal

Original: Que’ glorïosi che passaro al Colco non s’ammiraron come voi farete, quando Iasón vider fatto bifolco
Translate: Those glorious who came into Colchis, when they saw Jason become a farmer, were not as amazed as you are doing.

Original: La concreata e perpetüa sete del deïforme regno cen portava veloci quasi come ’l ciel vedete
Translate: The innate and continuing thirst of Godlike kingdom brought us up, as fast as the Heavenly movement

Original: Beatrice in suso, e io in lei guardava

Original: e forse in tanto in quanto un quadrel posa e vola e da la noce si dischiava,

Original: giunto mi vidi ove mirabil cosa mi torse il viso a sé

Original: e però quella cui non potea mia cura essere ascosa, volta ver’ me, sì lieta come bella,
Translate: and therefore she to whom none of my thoughts could be hidden, to me, as glad as she was beautiful,

Original: «Drizza la mente in Dio grata», mi disse, «che n’ha congiunti con la prima stella»
Translate: "Return your mind and express gratitude to God," he said to me, "who brought us into the first star."

Original: Parev’ a me che nube ne coprisse lucida, spessa, solida e pulita, quasi adamante che lo sol ferisse
Translate: It seemed to me that it covered us with a bright, thick, solid and clear cloud, like a diamond illuminated by the sun.

Original: Per entro sé l’etterna margarita ne ricevette, com’ acqua recepe raggio di luce permanendo unita
Translate: The eternal gem embraced us within itself, as the water receives the ray of sun remaining united

Original: S’io era corpo, e qui non si concepe com’ una dimensione altra patio,
Translate: If I had a solid body, and here you don't understand how one dimension could bear the other,

Original: ch’esser convien se corpo in corpo repe,
Translate: what has to happen if a body penetrates another body,

Original: accender ne dovria più il disio di veder quella essenza in che si vede come nostra natura e Dio s’unio
Translate: the desire to see that essence in which one sees the mystery of the incarnation of the divine

Original: Lì si vedrà ciò che tenem per fede, non dimostrato, ma fia per sé noto a guisa del ver primo che l’uom crede
Translate: There, we will see what we believe through faith, not shown rationally, but made known as the truths to which man believes

Original: Io rispuosi
Translate: I replied

Original: «Madonna, sì devoto com’ esser posso più, ringrazio lui lo qual dal mortal mondo m’ha remoto
Translate: "My lady, as devout as you cannot be more, I thank God who separated me from the mortal world.

Original: Ma ditemi
Translate: But tell me.

Original: che son li segni bui di questo corpo, che là giuso in terra fan di Cain favoleggiare altrui?»
Translate: What are the dark signs of this star, which down there in Earth induce some to fabulize Cain?

Original: Ella sorrise alquanto, e poi «S’elli erra l’oppinïon», mi disse,
Translate: She smiled a little, and then she said, "If the opinion of men is wrong,"

Original: «d’i mortali dove chiave di senso non diserra, certo non ti dovrien punger li strali d’ammirazione omai,
Translate: in that matter where the senses do not provide adequate explanations, surely you should not be surprised by now,

Original: poi dietro ai sensi vedi che la ragione ha corte l’ali
Translate: for you see that reason cannot always go after the senses

Original: Ma dimmi quel che tu da te ne pensi»
Translate: But tell me your opinion about it.

Original: E io
Translate: And I

Original: «Ciò che n’appar qua sù diverso credo che fanno i corpi rari e densi»
Translate: I believe that the differences in the brightness of the stars are caused by the different density of the star body.

Original: Ed ella
Translate: And you.

Original: «Certo assai vedrai sommerso nel falso il creder tuo, se bene ascolti l’argomentar ch’io li farò avverso
Translate: Of course you will see that your thought is totally wrong, if you listen carefully to the arguments with which I will refute him.

Original: La spera ottava vi dimostra molti lumi, li quali e nel quale e nel quanto notar si posson di diversi volti
Translate: The eighth Heaven shows you many stars, which appear different in quantity and quality

Original: Se raro e denso ciò facesser tanto, una sola virtù sarebbe in tutti, più e men distributa e altrettanto
Translate: If this were caused only by the different density, then in all would be present the same virtue, distributed to a greater extent, less or equal

Original: Virtù diverse esser convegnon frutti di princìpi formali, e quei, for ch’uno, seguiterieno a tua ragion distrutti
Translate: Instead it is necessary that different virtues are the product of different formal principles, which according to your reasoning would be reduced to only one

Original: Ancor, se raro fosse di quel bruno cagion che tu dimandi, o d’oltre in parte fora di sua materia sì digiuno esto pianeto,
Translate: Also, if the reason that you're looking for different brightness was the lower density, then this planet would be massless from one side to the other,

Original: o, sì come comparte lo grasso e ’l magro un corpo, così questo nel suo volume cangerebbe carte
Translate: or, as a body distributes unequally fat and skinny, so the Moon would have mass difference within it

Original: Se ’l primo fosse, fora manifesto ne l’eclissi del sol, per trasparere lo lume come in altro raro ingesto
Translate: If the first hypothesis were true, this would be seen during the eclipses of the sun, because sunlight would shine as it does when it is entered into another diaphanous body.

Original: Questo non è
Translate: This doesn't happen.

Original: però è da vedere de l’altro
Translate: therefore the other hypothesis remains to be verified

Original: e s’elli avvien ch’io l’altro cassi, falsificato fia lo tuo parere
Translate: And if I refute that, then your opinion will prove false.

Original: S’elli è che questo raro non trapassi, esser conviene un termine da onde lo suo contrario più passar non lassi
Translate: If the Moon is rarefied, but not from side to side, there must be a point beyond which there is a solid mass.

Original: e indi l’altrui raggio si rifonde così come color torna per vetro lo qual di retro a sé piombo nasconde
Translate: and from there the ray of the sun is reflected just as the light is reflected by a mirror

Original: Or dirai tu ch’el si dimostra tetro ivi lo raggio più che in altre parti, per esser lì refratto più a retro
Translate: Now you will say that the ray in that rarefied spot is less luminous, for it is reflected deeper

Original: Da questa instanza può deliberarti esperïenza, se già mai la provi, ch’esser suol fonte ai rivi di vostr’ arti
Translate: From this objection can free you experience, if you wish to do so, which is the beginning of all your knowledge.

Original: Tre specchi prenderai
Translate: You'll take three mirrors

Original: e i due rimovi da te d’un modo, e l’altro, più rimosso, tr’ambo li primi li occhi tuoi ritrovi
Translate: And thou shalt put two at the same distance from thee, and the third farthest, and placed in the middle of the other two.

Original: Rivolto ad essi, fa che dopo il dosso ti stea un lume che i tre specchi accenda e torni a te da tutti ripercosso
Translate: Turned towards them, make sure that behind your shoulders there is a light that is reflected in the same way in the three mirrors and that you can see it in all three

Original: Ben che nel quanto tanto non si stenda la vista più lontana, lì vedrai come convien ch’igualmente risplenda
Translate: Though the farther mirror reflects the light with less dimension, you will see that in it the light shines with the identical brightness of the other two

Original: Or, come ai colpi de li caldi rai de la neve riman nudo il suggetto e dal colore e dal freddo primai,
Translate: Now, like the warm rays of the sun, the snow melts and turns into water, devoid of the color and cold of the snow itself,

Original: così rimaso te ne l’intelletto voglio informar di luce sì vivace, che ti tremolerà nel suo aspetto
Translate: So I want to give new shape to your intellect that is bare of error, illuminating you with a light so intense that in its appearance it will seem as trembling as that of a star

Original: Dentro dal ciel de la divina pace si gira un corpo ne la cui virtute l’esser di tutto suo contento giace
Translate: In the Heaven of divine peace another revolves in whose virtue lies the essence of all its contents

Original: Lo ciel seguente, c’ha tante vedute, quell’ esser parte per diverse essenze, da lui distratte e da lui contenute
Translate: The next Heaven, which has so many stars, divides that essence among all the stars, distinct from it and enclosed in it

Original: Li altri giron per varie differenze le distinzion che dentro da sé hanno dispongono a lor fini e lor semenze
Translate: The other heavens arrange the distinct virtues that they have in themselves in different ways, in order to pour on Earth their influences and desired ends

Original: Questi organi del mondo così vanno, come tu vedi omai, di grado in grado, che di sù prendono e di sotto fanno
Translate: These organs of the Universe proceed as you have understood Heaven in Heaven, so that they receive an influence from above and reverbrate it down

Original: Riguarda bene omai sì com’ io vado per questo loco al vero che disiri, sì che poi sappi sol tener lo guado
Translate: Take a good look at the way I proceed to the truth that you desire, so that you can come to the conclusion by yourself.

Original: Lo moto e la virtù d’i santi giri, come dal fabbro l’arte del martello, da’ beati motor convien che spiri
Translate: The movement and virtue of the heavenly wheels must proceed from angelic intelligences, as the art of the hammer derives from the blacksmith

Original: e ’l ciel cui tanti lumi fanno bello, de la mente profonda che lui volve prende l’image e fassene suggello
Translate: and Heaven adorned with so many stars takes the imprint of which is sealed by the deep mind that makes it rotate

Original: E come l’alma dentro a vostra polve per differenti membra e conformate a diverse potenze si risolve,
Translate: And as the human soul within your body carries out different powers through different and differently formed members,

Original: così l’intelligenza sua bontate multiplicata per le stelle spiega, girando sé sovra sua unitate
Translate: So the angelic intelligence unfolds its goodness multiplied by the various stars, rotating while remaining united

Original: Virtù diversa fa diversa lega col prezïoso corpo ch’ella avviva, nel qual, sì come vita in voi, si lega
Translate: The virtue so diverse is linked in a different way with the precious stellar body to which it gives life, in which it binds just like life in you

Original: Per la natura lieta onde deriva, la virtù mista per lo corpo luce come letizia per pupilla viva
Translate: Since the virtue interpenerated in the star derives from a joyful nature, it shines in the starry body as joy shines in the pupil of the eye

Original: Da essa vien ciò che da luce a luce par differente, non da denso e raro
Translate: From this comes the fact that the brightness of the stars is different, not from the different density

Original: essa è formal principio che produce, conforme a sua bontà, lo turbo e ’l chiaro»
Translate: It is the formal principle that produces, in accordance with its goodness, opacity and lightness.

Original: Quel sol che pria d’amor mi scaldò ’l petto, di bella verità m’avea scoverto, provando e riprovando, il dolce aspetto
Translate: That sun that warmed my breast of love had revealed to me the sweet aspect of truth with arguments for and against

Original: e io, per confessar corretto e certo me stesso, tanto quanto si convenne leva’ il capo a proferer più erto
Translate: and I, to confess that I had corrected my mistake and I was sure that I understood, raised my head as straight as needed to speak

Original: ma visione apparve che ritenne a sé me tanto stretto, per vedersi, che di mia confession non mi sovvenne
Translate: But there appeared to me a vision that drew my gaze to itself so closely, to look at it, that I did not remember my confession any more.

Original: Quali per vetri trasparenti e tersi, o ver per acque nitide e tranquille, non sì profonde che i fondi sien persi,
Translate: Just like through clear and clear glass, or through clear and undisturbed waters,

Original: tornan d’i nostri visi le postille debili sì, che perla in bianca fronte non vien men forte a le nostre pupille
Translate: The reflections of our faces return so evanescent that a pearl on a white forehead does not affect our eyes less weakly,

Original: tali vid’ io più facce a parlar pronte
Translate: So I saw more faces of blessed, ready to speak.

Original: per ch’io dentro a l’error contrario corsi a quel ch’accese amor tra l’omo e ’l fonte
Translate: Then I ran into the error opposite to that which kindled love between Narcissus and his image mirrored in the water.

Original: Sùbito sì com’ io di lor m’accorsi, quelle stimando specchiati sembianti, per veder di cui fosser, li occhi torsi
Translate: As soon as I noticed the spirits, feeling that they were reflected images, I turned back to see who they were.

Original: e nulla vidi, e ritorsili avanti dritti nel lume de la dolce guida, che, sorridendo, ardea ne li occhi santi
Translate: And I saw nothing, and looked again into the eyes of my gentle guide, which, smiling, was burning in his gaze full of holiness.

Original: «Non ti maravigliar perch’ io sorrida», mi disse,
Translate: "Don't be surprised if I smile at your childish thought," he said to me,

Original: «appresso il tuo püeril coto, poi sopra ’l vero ancor lo piè non fida, ma te rivolve, come suole, a vòto
Translate: since your intellect is not yet sure behind the truth, but it makes you spin empty as it usually happens in these cases

Original: vere sustanze son ciò che tu vedi, qui rilegate per manco di voto
Translate: What you see are real creatures, relegated here for failure to vow

Original: Però parla con esse e odi e credi
Translate: So talk to them and believe everything you hear

Original: ché la verace luce che le appaga da sé non lascia lor torcer li piedi»
Translate: In fact, the true light that makes them happy does not allow them to turn away from the truth.

Original: E io a l’ombra che parea più vaga di ragionar, drizza’mi, e cominciai, quasi com’ uom cui troppa voglia smaga
Translate: And I turned to the soul that seemed most eager to speak, and began, almost as a man weakened by excessive desire.

Original: «O ben creato spirito, che a’ rai di vita etterna la dolcezza senti che, non gustata, non s’intende mai,
Translate: "O well-born spirit, who in the rays of eternal life feels an incomprehensible sweetness if it is not tried,

Original: grazïoso mi fia se mi contenti del nome tuo e de la vostra sorte»
Translate: I will be pleased if you tell me your name and your condition.

Original: Ond’ ella, pronta e con occhi ridenti
Translate: Then she, ready and with smiling eyes

Original: «La nostra carità non serra porte a giusta voglia, se non come quella che vuol simile a sé tutta sua corte
Translate: "Our charity does not close the door to a just desire, just like that of God who wants all Paradise like himself."

Original: I’ fui nel mondo vergine sorella
Translate: In the world I was a nun

Original: e se la mente tua ben sé riguarda, non mi ti celerà l’esser più bella,
Translate: And if you think carefully, the fact that I'm more beautiful won't hide my identity from you,

Original: ma riconoscerai ch’i’ son Piccarda, che, posta qui con questi altri beati, beata sono in la spera più tarda
Translate: but you will recognize me as Piccarda Donati, who, placed here with these other blesseds, are in the slowest Heaven

Original: Li nostri affetti, che solo infiammati son nel piacer de lo Spirito Santo, letizian del suo ordine formati
Translate: Our feelings, which are inflamed only by the pleasure of the Holy Spirit, rejoice in adapting to his order

Original: E questa sorte che par giù cotanto, però n’è data, perché fuor negletti li nostri voti, e vòti in alcun canto»
Translate: And this condition of ours, which seems so low, was given to us because our vows were not fulfilled and neglected in some respects.

Original: Ond’ io a lei
Translate: Then I told her

Original: «Ne’ mirabili aspetti vostri risplende non so che divino che vi trasmuta da’ primi concetti
Translate: In your wonderful appearance something divine shines that makes you different from how you were alive

Original: però non fui a rimembrar festino
Translate: That is why I was not quick to remember

Original: ma or m’aiuta ciò che tu mi dici, sì che raffigurar m’è più latino
Translate: But now what you tell me helps me, so it's easier for me to picture your face.

Original: Ma dimmi
Translate: But tell me.

Original: voi che siete qui felici, disiderate voi più alto loco per più vedere e per più farvi amici?»
Translate: You who are here happy, want to be in a higher place to see God more closely and be in greater communion with Him?

Original: Con quelle altr’ ombre pria sorrise un poco
Translate: With the other souls he first smiled a little

Original: da indi mi rispuose tanto lieta, ch’arder parea d’amor nel primo foco
Translate: Then he answered me so glad that he seemed to burn in the love of the Holy Spirit

Original: «Frate, la nostra volontà quïeta virtù di carità, che fa volerne sol quel ch’avemo, e d’altro non ci asseta
Translate: Brother, the virtue of charity appeases our will, and induces us to want only what we have and does not make us want anything else

Original: Se disïassimo esser più superne, foran discordi li nostri disiri dal voler di colui che qui ne cerne
Translate: If we wished to be higher, our desires would differ from the will of the One who places us here.

Original: che vedrai non capere in questi giri, s’essere in carità è qui necesse, e se la sua natura ben rimiri
Translate: and you will see that this is not possible in these Heavens, if here it is necessary to be in charity and if you look well at the nature of charity itself

Original: Anzi è formale ad esto beato esse tenersi dentro a la divina voglia, per ch’una fansi nostre voglie stesse
Translate: Indeed, to our condition as blessed it is essential to conform to the divine will, so that all our desires become one

Original: sì che, come noi sem di soglia in soglia per questo regno, a tutto il regno piace com’ a lo re che ’n suo voler ne ’nvoglia
Translate: so that the whole kingdom likes the way we are disposed of from Heaven to Heaven, and it pleases the king who desires us to conform to his will.

Original: E ’n la sua volontade è nostra pace
Translate: And in his will is our peace

Original: ell’ è quel mare al qual tutto si move ciò ch’ella crïa o che natura face»
Translate: It is that sea towards which all that it creates or produces is moved.

Original: Chiaro mi fu allor come ogne dove in cielo è paradiso, etsi la grazia del sommo ben d’un modo non vi piove
Translate: Then it became clear to me that every point in Heaven is Paradise, even though the grace of the highest good is not irradiated in one way.

Original: Ma sì com’ elli avvien, s’un cibo sazia e d’un altro rimane ancor la gola,
Translate: But as happens when one full food and another still remains the desire,

Original: che quel si chere e di quel si ringrazia, così fec’ io con atto e con parola,
Translate: When you ask for this and thank yourself for that, so did I in the acts and words

Original: per apprender da lei qual fu la tela onde non trasse infino a co la spuola
Translate: to know from her which was the web from which he did not draw the shuttle to the end

Original: «Perfetta vita e alto merto inciela donna più sù», mi disse,
Translate: "A perfect life and a high merit place a woman in a higher Heaven," he said to me,

Original: «a la cui norma nel vostro mondo giù si veste e vela,
Translate: according to whose rule on Earth we dress and take the veil,

Original: perché fino al morir si vegghi e dorma con quello sposo ch’ogne voto accetta che caritate a suo piacer conforma
Translate: in order to watch and sleep until death with that bridegroom who accepts every vow that charity conforms to his will

Original: Dal mondo, per seguirla, giovinetta fuggi’mi, e nel suo abito mi chiusi e promisi la via de la sua setta
Translate: To follow her as a maiden, I fled from the world and clothed her dress, promising to follow the rule of her Order.

Original: Uomini poi, a mal più ch’a bene usi, fuor mi rapiron de la dolce chiostra
Translate: Afterward, men, more accustomed to evil than to good, kidnapped me out of the sweet convent.

Original: Iddio si sa qual poi mia vita fusi
Translate: God knows what my life was then

Original: E quest’ altro splendor che ti si mostra da la mia destra parte e che s’accende di tutto il lume de la spera nostra,
Translate: And this other splendor that appears to you to my right hand and that lights up of all the light of our Heaven,

Original: ciò ch’io dico di me, di sé intende
Translate: understand well what I say about myself

Original: sorella fu, e così le fu tolta di capo l’ombra de le sacre bende
Translate: she was a nun, and the veil from her head was taken away in the same way.

Original: Ma poi che pur al mondo fu rivolta contra suo grado e contra buona usanza, non fu dal vel del cor già mai disciolta
Translate: But after it came to the world against his will and against every good custom, yet it was never separated from the veil of the heart.

Original: Quest’ è la luce de la gran Costanza che del secondo vento di Soave generò ’l terzo e l’ultima possanza»
Translate: This is the soul of the great Constance of Altavilla, which from the second emperor of Swabia begat the third, who was also the last.

Original: Così parlommi, e poi cominciò ‘Ave, Maria’ cantando, e cantando vanio come per acqua cupa cosa grave
Translate: So he spoke to me, and then he began to sing "Hail Mary," and in this way he vanished like an object sinking into deep water.

Original: La vista mia, che tanto lei seguio quanto possibil fu, poi che la perse, volsesi al segno di maggior disio,
Translate: My gaze, which followed her as far as possible, after having lost sight of her, turned to the main object of her desire

Original: e a Beatrice tutta si converse
Translate: and fixed Beatrice

Original: ma quella folgorò nel mïo sguardo sì che da prima il viso non sofferse
Translate: But she shook my eyes so much that I couldn't stand the sight of her at first.

Original: e ciò mi fece a dimandar più tardo
Translate: And that made me more reluctant to ask.

Original: Intra due cibi, distanti e moventi d’un modo, prima si morria di fame, che liber’ omo l’un recasse ai denti
Translate: A man with free choice, placed between two foods at equal distance and equally attractive, would starve to death before eating one

Original: sì si starebbe un agno intra due brame di fieri lupi, igualmente temendo
Translate: so a lamb would stand between two wolves who want to devour him, equally fearing

Original: sì si starebbe un cane intra due dame
Translate: So it would be a dog between two deer

Original: per che, s’i’ mi tacea, me non riprendo, da li miei dubbi d’un modo sospinto, poi ch’era necessario, né commendo
Translate: so that, if I kept silent, I do not reproach or praise myself, for this was inevitable since I was driven by my doubts in the same way

Original: Io mi tacea, ma ’l mio disir dipinto m’era nel viso, e ’l dimandar con ello, più caldo assai che per parlar distinto
Translate: I kept silent, but my desire was painted on my face and along with it my question, even more evident than if I had not spoken

Original: Fé sì Beatrice qual fé Danïello, Nabuccodonosor levando d’ira, che l’avea fatto ingiustamente fello
Translate: Beatrice acted like Daniel when she appeased Nebuchadnezzar's anger, which had become unjustly cruel

Original: e disse
Translate: and said,

Original: «Io veggio ben come ti tira uno e altro disio, sì che tua cura sé stessa lega sì che fuor non spira
Translate: I see well how both desires attract you, so that your anxiety restrains itself and does not shine outside

Original: Tu argomenti
Translate: That's what you're saying.

Original: “Se ’l buon voler dura, la vïolenza altrui per qual ragione di meritar mi scema la misura?”
Translate: "If good will persists, why does the violence of others diminish for me the measure of well deserved?"

Original: Ancor di dubitar ti dà cagione parer tornarsi l’anime a le stelle, secondo la sentenza di Platone
Translate: It still gives you reason to doubt the fact that souls seem to return to the stars, according to Plato's opinion.

Original: Queste son le question che nel tuo velle pontano igualmente
Translate: These are the questions that are equally pressing your will

Original: e però pria tratterò quella che più ha di felle
Translate: so I will first treat the one that is most dangerous on the doctrinal plane

Original: D’i Serafin colui che più s’india, Moïsè, Samuel, e quel Giovanni che prender vuoli, io dico, non Maria,
Translate: That Seraphim who is closest to God, Moses, Samuel, John the Baptist or Evangelist, even Mary,

Original: non hanno in altro cielo i loro scanni che questi spirti che mo t’appariro, né hanno a l’esser lor più o meno anni
Translate: have their seat in the same Heaven as these spirits that have just appeared to you, nor does their stay there have a longer or shorter duration

Original: ma tutti fanno bello il primo giro, e differentemente han dolce vita per sentir più e men l’etterno spiro
Translate: but all of them adorn the highest Heaven, and have a different degree of happiness depending on whether they feel more or less the Holy Spirit

Original: Qui si mostraro, non perché sortita sia questa spera lor, ma per far segno de la celestïal c’ha men salita
Translate: They have appeared to you here in Heaven, not because it is assigned to them as a seat, but to manifest visibly their least degree of bliss.

Original: Così parlar conviensi al vostro ingegno, però che solo da sensato apprende ciò che fa poscia d’intelletto degno
Translate: It is necessary to speak thus to your ingenuity, for it learns only through the senses what then becomes the object of intellectual knowledge.

Original: Per questo la Scrittura condescende a vostra facultate, e piedi e mano attribuisce a Dio e altro intende
Translate: That is why Scripture adapts itself to your faculties and attributes physical traits to God, meaning other things.

Original: e Santa Chiesa con aspetto umano Gabrïel e Michel vi rappresenta, e l’altro che Tobia rifece sano
Translate: and the Holy Church depicts with human appearance the archangels Gabriel and Michael, and the other that healed Tobias

Original: Quel che Timeo de l’anime argomenta non è simile a ciò che qui si vede, però che, come dice, par che senta
Translate: What platonic dialogue Timeo says about souls is different from what you see here, since it seems that the philosopher understands exactly what he says.

Original: Dice che l’alma a la sua stella riede, credendo quella quindi esser decisa quando natura per forma la diede
Translate: Plato affirms that the soul returns after death to its star, for he believes that it is detached from it when nature gave it a substantial form

Original: e forse sua sentenza è d’altra guisa che la voce non suona, ed esser puote con intenzion da non esser derisa
Translate: But perhaps his opinion is different from the literal sense, and in that case it is not worthy to be mocked.

Original: S’elli intende tornare a queste ruote l’onor de la influenza e ’l biasmo, forse in alcun vero suo arco percuote
Translate: If Plato wants to attribute to these celestial spheres the merit and reproach of the astral influence, perhaps he is not far from the truth

Original: Questo principio, male inteso, torse già tutto il mondo quasi, sì che Giove, Mercurio e Marte a nominar trascorse
Translate: This doctrine, misinterpreted, led to error almost all peoples, so that they identified with the planets Jupiter, Mercury, Mars

Original: L’altra dubitazion che ti commove ha men velen, però che sua malizia non ti poria menar da me altrove
Translate: The other doubt that torments you is less dangerous, for his malice could not turn you away from me

Original: Parere ingiusta la nostra giustizia ne li occhi d’i mortali, è argomento di fede e non d’eretica nequizia
Translate: The fact that divine justice may seem unrighteous in the eyes of men is a matter of faith and not of heresy

Original: Ma perché puote vostro accorgimento ben penetrare a questa veritate, come disiri, ti farò contento
Translate: But because your intellect can well interpret this truth, I will please you as you desire.

Original: Se vïolenza è quando quel che pate nïente conferisce a quel che sforza, non fuor quest’ alme per essa scusate
Translate: If violence exists when he who suffers it does not go along with the one who accomplishes it, then these souls were not excused for it.

Original: ché volontà, se non vuol, non s’ammorza, ma fa come natura face in foco, se mille volte vïolenza il torza
Translate: For the will, if it will not, does not fail, but does as the fire that tends by nature to rise, even if a thousand times the violence pushes it down

Original: Per che, s’ella si piega assai o poco, segue la forza
Translate: In fact, if the will bends little or much, it goes along with violence.

Original: e così queste fero possendo rifuggir nel santo loco
Translate: and so did these souls, since they could return to their convent.

Original: Se fosse stato lor volere intero, come tenne Lorenzo in su la grada, e fece Muzio a la sua man severo,
Translate: If their will had been intact, like that which St. Lawrence held on the grating and that which led Mucio Scevola to be severe with his hand,

Original: così l’avria ripinte per la strada ond’ eran tratte, come fuoro sciolte
Translate: It would bring them back to the road from which they had been taken, as soon as they were freed from physical impediment.

Original: ma così salda voglia è troppo rada
Translate: but such a supreme will is too rare

Original: E per queste parole, se ricolte l’hai come dei, è l’argomento casso che t’avria fatto noia ancor più volte
Translate: And thanks to these words of mine, if you listened to them properly, it is refuted the argument that would hurt you other times

Original: Ma or ti s’attraversa un altro passo dinanzi a li occhi, tal che per te stesso non usciresti
Translate: But now you have a new question, so you couldn't solve it yourself.

Original: pria saresti lasso
Translate: You'd have won before.

Original: Io t’ho per certo ne la mente messo ch’alma beata non poria mentire, però ch’è sempre al primo vero appresso
Translate: I have told you with certainty that the blessed soul cannot lie, for it is always in communion with the divine truth.

Original: e poi potesti da Piccarda udire che l’affezion del vel Costanza tenne
Translate: And then you heard from Piccarda that Constance remained faithful in the heart to the monastic rule,

Original: sì ch’ella par qui meco contradire
Translate: so that it seems to contradict me

Original: Molte fïate già, frate, addivenne che, per fuggir periglio, contra grato si fé di quel che far non si convenne
Translate: Many times, brother, it has happened that, in order to escape a danger, he did not want to do what was not necessary to do

Original: come Almeone, che, di ciò pregato dal padre suo, la propria madre spense, per non perder pietà si fé spietato
Translate: As Alcmeon, who, by his father's prayer, killed his mother, and showed himself devoted, became merciless.

Original: A questo punto voglio che tu pense che la forza al voler si mischia, e fanno sì che scusar non si posson l’offense
Translate: In this regard, I want you to think that violence is mixed with will, and this means that the offences committed cannot be justified.

Original: Voglia assoluta non consente al danno
Translate: Absolute will does not consent to harm

Original: ma consentevi in tanto in quanto teme, se si ritrae, cadere in più affanno
Translate: But he consents to you in so far as he fears that he will suffer greater harm, if he withdraws.

Original: Però, quando Piccarda quello spreme, de la voglia assoluta intende, e io de l’altra
Translate: Therefore, when Piccarda expresses that concept, he speaks of the absolute will, while I speak of the relative will.

Original: sì che ver diciamo insieme»
Translate: So let's both say a real thing.

Original: Cotal fu l’ondeggiar del santo rio ch’uscì del fonte ond’ ogne ver deriva
Translate: This was the abundant and flowing flow of the holy river that flowed from the source from which all truth comes.

Original: tal puose in pace uno e altro disio
Translate: it solved both my doubts

Original: «O amanza del primo amante, o diva», diss’ io appresso,
Translate: "O beloved of the first lover, or divine woman," I said later,

Original: «il cui parlar m’inonda e scalda sì, che più e più m’avviva, non è l’affezion mia tanto profonda, che basti a render voi grazia per grazia
Translate: whose words flood me and warm me to the point that they revive me more and more, my feeling is not intense enough to be able to thank you enough

Original: ma quei che vede e puote a ciò risponda
Translate: He who sees everything and can do it for me

Original: Io veggio ben che già mai non si sazia nostro intelletto, se ’l ver non lo illustra di fuor dal qual nessun vero si spazia
Translate: I see that our intellect is never satisfied, unless it is enlightened by that truth beyond which no other truth can stand.

Original: Posasi in esso, come fera in lustra, tosto che giunto l’ha
Translate: It rests in that truth, as a beast in its den, as soon as it has reached it.

Original: e giugner puollo
Translate: and can reach it,

Original: se non, ciascun disio sarebbe frustra
Translate: otherwise every desire would fall into vain

Original: Nasce per quello, a guisa di rampollo, a piè del vero il dubbio
Translate: For this desire for knowledge at the feet of truth is born doubt, like a sprout

Original: ed è natura ch’al sommo pinge noi di collo in collo
Translate: and nature pushes us from high to high

Original: Questo m’invita, questo m’assicura con reverenza, donna, a dimandarvi d’un’altra verità che m’è oscura
Translate: This makes me sure and impels me to ask you with reverence, woman, of another truth that is not clear to me

Original: Io vo’ saper se l’uom può sodisfarvi ai voti manchi sì con altri beni, ch’a la vostra statera non sien parvi»
Translate: I want to know if man can compensate for the vows lacking with other works of good, such that your scales are not ridiculous.

Original: Beatrice mi guardò con li occhi pieni di faville d’amor così divini, che, vinta, mia virtute diè le reni,
Translate: Beatrice looked at me with her eyes full of sparks of love so alive that my visual virtue, won, failed.

Original: e quasi mi perdei con li occhi chini
Translate: And I almost got lost with my eyes low

Original: «S’io ti fiammeggio nel caldo d’amore di là dal modo che ’n terra si vede, sì che del viso tuo vinco il valore,
Translate: If I am dazzling you with the light of my love beyond the usual way on Earth, so that I overcome your visual power,

Original: non ti maravigliar,
Translate: Don't be surprised.

Original: ché ciò procede da perfetto veder, che, come apprende, così nel bene appreso move il piede
Translate: in fact, this happens for my perfect vision of God, that the more he perceives the divine light, the more he penetrates into the perceived good

Original: Io veggio ben sì come già resplende ne l’intelletto tuo l’etterna luce, che, vista, sola e sempre amore accende
Translate: I see well how the eternal light of God shines in your intellect, which is the only one to light the desire of self as soon as it is seen.

Original: e s’altra cosa vostro amor seduce, non è se non di quella alcun vestigio, mal conosciuto, che quivi traluce
Translate: and if anything else earthly attracts your love, it is only some trace of that light that shines through it and is poorly known

Original: Tu vuo’ saper se con altro servigio, per manco voto, si può render tanto che l’anima sicuri di letigio»
Translate: You want to know if you can reciprocate a failed vow with another good work, that much enough to avoid to the soul a controversy with God.

Original: Sì cominciò Beatrice questo canto
Translate: So Beatrice began this song

Original: e sì com’ uom che suo parlar non spezza, continüò così ’l processo santo
Translate: and just as the man who did not interrupt his speech continued his reasoning full of holiness

Original: «Lo maggior don che Dio per sua larghezza fesse creando, e a la sua bontate più conformato,
Translate: "The greatest gift that God, by his generosity, made by creating man, and the one more in keeping with his goodness,

Original: e quel ch’e’ più apprezza, fu de la volontà la libertate
Translate: and what He most appreciates was the free will

Original: di che le creature intelligenti, e tutte e sole, fuoro e son dotate
Translate: of it all the intelligent creatures, and only them, are endowed

Original: Or ti parrà, se tu quinci argomenti, l’alto valor del voto, s’è sì fatto che Dio consenta quando tu consenti
Translate: Now, if you reflect on this, you will understand the high value of the vow, provided it is done in such a way that it is acceptable to God and has the consent of the one who pronounces it.

Original: ché, nel fermar tra Dio e l’omo il patto, vittima fassi di questo tesoro, tal quale io dico
Translate: For when man and God sign the covenant, there is a sacrifice of this treasure of which I speak,

Original: e fassi col suo atto
Translate: and it is done in a completely voluntary way

Original: Dunque che render puossi per ristoro? Se credi bene usar quel c’hai offerto, di maltolletto vuo’ far buon lavoro
Translate: So, what could be given in exchange for it? If you wanted to use what you offered, it's as if you wanted to do a good work with the proceeds of a theft

Original: Tu se’ omai del maggior punto certo
Translate: You're certain about the main point.

Original: ma perché Santa Chiesa in ciò dispensa, che par contra lo ver ch’i’ t’ho scoverto,
Translate: but since the Holy Church sometimes dispenses from vows, which seems to contradict what I have just told you,

Original: convienti ancor sedere un poco a mensa,
Translate: It's okay for you to sit down at the cafeteria a little longer,

Original: però che ’l cibo rigido c’hai preso, richiede ancora aiuto a tua dispensa
Translate: for you must be helped to digest the heavy food you have ingested

Original: Apri la mente a quel ch’io ti paleso e fermalvi entro
Translate: Open your mind to what I explain and fix it in your memory

Original: ché non fa scïenza, sanza lo ritenere, avere inteso
Translate: For hearing does not produce knowledge, unless one remembers.

Original: Due cose si convegnono a l’essenza di questo sacrificio
Translate: Two things form the essence of this sacrifice

Original: l’una è quella di che si fa
Translate: One is the thing that is offered,

Original: l’altr’ è la convenenza
Translate: the other is convenience

Original: Quest’ ultima già mai non si cancella se non servata
Translate: The latter can never be deleted if it is not respected

Original: e intorno di lei sì preciso di sopra si favella
Translate: And I have already spoken to you about this precisely just now.

Original: però necessitato fu a li Ebrei pur l’offerere, ancor ch’alcuna offerta sì permutasse, come saver dei
Translate: For this reason the Hebrews were commanded to make offerings, even though some offerings were changed.

Original: L’altra, che per materia t’è aperta, puote ben esser tal, che non si falla se con altra materia si converta
Translate: The other thing, which I explained to you is the matter of voting, can however be exchanged for something else without committing sin.

Original: Ma non trasmuti carco a la sua spalla per suo arbitrio alcun, sanza la volta e de la chiave bianca e de la gialla
Translate: But no one dares change the load on his shoulders at his whim, without the approval of ecclesiastical authority

Original: e ogne permutanza credi stolta, se la cosa dimessa in la sorpresa come ’l quattro nel sei non è raccolta
Translate: and judge wrong every permutation in which the thing left is not contained in that exchanged as the four is contained in the six

Original: Però qualunque cosa tanto pesa per suo valor che tragga ogne bilancia, sodisfar non si può con altra spesa
Translate: Therefore, whatever is so precious as to have no term of comparison, it cannot be exchanged for anything else.

Original: Non prendan li mortali il voto a ciancia
Translate: Men don't take the vow lightly

Original: siate fedeli, e a ciò far non bieci, come Ieptè a la sua prima mancia
Translate: Be faithful, and be not reckless, as Jephthah was in his first offering,

Original: cui più si convenia dicer ‘Mal feci’, che, servando, far peggio
Translate: to which it would have been better to say 'I was wrong', rather than to do worse by observing the vote

Original: e così stolto ritrovar puoi il gran duca de’ Greci, onde pianse Efigènia il suo bel volto, e fé pianger di sé i folli e i savi ch’udir parlar di così fatto cólto
Translate: And the captain of the Greeks was also foolish, so his daughter Iphigenia mourned her beauty, and made the mad and the healthy to weep for themselves, who heard of such a cult.

Original: Siate, Cristiani, a muovervi più gravi
Translate: O Christians, be more cautious in making vows

Original: non siate come penna ad ogne vento, e non crediate ch’ogne acqua vi lavi
Translate: Don't be feathers that move in every wind, and don't believe that all water can wash you.

Original: Avete il novo e ’l vecchio Testamento, e ’l pastor de la Chiesa che vi guida
Translate: You have the New and Old Testament and the pastor of the Church who guides you

Original: questo vi basti a vostro salvamento
Translate: This is enough for you to lead you to salvation.

Original: Se mala cupidigia altro vi grida, uomini siate, e non pecore matte, sì che ’l Giudeo di voi tra voi non rida
Translate: If an evil desire tells you anything else, be men and not sheep mad, so that the Jew who lives among you does not laugh at your behavior.

Original: Non fate com’ agnel che lascia il latte de la sua madre, e semplice e lascivo seco medesmo a suo piacer combatte»
Translate: Do not act like a lamb that leaves the mother's milk and, simple and restless, fights alone to her detriment.

Original: Così Beatrice a me com’ ïo scrivo
Translate: So Beatrice told me how I write about it.

Original: poi si rivolse tutta disïante a quella parte ove ’l mondo è più vivo
Translate: Then he turned, full of desire, to that part where the world is brighter.

Original: Lo suo tacere e ’l trasmutar sembiante puoser silenzio al mio cupido ingegno, che già nuove questioni avea davante
Translate: His silence and the fact that he changed his appearance silenced my greedy ingenuity, which already proposed new questions

Original: e sì come saetta che nel segno percuote pria che sia la corda queta, così corremmo nel secondo regno
Translate: and as quick as an arrow that hits the target before the bow cord stops vibrate, so we ascended to Heaven II

Original: Quivi la donna mia vid’ io sì lieta, come nel lume di quel ciel si mise, che più lucente se ne fé ’l pianeta
Translate: Here I saw my woman so happy, as soon as she entered the star of Heaven, that the planet itself became brighter.

Original: E se la stella si cambiò e rise, qual mi fec’ io che pur da mia natura trasmutabile son per tutte guise
Translate: And if the star turned and laughed, let alone how I could do that, by my mortal nature, I am subject to every kind of change.

Original: Come ’n peschiera ch’è tranquilla e pura traggonsi i pesci a ciò che vien di fori per modo che lo stimin lor pastura,
Translate: As in a calm and clear fish pond, the fish approach the hair of the water, believing that what comes from the outside is their food,

Original: sì vid’ io ben più di mille splendori trarsi ver’ noi, e in ciascun s’udia
Translate: So I saw more than a thousand lights coming to us, and within each one was heard.

Original: «Ecco chi crescerà li nostri amori»
Translate: This is who will increase our ardour of charity.

Original: E sì come ciascuno a noi venìa, vedeasi l’ombra piena di letizia nel folgór chiaro che di lei uscia
Translate: And as soon as every light came to us, one could see the shadow full of joy wrapped in the clear splendor that came out of it.

Original: Pensa, lettor, se quel che qui s’inizia non procedesse, come tu avresti di più savere angosciosa carizia
Translate: If what I began to describe did not go forward, think, or reader, as you would be spiritually miserable, longing with anguish to know more

Original: e per te vederai come da questi m’era in disio d’udir lor condizioni, sì come a li occhi mi fur manifesti
Translate: and you will understand for yourself how I wished to know about their condition, as soon as they appeared in my eyes.

Original: «O bene nato a cui veder li troni del trïunfo etternal concede grazia prima che la milizia s’abbandoni,
Translate: "O lucky spirit, to whom divine grace grants to see the seats of eternal triumph before abandoning the earthly militia,"

Original: del lume che per tutto il ciel si spazia noi semo accesi
Translate: We are bright of the light that spreads throughout the sky

Original: e però, se disii di noi chiarirti, a tuo piacer ti sazia»
Translate: Therefore, if you wish to have some clarification about us, ask without hesitation.

Original: Così da un di quelli spirti pii detto mi fu
Translate: So I was told by one of those holy spirits

Original: e da Beatrice
Translate: and Beatrice added

Original: «Dì, dì sicuramente, e credi come a dii»
Translate: Speak, speak fearlessly, and believe as to God.

Original: «Io veggio ben sì come tu t’annidi nel proprio lume, e che de li occhi il traggi, perch’ e’ corusca sì come tu ridi
Translate: "I see well how you hide in your own light, and that it is born from your gaze, because it becomes more intense when you smile

Original: ma non so chi tu se’, né perché aggi, anima degna, il grado de la spera che si vela a’ mortai con altrui raggi»
Translate: But I do not know who you are, nor why you occupy, worthy soul, the rank of Heaven which is veiled to men by the rays of the Sun.

Original: Questo diss’ io diritto a la lumera che pria m’avea parlato
Translate: I said this to the light that he had spoken to me before.

Original: ond’ ella fessi lucente più assai di quel ch’ell’ era
Translate: so that it became much brighter than it was before

Original: Sì come il sol che si cela elli stessi per troppa luce, come ’l caldo ha róse le temperanze d’i vapori spessi,
Translate: Like the Sun hiding from sight for too much light, as the heat has pink temperatures with thick vapors,

Original: per più letizia sì mi si nascose dentro al suo raggio la figura santa
Translate: So the holy figure of the blessed came to my eyes because of the increased gladness

Original: e così chiusa chiusa mi rispuose nel modo che ’l seguente canto canta
Translate: And so, wrapped in light, he answered me in the manner that is described by the following Song.

Original: «Poscia che Costantin l’aquila volse contr’ al corso del ciel, ch’ella seguio dietro a l’antico che Lavina tolse,
Translate: After Constantine brought the imperial eagle against the course of heaven, which she followed behind Aeneas who took to marry Lavinia,

Original: cento e cent’ anni e più l’uccel di Dio ne lo stremo d’Europa si ritenne, vicino a’ monti de’ quai prima uscìo
Translate: the divine bird remained more than two hundred years in the extremity of Europe, near the mountains of the Troad from which began its flight

Original: e sotto l’ombra de le sacre penne governò ’l mondo lì di mano in mano, e, sì cangiando, in su la mia pervenne
Translate: And there he ruled the world in the shadow of the holy feathers, passing from hand to hand, until he came into mine.

Original: Cesare fui e son Iustinïano,
Translate: I was a Roman emperor and my name is Justinian

Original: che, per voler del primo amor ch’i’ sento, d’entro le leggi trassi il troppo e ’l vano
Translate: I am the one who, inspired by the Holy Spirit, removed from the laws what was superfluous and what was useless.

Original: E prima ch’io a l’ovra fossi attento, una natura in Cristo esser, non più e, credea, e di tal fede era contento
Translate: And before I dedicated myself to this work, I believed that in Christ there was the only divine nature, and I was happy with this faith.

Original: ma ’l benedetto Agapito, che fue sommo pastore, a la fede sincera mi dirizzò con le parole sue
Translate: But the blessed Agapite, who was high pontiff, directed me to the true faith with his words

Original: Io li credetti
Translate: I believed him

Original: e ciò che ’n sua fede era, vegg’ io or chiaro sì, come tu vedi ogni contradizione e falsa e vera
Translate: and now I see what was in his faith so clearly, as you see that in a contradictory judgment there is a true sentence and a false one

Original: Tosto che con la Chiesa mossi i piedi, a Dio per grazia piacque di spirarmi l’alto lavoro, e tutto ’n lui mi diedi
Translate: As soon as I returned to the Church, God wanted by his grace to inspire me in the high work and I dedicated my soul and body to it.

Original: e al mio Belisar commendai l’armi, cui la destra del ciel fu sì congiunta, che segno fu ch’i’ dovessi posarmi
Translate: And I gave my weapons to my General Belisario, who was seen by heaven to the extent that this was a sign that I should stop.

Original: Or qui a la question prima s’appunta la mia risposta
Translate: Now here ends my first answer

Original: ma sua condizione mi stringe a seguitare alcuna giunta,
Translate: But what I said makes me follow an addition,

Original: perché tu veggi con quanta ragione si move contr’ al sacrosanto segno e chi ’l s’appropria e chi a lui s’oppone
Translate: that you may see how unjustly they act against the sacred symbol of the eagle, both those who take possession of it, and those who oppose it.

Original: Vedi quanta virtù l’ha fatto degno di reverenza
Translate: See how much virtue has made the sign worthy of reverence

Original: e cominciò da l’ora che Pallante morì per darli regno
Translate: And it began from the day that Pallas died to secure him a kingdom.

Original: Tu sai ch’el fece in Alba sua dimora per trecento anni e oltre, infino al fine che i tre a’ tre pugnar per lui ancora
Translate: Thou knowest that it dwelt more than three hundred years in Alba Longa, until the time when Orazi and Curiazi fought for him again.

Original: E sai ch’el fé dal mal de le Sabine al dolor di Lucrezia in sette regi, vincendo intorno le genti vicine
Translate: And thou knowest what he did from the Sabine rat unto the reproach of Lucreziah, at the time of the seven kings of Rome, conquering the surrounding peoples.

Original: Sai quel ch’el fé portato da li egregi Romani incontro a Brenno, incontro a Pirro, incontro a li altri principi e collegi
Translate: You know what he did, brought by the noble Romans against Brenno and Pirro, and against other republics and monarchs of Italy

Original: onde Torquato e Quinzio, che dal cirro negletto fu nomato, i Deci e ’ Fabi ebber la fama che volontier mirro
Translate: So Torquatus and Quinzio Cincinnato, who was said so for the neglected hair, and Deci and Fabi had the fame that I gladly honor

Original: Esso atterrò l’orgoglio de li Aràbi che di retro ad Anibale passaro l’alpestre rocce, Po, di che tu labi
Translate: It brought down the pride of the Carthaginians who passed through the Alps after Hannibal, from whom you, O river Po, descend.

Original: Sott’ esso giovanetti trïunfaro Scipïone e Pompeo
Translate: Scipio and Pompey triumphed under it when they were young

Original: e a quel colle sotto ’l qual tu nascesti parve amaro
Translate: And seemed bitter to that hill under which thou wast born.

Original: Poi, presso al tempo che tutto ’l ciel volle redur lo mondo a suo modo sereno, Cesare per voler di Roma il tolle
Translate: Then, when the time was near when Heaven wanted to make the whole world become serene in its image, Caesar took the sign of the eagle at the will of Rome

Original: E quel che fé da Varo infino a Reno, Isara vide ed Era e vide Senna e ogne valle onde Rodano è pieno
Translate: And what it did from the river Varus unto the Rhine, the Isère, and the Loire, and the Seine, and every valley of which the Rhone is full, saw.

Original: Quel che fé poi ch’elli uscì di Ravenna e saltò Rubicon, fu di tal volo, che nol seguiteria lingua né penna
Translate: What he did after leaving Ravenna and passing the Rubicon was such a fast flight that neither the tongue nor the pen could describe it.

Original: Inver’ la Spagna rivolse lo stuolo, poi ver’ Durazzo, e Farsalia percosse sì ch’al Nil caldo si sentì del duolo
Translate: He turned his troops against Spain and then to Durazzo, and struck Farsàlo to the point that the pain came to the heat Nile

Original: Antandro e Simeonta, onde si mosse, rivide e là dov’ Ettore si cuba
Translate: The eagle saw again the port of Antandro and the river Simoenta from which it moved, and the tomb of Hector

Original: e mal per Tolomeo poscia si scosse
Translate: And he departed for Egypt, with evil consequences for Ptolemy.

Original: Da indi scese folgorando a Iuba
Translate: From there he went down like a lightning strike against Juba,

Original: onde si volse nel vostro occidente, ove sentia la pompeana tuba
Translate: Then he went to the West of your world, where he heard the trumpet of the Pompeians.

Original: Di quel che fé col baiulo seguente, Bruto con Cassio ne l’inferno latra, e Modena e Perugia fu dolente
Translate: Of what it did with the successor of Caesar , Brutus and Cassius still latranus in Hell and Modena and Perugia were sore about it

Original: Piangene ancor la trista Cleopatra, che, fuggendoli innanzi, dal colubro la morte prese subitana e atra
Translate: The sad Cleopatra still weeps, who, fleeing before him, gave himself sudden and heinous death with the serpent.

Original: Con costui corse infino al lito rubro
Translate: With Ottaviano the eagle ran to the Red Sea

Original: con costui puose il mondo in tanta pace, che fu serrato a Giano il suo delubro
Translate: He brought the world into peace with him, to the point that the temple of Janus was closed.

Original: Ma ciò che ’l segno che parlar mi face fatto avea prima e poi era fatturo per lo regno mortal ch’a lui soggiace,
Translate: But what the sign of which I speak had done before and would have done after for the mortal kingdom that is submissive to him,

Original: diventa in apparenza poco e scuro, se in mano al terzo Cesare si mira con occhio chiaro e con affetto puro
Translate: It becomes little in appearance if you compare it to what you did with the third emperor, if you look with clarity and sincerity

Original: ché la viva giustizia che mi spira, li concedette, in mano a quel ch’i’ dico, gloria di far vendetta a la sua ira
Translate: For the divine righteousness which inspired me gave him, in the hand of Tiberius, the glory of punishing original sin.

Original: Or qui t’ammira in ciò ch’io ti replìco
Translate: Now take admiration for what I add

Original: poscia con Tito a far vendetta corse de la vendetta del peccato antico
Translate: Then with Titus he ran to avenge the vengeance of ancient sin.

Original: E quando il dente longobardo morse la Santa Chiesa, sotto le sue ali Carlo Magno, vincendo, la soccorse
Translate: And when the violence of the Longobards turned against the Holy Church, Charlemagne rescued her under the wings of the eagle, defeating that people

Original: Omai puoi giudicar di quei cotali ch’io accusai di sopra e di lor falli, che son cagion di tutti vostri mali
Translate: You can now judge the conduct of those whom I have accused before and their sins, who are the cause of all your evils.

Translate: One opposes the imperial symbol the yellow lilies of the house of France, and the other appropriates for their political part, so that it is difficult to determine who is wrong the most

Original: Faccian li Ghibellin, faccian lor arte sott’ altro segno, ché mal segue quello sempre chi la giustizia e lui diparte
Translate: The Ghibellines make their policy under another symbol, for whoever always separates it from justice makes a bad use of it

Original: e non l’abbatta esto Carlo novello coi Guelfi suoi, ma tema de li artigli ch’a più alto leon trasser lo vello
Translate: And believe not to bring him down with his Guelphs Charles II of Anjou, but to fear his claws, which skinned lions fiercer than he.

Original: Molte fïate già pianser li figli per la colpa del padre, e non si creda che Dio trasmuti l’armi per suoi gigli
Translate: Many times the children have already paid for the sins of the fathers, and therefore do not believe Charles that God changes his symbol with his lilies

Original: Questa picciola stella si correda d’i buoni spirti che son stati attivi perché onore e fama li succeda
Translate: This small planet welcomes the good spirits who have been active in the search for honor and fame

Original: e quando li disiri poggian quivi, sì disvïando, pur convien che i raggi del vero amore in sù poggin men vivi
Translate: and when the desires are turned to this, thus deviating from their end, it is inevitable that love is less directed toward God

Original: Ma nel commensurar d’i nostri gaggi col merto è parte di nostra letizia, perché non li vedem minor né maggi
Translate: However, if we compare our rewards with our merit, this brings us joy, for we see them neither lesser nor greater.

Original: Quindi addolcisce la viva giustizia in noi l’affetto sì, che non si puote torcer già mai ad alcuna nequizia
Translate: In this way divine justice softens our feeling, so that it can never be turned to an evil thought

Original: Diverse voci fanno dolci note
Translate: Several voices produce sweet melodies

Original: così diversi scanni in nostra vita rendon dolce armonia tra queste rote
Translate: so the different degrees of our bliss make a sweet harmony in these Heavens

Original: E dentro a la presente margarita luce la luce di Romeo, di cui fu l’ovra grande e bella mal gradita
Translate: And inside this star shines the light of Romeo of Villanova, whose beautiful and great work was not appreciated

Original: Ma i Provenzai che fecer contra lui non hanno riso
Translate: But the Provencals, who acted against him, did not laugh.

Original: e però mal cammina qual si fa danno del ben fare altrui
Translate: And so he walks a bad way, who is envious, and considers the good deeds of others to be his own harm.

Original: Quattro figlie ebbe, e ciascuna reina, Ramondo Beringhiere, e ciò li fece Romeo, persona umìle e peregrina
Translate: Raimond Berengario had four daughters, each king's wife, and this was the result of the work of Romeo, a humble and foreign person.

Original: E poi il mosser le parole biece a dimandar ragione a questo giusto,
Translate: And then the envious words of the courtiers led him to take account of the work of that righteous man,

Original: che li assegnò sette e cinque per diece, indi partissi povero e vetusto
Translate: who had increased the state rents, so that Romeo went away poor and old.

Original: e se ’l mondo sapesse il cor ch’elli ebbe mendicando sua vita a frusto a frusto, assai lo loda, e più lo loderebbe»
Translate: And if the world knew how dignified it was to beg bread, it would praise it even more than it already does.

Original: «Osanna, sanctus Deus sabaòth, superillustrans claritate tua felices ignes horum malacòth»
Translate: Hosanna, holy God of hosts, may the blessed fires of these kingdoms shine from above with your light.

Original: Così, volgendosi a la nota sua, fu viso a me cantare essa sustanza, sopra la qual doppio lume s’addua
Translate: So, dancing to the rhythm of his song, it seemed to me that he sang that soul, in which a double light shines

Original: ed essa e l’altre mossero a sua danza, e quasi velocissime faville mi si velar di sùbita distanza
Translate: It and the others moved to the rhythm of that dance, and as very rapid sparks disappeared from my sight by the distance

Original: Io dubitava e dicea ‘Dille, dille’ fra me,
Translate: I was in doubt, and I was like, "Speak, speak.

Original: ‘dille’ dicea, ‘a la mia donna che mi diseta con le dolci stille’
Translate: "Speak," he said, "to my woman, who quenches my thirst with the sweet drops of her knowledge."

Original: Ma quella reverenza che s’indonna di tutto me, pur per Be e per ice, mi richinava come l’uom ch’assonna
Translate: But that reverence that took over all of me, at only hearing the syllables 'Well' and 'ice', made me bow my head like the one who is taken from sleep

Original: Poco sofferse me cotal Beatrice e cominciò, raggiandomi d’un riso tal, che nel foco faria l’uom felice
Translate: Beatrice soon tolerated that I was in that state and began to speak, illuminating me with such a smile that it would make a man happy in the flames

Original: «Secondo mio infallibile avviso, come giusta vendetta giustamente punita fosse, t’ha in pensier miso
Translate: According to my infallible judgment, you have doubts as to how it is possible that just vengeance has rightly been punished.

Original: ma io ti solverò tosto la mente
Translate: But I'm gonna figure this out soon.

Original: e tu ascolta, ché le mie parole di gran sentenza ti faran presente
Translate: And thou hearest, for my words shall give thee a great truth.

Original: Per non soffrire a la virtù che vole freno a suo prode, quell’ uom che non nacque, dannando sé, dannò tutta sua prole
Translate: The man who was not born, for not having endured to his will a restraint to his advantage, condemning himself condemned the whole human line.

Original: onde l’umana specie inferma giacque giù per secoli molti in grande errore,
Translate: so that humanity lay on Earth for many centuries in a grave error,

Original: fin ch’al Verbo di Dio discender piacque u’ la natura, che dal suo fattore s’era allungata,
Translate: until the Son of God liked to go down where he joined human nature, who had turned away from his Creator,

Original: unì a sé in persona con l’atto sol del suo etterno amore
Translate: in one person, with the one act of the Holy Spirit

Original: Or drizza il viso a quel ch’or si ragiona
Translate: Now pay attention to what I'm about to say.

Original: questa natura al suo fattore unita, qual fu creata, fu sincera e buona
Translate: this human nature, together with its Creator, was pure and free from sin as it had been created

Original: ma per sé stessa pur fu ella sbandita di paradiso, però che si torse da via di verità e da sua vita
Translate: But for herself she was cast out of Eden, for she departed with original sin from the way of truth.

Original: La pena dunque che la croce porse s’a la natura assunta si misura, nulla già mai sì giustamente morse
Translate: Therefore, the penalty represented by the cross was absolutely right, if one considers the human nature by itself

Original: e così nulla fu di tanta ingiura, guardando a la persona che sofferse, in che era contratta tal natura
Translate: On the other hand, if one looks at the person who suffered it and who was united with such human nature, it was absolutely unjust.

Original: Però d’un atto uscir cose diverse
Translate: So from the same act they had different effects.

Original: ch’a Dio e a’ Giudei piacque una morte
Translate: For the same death pleased God and the Jews.

Original: per lei tremò la terra e ’l ciel s’aperse
Translate: for it, the earth was shaken by an earthquake, and Heaven was opened.

Original: Non ti dee oramai parer più forte, quando si dice che giusta vendetta poscia vengiata fu da giusta corte
Translate: It must no longer seem difficult to understand why it is said that a just vengeance was later avenged by a just court

Original: Ma io veggi’ or la tua mente ristretta di pensiero in pensier dentro ad un nodo, del qual con gran disio solver s’aspetta
Translate: But now I see that your mind, from thought to thought, is gripped by another knot, from which it has a great desire to be loosed.

Original: Tu dici
Translate: You say

Original: “Ben discerno ciò ch’i’ odo
Translate: "I understand what I've heard.

Original: ma perché Dio volesse, m’è occulto, a nostra redenzion pur questo modo”
Translate: but I don't understand why God wanted to choose this way of redeeming us."

Original: Questo decreto, frate, sta sepulto a li occhi di ciascuno il cui ingegno ne la fiamma d’amor non è adulto
Translate: This truth, brother, is buried in the eyes of each one whose ingenuity is not yet nourished by the flame of charity

Original: Veramente, però ch’a questo segno molto si mira e poco si discerne, dirò perché tal modo fu più degno
Translate: However, since it's hard to understand perfectly about this subject, I'll explain why that was the right way.

Original: La divina bontà, che da sé sperne ogne livore, ardendo in sé, sfavilla sì che dispiega le bellezze etterne
Translate: The divine goodness, which despises all hatred, burning in itself shines in such a way that it emanates eternal beauties

Original: Ciò che da lei sanza mezzo distilla non ha poi fine, perché non si move la sua imprenta quand’ ella sigilla
Translate: What is created by it directly has no end, because its imprint, after the seal has been imprinted, cannot change

Original: Ciò che da essa sanza mezzo piove libero è tutto, perché non soggiace a la virtute de le cose nove
Translate: What comes from it directly is completely free, because it is not subject to the virtue of the heavenly influences

Original: Più l’è conforme, e però più le piace
Translate: The more a creature conforms, the more it likes it

Original: ché l’ardor santo ch’ogne cosa raggia, ne la più somigliante è più vivace
