Translate: For the holy ardour that illuminates all things is more alive in the creatures that most resemble them.

Original: Di tutte queste dote s’avvantaggia l’umana creatura,
Translate: The human creature possesses all these qualities

Original: e s’una manca, di sua nobilità convien che caggia
Translate: and if one is missing, it is inevitable that he loses his nobility

Original: Solo il peccato è quel che la disfranca e falla dissimìle al sommo bene, per che del lume suo poco s’imbianca
Translate: Sin is the only thing that makes her slave and makes her deformed from the highest good, for little of her light shines

Original: e in sua dignità mai non rivene, se non rïempie, dove colpa vòta, contra mal dilettar con giuste pene
Translate: and he cannot regain his dignity, unless he fills up the void left by guilt with a just penalty contrary to his evil desires.

Original: Vostra natura, quando peccò tota nel seme suo, da queste dignitadi, come di paradiso, fu remota
Translate: When your nature completely sinned in Adam, it was turned away from this dignity as from Eden.

Original: né ricovrar potiensi, se tu badi ben sottilmente, per alcuna via, sanza passar per un di questi guadi
Translate: neither could such dignity be recovered, if you subtlely reason, in any way, without passing through one of these streets.

Original: o che Dio solo per sua cortesia dimesso avesse, o che l’uom per sé isso avesse sodisfatto a sua follia
Translate: God, by virtue of His generosity, could forgive, or man could atone for himself for his guilt

Original: Ficca mo l’occhio per entro l’abisso de l’etterno consiglio, quanto puoi al mio parlar distrettamente fisso
Translate: Put your gaze in the abyss of divine justice, no matter how tight you may hold it to my words.

Original: Non potea l’uomo ne’ termini suoi mai sodisfar,
Translate: Man by his very nature could never have atoned alone,

Original: per non potere ir giuso con umiltate obedïendo poi, quanto disobediendo intese ir suso
Translate: For he could not humble himself and obey as much as he haughty at the time of sin.

Original: e questa è la cagion per che l’uom fue da poter sodisfar per sé dischiuso
Translate: and this is the reason why man was forsaken the way to repair on his own initiative

Original: Dunque a Dio convenia con le vie sue riparar l’omo a sua intera vita, dico con l’una, o ver con amendue
Translate: Therefore it was necessary for God to help man to remedy in his whole life, in one way or another, or in both.

Original: Ma perché l’ovra tanto è più gradita da l’operante, quanto più appresenta de la bontà del core ond’ ell’ è uscita,
Translate: But since the work is all the more pleasing to those who act the more it manifests the goodness of the heart from which it originated,

Original: la divina bontà che ’l mondo imprenta, di proceder per tutte le sue vie, a rilevarvi suso, fu contenta
Translate: the divine goodness that sealed in his image the world wanted to use both ways to redeem you

Original: Né tra l’ultima notte e ’l primo die sì alto o sì magnifico processo, o per l’una o per l’altra, fu o fie
Translate: And in all human history we have never seen nor will we see an equally magnificent act, either way.

Original: ché più largo fu Dio a dar sé stesso per far l’uom sufficiente a rilevarsi, che s’elli avesse sol da sé dimesso
Translate: For God was more generous to sacrifice himself to redeem you than he would have been if he had simply forgiven you.

Original: e tutti li altri modi erano scarsi a la giustizia, se ’l Figliuol di Dio non fosse umilïato ad incarnarsi
Translate: and all the other ways were insufficient to divine righteousness, if the Son of God had not humbled himself,

Original: Or per empierti bene ogne disio, ritorno a dichiararti in alcun loco, perché tu veggi lì così com’ io
Translate: Now, to fully satisfy your every wish, I want to point out a point so that you see as clearly as I do.

Original: Tu dici
Translate: You say

Original: “Io veggio l’acqua, io veggio il foco, l’aere e la terra e tutte lor misture venire a corruzione, e durar poco
Translate: "I see that water, fire, air, earth and all their compounds are corruptible and are not eternal

Original: e queste cose pur furon creature
Translate: And these things are creatures anyway.

Original: per che, se ciò ch’è detto è stato vero, esser dovrien da corruzion sicure”
Translate: So, if what I've been told is true, they should be safe from corruption "

Original: Li angeli, frate, e ’l paese sincero nel qual tu se’, dir si posson creati, sì come sono, in loro essere intero
Translate: Brother, the angels and Heaven in which you find yourself have been created in the fullness of their being

Original: ma li alimenti che tu hai nomati e quelle cose che di lor si fanno da creata virtù sono informati
Translate: instead the elements that you have named and those objects that are composed of them, have received the form from the influence of Heaven

Original: Creata fu la materia ch’elli hanno
Translate: The matter of which they are made was created directly

Original: creata fu la virtù informante in queste stelle che ’ntorno a lor vanno
Translate: The virtue of information was created in these stars that revolve around them.

Original: L’anima d’ogne bruto e de le piante di complession potenzïata tira lo raggio e ’l moto de le luci sante
Translate: The ray and movement of the stars draws out the vegetative and psychic soul from the material suitable to receive the form

Original: ma vostra vita sanza mezzo spira la somma beninanza, e la innamora di sé sì che poi sempre la disira
Translate: instead your intellectual soul is created directly by the divine goodness, which makes you fall in love with yourself, so much so that then you always want to join it

Original: E quinci puoi argomentare ancora vostra resurrezion, se tu ripensi come l’umana carne fessi allora che li primi parenti intrambo fensi»
Translate: From this you can also understand your resurrection of the flesh, if you think that the human body was created directly by God together with the first forefathers.

Original: Solea creder lo mondo in suo periclo che la bella Ciprigna il folle amore raggiasse, volta nel terzo epiciclo
Translate: The ancient world used to believe, at its own risk, that the goddess Venus, turning into the third Heaven, would radiate the influence of sensual love.

Original: per che non pur a lei faceano onore di sacrificio e di votivo grido le genti antiche ne l’antico errore
Translate: so that the ancient peoples, in the error of paganism, did not honor her alone with sacrifices and vows,

Original: ma Dïone onoravano e Cupido, quella per madre sua, questo per figlio, e dicean ch’el sedette in grembo a Dido
Translate: But they also honored Dio's mother and Cupid's son, and said that the latter had sat in the lap of Dido.

Original: e da costei ond’ io principio piglio pigliavano il vocabol de la stella che ’l sol vagheggia or da coppa or da ciglio
Translate: And from this divinity of which I speak they took the name to indicate the planet which the sun is now courting from behind, now before

Original: Io non m’accorsi del salire in ella
Translate: I didn't notice to ascend to the star

Original: ma d’esservi entro mi fé assai fede la donna mia ch’i’ vidi far più bella
Translate: But I knew I was in it because I saw that my woman had become more beautiful.

Original: E come in fiamma favilla si vede, e come in voce voce si discerne, quand’ una è ferma e altra va e riede,
Translate: And how do you distinguish a spark in the flame, or how do you hear a modulating voice on a firm voice,

Original: vid’ io in essa luce altre lucerne muoversi in giro più e men correnti, al modo, credo, di lor viste interne
Translate: I saw in that luminous Heaven other lights, which turned more or less fast, just as, I believe, they enjoyed their inner vision.

Original: Di fredda nube non disceser venti, o visibili o no, tanto festini,
Translate: From a cold cloud they never descended so fast visible or invisible winds,

Original: che non paressero impediti e lenti a chi avesse quei lumi divini veduti a noi venir, lasciando il giro pria cominciato in li alti Serafini
Translate: that they did not seem restrained and slow to those who had seen those divine lights coming towards us, leaving the dance that they had previously begun in the First Mobile

Original: e dentro a quei che più innanzi appariro sonava ‘Osanna’ sì, che unque poi di rïudir non fui sanza disiro
Translate: And within those that appeared nearest to us, a 'Hosanna' resonated, so that I was never deprived of the desire to hear it later.

Original: Indi si fece l’un più presso a noi e solo incominciò
Translate: Then a spirit came closer to us, and began to speak alone.

Original: «Tutti sem presti al tuo piacer, perché di noi ti gioi
Translate: We are all solicitous to satisfy your pleasure, so that you may rejoice thanks to us.

Original: Noi ci volgiam coi principi celesti d’un giro e d’un girare e d’una sete, ai quali tu del mondo già dicesti
Translate: We rotate, sharing the same dance, the same movement and the same desire of God, with the Princes, to whom you once said in the world

Original: ‘Voi che ’ntendendo il terzo ciel movete’
Translate: 'You who with your intellect move the third Heaven'

Original: e sem sì pien d’amor, che, per piacerti, non fia men dolce un poco di quïete»
Translate: and we are so full of love that, to please you, there will be no less sweet to stand still for a while

Original: Poscia che li occhi miei si fuoro offerti a la mia donna reverenti, ed essa fatti li avea di sé contenti e certi,
Translate: After turning a reverent look to my woman and after she reassured me with a nod,

Original: rivolsersi a la luce che promessa tanto s’avea, e «Deh, chi siete?» fue la voce mia di grande affetto impressa
Translate: I turned my eyes to the light that so many promises had made to me and said with a voice full of great affection "Orsu, who are you?

Original: E quanta e quale vid’ io lei far piùe per allegrezza nova che s’accrebbe, quando parlai, a l’allegrezze sue
Translate: How I saw that light become greater and brighter, when I spoke, because of the increased joy that was added to the joy that already felt

Original: Così fatta, mi disse
Translate: After she became such, she said to me,

Original: «Il mondo m’ebbe giù poco tempo
Translate: The world had little time with me

Original: e se più fosse stato, molto sarà di mal, che non sarebbe
Translate: and if I had lived longer, much of the evil that will happen would not happen

Original: La mia letizia mi ti tien celato che mi raggia dintorno e mi nasconde quasi animal di sua seta fasciato
Translate: My joy shining around me hides me in your eyes, like an animal wrapped in silk.

Original: Assai m’amasti, e avesti ben onde
Translate: You loved me very much, and you were right.

Original: che s’io fossi giù stato, io ti mostrava di mio amor più oltre che le fronde
Translate: For if I had lived yet, I would have shown thee not only the branches of my affection.

Original: Quella sinistra riva che si lava di Rodano poi ch’è misto con Sorga, per suo segnore a tempo m’aspettava,
Translate: That left bank that is bathed by the Rhone after the Sorga has flowed into it had long awaited me as its lord,

Original: e quel corno d’Ausonia che s’imborga di Bari e di Gaeta e di Catona, da ove Tronto e Verde in mare sgorga
Translate: as well as that horn of Italy that has as cities Bari, Gaeta and Catona, from where the rivers Tronto and Liri flow into the sea

Original: Fulgeami già in fronte la corona di quella terra che ’l Danubio riga poi che le ripe tedesche abbandona
Translate: The crown of that land which the Danube passed through was already shining on my forehead, after leaving the German lands.

Original: E la bella Trinacria, che caliga tra Pachino e Peloro, sopra ’l golfo che riceve da Euro maggior briga,
Translate: And the beautiful Sicily, which is covered with caligos between Pachino and Peloro, on the gulf that is beaten by Scirocco,

Original: non per Tifeo ma per nascente solfo,
Translate: not because of the giant Typhaeus but the sulfur,

Original: attesi avrebbe li suoi regi ancora, nati per me di Carlo e di Ridolfo,
Translate: He would still wait for his rulers born through me by Charles and Rodolfo,

Original: se mala segnoria, che sempre accora li popoli suggetti, non avesse mosso Palermo a gridar
Translate: If the bad government that always pushes the peoples to rebel, had not led Palermo to shout

Original: “Mora, mora”
Translate: "Dying, dying"

Original: E se mio frate questo antivedesse, l’avara povertà di Catalogna già fuggeria, perché non li offendesse
Translate: And if my brother Roberto were to foresee this, he would already avoid the avarice worthy of the Catalans so that it would not harm him.

Original: ché veramente proveder bisogna per lui, o per altrui, sì ch’a sua barca carcata più d’incarco non si pogna
Translate: For it is necessary that he or someone in his place should provide, that his kingdom may not suffer further harm.

Original: La sua natura, che di larga parca discese, avria mestier di tal milizia che non curasse di mettere in arca»
Translate: His character, which descended from liberal ancestors is stingy, would need soldiers such as not to worry only about pocketing gains.

Original: «Però ch’i’ credo che l’alta letizia che ’l tuo parlar m’infonde, segnor mio, là ’ve ogne ben si termina e s’inizia,
Translate: "Because I believe that the great joy that gives me your speech, my lord, you see it where it ends and every good begins

Original: per te si veggia come la vegg’ io, grata m’è più
Translate: You see it as I see it, it's even more pleasing to me.

Original: e anco quest’ ho caro perché ’l discerni rimirando in Dio
Translate: And it is dear to me that you see her in God.

Original: Fatto m’hai lieto, e così mi fa chiaro, poi che, parlando, a dubitar m’hai mosso com’ esser può, di dolce seme, amaro»
Translate: You have made me happy, so now make me clear, since with your words you have led me to doubt how it is possible for a child to be degenerate with respect to his father.

Original: Questo io a lui
Translate: That's what I told him.

Original: ed elli a me
Translate: and he answered me

Original: «S’io posso mostrarti un vero, a quel che tu dimandi terrai lo viso come tien lo dosso
Translate: If I can show you the truth, with respect to your doubt you will have your face turned to where you now turn your back

Original: Lo ben che tutto il regno che tu scandi volge e contenta, fa esser virtute sua provedenza in questi corpi grandi
Translate: The good that rotates and satisfies all the kingdom that you cross, makes Providence become operational virtue in these stars

Original: E non pur le nature provedute sono in la mente ch’è da sé perfetta, ma esse insieme con la lor salute
Translate: And in the mind of God that is perfect in itself, are determined not only the various natures, but with them also their end

Original: per che quantunque quest’ arco saetta disposto cade a proveduto fine, sì come cosa in suo segno diretta
Translate: in fact, whatever is addressed by the celestial influences, is carried out with a precise and determined end, just like an arrow directed against a target

Original: Se ciò non fosse, il ciel che tu cammine producerebbe sì li suoi effetti, che non sarebbero arti, ma ruine
Translate: If it were not so, the Heaven that you travel through would produce its effects in such a way that they would not benefit influences, but ruins.

Original: e ciò esser non può, se li ’ntelletti che muovon queste stelle non son manchi, e manco il primo, che non li ha perfetti
Translate: and this cannot happen, if the angelic intelligences that move these stars are not defective, and if not even the first intellect that would not have made them perfect

Original: Vuo’ tu che questo ver più ti s’imbianchi?»
Translate: Do you want further explanation about this?

Original: E io
Translate: And I...

Original: «Non già ché impossibil veggio che la natura, in quel ch’è uopo, stanchi»
Translate: "No, for I understand that it is impossible for nature to fail in what is necessary"

Original: Ond’ elli ancora
Translate: Then he went on

Original: «Or dì
Translate: So tell me.

Original: sarebbe il peggio per l’omo in terra, se non fosse cive?»
Translate: Would it be worse for the man who lives on Earth if he wasn't a citizen?

Original: «Sì», rispuos’ io
Translate: "Yes," I replied.

Original: «e qui ragion non cheggio»
Translate: I do not ask for any explanation of this.

Original: «E puot’ elli esser, se giù non si vive diversamente per diversi offici?
Translate: And could this happen if we didn't live on Earth, each carrying out a different function?

Original: Non, se ’l maestro vostro ben vi scrive»
Translate: not, if your teacher writes the true

Original: Sì venne deducendo infino a quici
Translate: So he came reasoning to this point

Original: poscia conchiuse
Translate: then concluded

Original: «Dunque esser diverse convien di vostri effetti le radici
Translate: Therefore it is necessary that the roots of your effects be different.

Original: per ch’un nasce Solone e altro Serse, altro Melchisedèch e altro quello che, volando per l’aere, il figlio perse
Translate: That is why one is born a lawgiver and another leader, one priest and another engineer, like the one who lost the son who flew into heaven.

Original: La circular natura, ch’è suggello a la cera mortal, fa ben sua arte, ma non distingue l’un da l’altro ostello
Translate: Angelic intelligence, which imprints the seal on mortal wax, operates its art but does not distinguish one family from another

Original: Quinci addivien ch’Esaù si diparte per seme da Iacòb
Translate: That is why Esau is different from his brother Jacob

Original: e vien Quirino da sì vil padre, che si rende a Marte
Translate: That is why Romulus descends from a father so humble that he is attributed to Mars

Original: Natura generata il suo cammino simil farebbe sempre a’ generanti, se non vincesse il proveder divino
Translate: The created nature would walk a path always equal to that of the parents, if the divine Providence were no longer strong

Original: Or quel che t’era dietro t’è davanti
Translate: Now what was behind you is in front of you.

Original: ma perché sappi che di te mi giova, un corollario voglio che t’ammanti
Translate: But so that you know that I'm happy to be with you, I want to give you one more corollary.

Original: Sempre natura, se fortuna trova discorde a sé, com’ ogne altra semente fuor di sua regïon, fa mala prova
Translate: Nature, whenever it finds the outer conditions discordant, produces bad effects like a seed fallen into a soil not suitable for that species

Original: E se ’l mondo là giù ponesse mente al fondamento che natura pone, seguendo lui, avria buona la gente
Translate: And if the earthly world cared more about the foundation laid by nature, following it would have better people

Original: Ma voi torcete a la religïone tal che fia nato a cignersi la spada, e fate re di tal ch’è da sermone
Translate: But you force one to religious life who would be born to carry the sword, and make a king who would be brought to religion.

Original: onde la traccia vostra è fuor di strada»
Translate: That is why your way is out of the right way.

Original: Da poi che Carlo tuo, bella Clemenza, m’ebbe chiarito, mi narrò li ’nganni che ricever dovea la sua semenza
Translate: After your beautiful Charlemagne had made my doubts clear, he told me the deceptions that his descendants were to suffer.

Original: ma disse
Translate: but he said

Original: «Taci e lascia muover li anni»
Translate: Shut up and let the years go by.

Original: sì ch’io non posso dir se non che pianto giusto verrà di retro ai vostri danni
Translate: so that I cannot say except that your misfortunes will be rightly punished by God

Original: E già la vita di quel lume santo rivolta s’era al Sol che la rïempie come quel ben ch’a ogne cosa è tanto
Translate: And now the soul of that holy light had turned to the sun that filled it like that good that is greater than anything

Original: Ahi anime ingannate e fatture empie, che da sì fatto ben torcete i cuori, drizzando in vanità le vostre tempie
Translate: Alas, misguided souls and evil creatures, who turn your hearts away from such a good, and turn your mind toward vain things.

Original: Ed ecco un altro di quelli splendori ver’ me si fece, e ’l suo voler piacermi significava nel chiarir di fori
Translate: And behold, another of those splendors came near unto me, and with his brightness manifested the will to answer my questions.

Original: Li occhi di Bëatrice, ch’eran fermi sovra me, come pria, di caro assenso al mio disio certificato fermi
Translate: The eyes of Beatrice, who were fixed on me, as they had done before, gave me a sign of assent to my desire to speak.

Original: «Deh, metti al mio voler tosto compenso, beato spirto», dissi,
Translate: "Now, blessed spirit, put a counterweight to my will at once," I said,

Original: «e fammi prova ch’i’ possa in te refletter quel ch’io penso»
Translate: and show me that my thoughts can be reflected in your mind

Original: Onde la luce che m’era ancor nova, del suo profondo, ond’ ella pria cantava, seguette come a cui di ben far giova
Translate: Then that light, which I did not yet know, from its depth in which it used to sing, began to speak as the one who likes to do good.

Original: «In quella parte de la terra prava italica che siede tra Rïalto e le fontane di Brenta e di Piava,
Translate: In that part of the wicked land of Italy that is between Rialto and the springs of Brenta and Piave,

Original: si leva un colle, e non surge molt’ alto, là onde scese già una facella che fece a la contrada un grande assalto
Translate: a hill rises not very high, from where descended an incendiary torch that exercised a tyrannical dominion over the region

Original: D’una radice nacqui e io ed ella
Translate: Both of us were born from the same parents

Original: Cunizza fui chiamata, e qui refulgo perché mi vinse il lume d’esta stella
Translate: I was called Cunizza and shining in this Heaven because I was overwhelmed by the influence of this planet

Original: ma lietamente a me medesma indulgo la cagion di mia sorte, e non mi noia
Translate: But with joy I forgive myself the cause of my lot, and I do not regret it.

Original: che parria forse forte al vostro vulgo
Translate: which, perhaps, might seem difficult to understand for the volgo

Original: Di questa luculenta e cara gioia del nostro cielo che più m’è propinqua, grande fama rimase
Translate: Of this shining and precious gem of our Heaven that is nearest to me is still a great fame

Original: e pria che moia, questo centesimo anno ancor s’incinqua
Translate: And before it vanisheth, they shall pass no less than five centuries.

Original: vedi se far si dee l’omo eccellente, sì ch’altra vita la prima relinqua
Translate: See if man has to take care to acquire fame, so as to leave another glorious life behind his mortal life

Original: E ciò non pensa la turba presente che Tagliamento e Adice richiude, né per esser battuta ancor si pente
Translate: Instead, the people who today live in the Trevigiana Mark, between Tagliamento and Adige, do not think about this, and even though they suffer punishments they do not regret

Original: ma tosto fia che Padova al palude cangerà l’acqua che Vincenza bagna, per essere al dover le genti crude
Translate: but it will soon happen that the Paduans will change with their blood the water of the swamp that bathes Vicenza, serving the fact of being reluctant to their duty

Original: e dove Sile e Cagnan s’accompagna, tal signoreggia e va con la testa alta, che già per lui carpir si fa la ragna
Translate: And there where the Sile and the Cagnano are joined, there is a tyrant who rules with pride, so that the conspiracy that will eliminate him is already ordained.

Original: Piangerà Feltro ancora la difalta de l’empio suo pastor, che sarà sconcia sì, che per simil non s’entrò in malta
Translate: Moreover Feltre will regret the betrayal of his wicked bishop, who will be so hateful that no one was ever imprisoned for such an act.

Original: Troppo sarebbe larga la bigoncia che ricevesse il sangue ferrarese, e stanco chi ’l pesasse a oncia a oncia,
Translate: Too big should be the vessel that contained all the Ferrara blood and would be tired who weighed it accurately,

Original: che donerà questo prete cortese per mostrarsi di parte
Translate: the blood that this courteous priest will shed to show his faithfulness to his party

Original: e cotai doni conformi fieno al viver del paese
Translate: And these gifts shall be according to the manners of that earth.

Original: Sù sono specchi, voi dicete Troni, onde refulge a noi Dio giudicante
Translate: At the top are mirrors, which you call Thrones, from where God the judge shines to us.

Original: sì che questi parlar ne paion buoni»
Translate: So these speeches seem right to us.

Original: Qui si tacette
Translate: At this point, he was silent.

Original: e fecemi sembiante che fosse ad altro volta, per la rota in che si mise com’ era davante
Translate: And he showed me that he had turned to other things, for he began to dance in the round, as he did before.

Original: L’altra letizia, che m’era già nota per cara cosa, mi si fece in vista qual fin balasso in che lo sol percuota
Translate: The other joyful spirit, which had already been presented to me as a precious soul, was shown to me as a refined ruby struck by sunlight.

Original: Per letiziar là sù fulgor s’acquista, sì come riso qui
Translate: In Paradise one acquires splendour when one is glad, as on Earth when one laughs

Original: ma giù s’abbuia l’ombra di fuor, come la mente è trista
Translate: But in Hell the shadow growth up from the outside, as much as the mind is saddened.

Original: «Dio vede tutto, e tuo veder s’inluia», diss’ io,
Translate: "God sees everything and your sight fits into Him," I said.

Original: «beato spirto, sì che nulla voglia di sé a te puot’ esser fuia
Translate: or blessed spirit, so that no desire can escape from you

Original: Dunque la voce tua, che ’l ciel trastulla sempre col canto di quei fuochi pii che di sei ali facen la coculla,
Translate: So, your voice, which always delights Heaven with the singing of those angels who fall in love with six wings,

Original: perché non satisface a’ miei disii?
Translate: Why doesn't he fulfill my wishes?

Original: Già non attendere’ io tua dimanda, s’io m’intuassi, come tu t’inmii»
Translate: I would not wait for you to speak, if I could penetrate you as you can do it in me.

Original: «La maggior valle in che l’acqua si spanda», incominciaro allor le sue parole,
Translate: "The greatest sinking in which the water is poured," he then began to speak,

Original: «fuor di quel mar che la terra inghirlanda, tra ’ discordanti liti contra ’l sole tanto sen va,
Translate: Outside of that sea that surrounds the land, it extends eastward among the opposite shores so much

Original: che fa meridïano là dove l’orizzonte pria far suole
Translate: who makes himself meridian there where he first makes horizon

Original: Di quella valle fu’ io litorano tra Ebro e Macra, che per cammin corto parte lo Genovese dal Toscano
Translate: I was born on the coast of that valley, between the rivers Ebro and Magra, which for a short stretch divides Liguria from Tuscany

Original: Ad un occaso quasi e ad un orto Buggea siede e la terra ond’ io fui, che fé del sangue suo già caldo il porto
Translate: The city of Buggea and the city where I was born, which poured so much blood into the harbor, have almost the same dawn and the same horizon

Original: Folco mi disse quella gente a cui fu noto il nome mio
Translate: Those who knew me called me Folco

Original: e questo cielo di me s’imprenta, com’ io fe’ di lui
Translate: and this Heaven shines of my light as I shine of his

Original: ché più non arse la figlia di Belo, noiando e a Sicheo e a Creusa, di me, infin che si convenne al pelo
Translate: For the daughter of Belo, who offended Creusa and Sicheus, didn't burn with love any more than I did, until I was young.

Original: né quella Rodopëa che delusa fu da Demofoonte, né Alcide quando Iole nel core ebbe rinchiusa
Translate: Neither did the rodopea Fillide, which was abandoned by Demophoon, burn out of love, nor the Alcid when he was in love with Iole.

Original: Non però qui si pente, ma si ride,
Translate: However, we do not regret this here, but we rejoice.

Original: non de la colpa, ch’a mente non torna, ma del valor ch’ordinò e provide
Translate: not of guilt, whose remembrance is erased in us, but of the divine virtue which determined and arranged this

Original: Qui si rimira ne l’arte ch’addorna cotanto affetto, e discernesi ’l bene per che ’l mondo di sù quel di giù torna
Translate: Here in Paradise one contemplates the divine art of creation that God's love beautifies and distinguishes the providential end for which Heaven gives shape to the earthly world

Original: Ma perché tutte le tue voglie piene ten porti che son nate in questa spera, proceder ancor oltre mi convene
Translate: But so that all the desires of knowledge that are born in you in this Heaven are fully satisfied, I must tell you something else.

Original: Tu vuo’ saper chi è in questa lumera che qui appresso me così scintilla come raggio di sole in acqua mera
Translate: You want to know who is in this light flashing here next to me, so it looks like a ray of sunshine in crystal clear water

Original: Or sappi che là entro si tranquilla Raab
Translate: Now know that Rahab enjoys peace in there

Original: e a nostr’ ordine congiunta, di lei nel sommo grado si sigilla
Translate: and, united with our Heaven, it receives the imprint of her to the highest degree

Original: Da questo cielo, in cui l’ombra s’appunta che ’l vostro mondo face, pria ch’altr’ alma del trïunfo di Cristo fu assunta
Translate: It was taken by this Heaven, in which the shadow cone projected from the Earth ends, before every other soul by the triumph of Christ.

Original: Ben si convenne lei lasciar per palma in alcun cielo de l’alta vittoria che s’acquistò con l’una e l’altra palma,
Translate: It was right to leave it in Heaven as a symbol of the great victory that was obtained with the crucifixion of Christ,

Original: perch’ ella favorò la prima gloria di Iosüè in su la Terra Santa, che poco tocca al papa la memoria
Translate: because it favored the first military victory of Joshua in the Holy Land, of which the pope today remembers too little

Original: La tua città, che di colui è pianta che pria volse le spalle al suo fattore e di cui è la ’nvidia tanto pianta,
Translate: your city, which is the product of the one who first rebelled against God and whose envy is the source of so much suffering,

Original: produce e spande il maladetto fiore c’ha disvïate le pecore e li agni, però che fatto ha lupo del pastore
Translate: conia and spread the goddamn blossom that has misled all the Christian people, in that it has transformed the shepherd into a wolf

Original: Per questo l’Evangelio e i dottor magni son derelitti, e solo ai Decretali si studia, sì che pare a’ lor vivagni
Translate: For this reason the Gospel and the books of the Fathers of the Church are neglected, and only the Decretals are read, as appears from their wrinkled margins.

Original: A questo intende il papa e ’ cardinali
Translate: The pope and the cardinals think only of this

Original: non vanno i lor pensieri a Nazarette, là dove Gabrïello aperse l’ali
Translate: Their thoughts do not go to Nazareth, where the archangel Gabriel opened his wings.

Original: Ma Vaticano e l’altre parti elette di Roma che son state cimitero a la milizia che Pietro seguette,
Translate: However, the Vatican and the other sacred places of Rome, which saw the martyrdom of the early Christians who followed Peter,

Original: tosto libere fien de l’avoltero»
Translate: They will soon be free from this desecration.

Original: Guardando nel suo Figlio con l’Amore che l’uno e l’altro etternalmente spira, lo primo e ineffabile Valore quanto per mente e per loco si gira con tant’ ordine fé,
Translate: The first and unspeakable Power , looking at the Son with the Holy Spirit who breathes eternally from both, created the harmonious movement of Heaven in such a perfect way

Original: ch’esser non puote sanza gustar di lui chi ciò rimira
Translate: that it is not possible to admire it without enjoying the divine image

Original: Leva dunque, lettore, a l’alte rote meco la vista, dritto a quella parte dove l’un moto e l’altro si percuote
Translate: So, O reader, look up with me to the celestial spheres, right at that point where the two opposite movements intersect

Original: e lì comincia a vagheggiar ne l’arte di quel maestro che dentro a sé l’ama, tanto che mai da lei l’occhio non parte
Translate: and begins to admire there the work of art of that craftsman who loves it within himself, to the point that he never looks away from it

Original: Vedi come da indi si dirama l’oblico cerchio che i pianeti porta, per sodisfare al mondo che li chiama
Translate: See how the Zodiac who carries the planets with him diverges from there, to satisfy the needs of the Earth that invokes them

Original: Che se la strada lor non fosse torta, molta virtù nel ciel sarebbe in vano, e quasi ogne potenza qua giù morta
Translate: In fact, if its trajectory were not oblique to the celestial equator, many astral influences would be useless and here, on Earth, every potentiality of nature would remain inactive

Original: e se dal dritto più o men lontano fosse ’l partire, assai sarebbe manco e giù e sù de l’ordine mondano
Translate: and if the divergence were greater or lesser, the order of the world would be very lacking in both hemispheres

Original: Or ti riman, lettor, sovra ’l tuo banco, dietro pensando a ciò che si preliba, s’esser vuoi lieto assai prima che stanco
Translate: Now stay, reader, on your bench, thinking of what I tell you and what it promises to be, if you want to rejoice before you are tired

Original: Messo t’ho innanzi
Translate: I put the food in front of you.

Original: omai per te ti ciba
Translate: Now you have to eat alone,

Original: ché a sé torce tutta la mia cura quella materia ond’ io son fatto scriba
Translate: For that matter which I am called to transcribe draws all my attention to itself,

Original: Lo ministro maggior de la natura, che del valor del ciel lo mondo imprenta e col suo lume il tempo ne misura,
Translate: The greatest minister of nature, who spreads his beneficial influence on the Earth and with its light measures time,

Original: con quella parte che sù si rammenta congiunto, si girava per le spire in che più tosto ognora s’appresenta
Translate: joined with that point I said before, it was spinning in that spiral where every day rises a little earlier.

Original: e io era con lui
Translate: And I was with him.

Original: ma del salire non m’accors’ io, se non com’ uom s’accorge, anzi ’l primo pensier, del suo venire
Translate: But I didn't notice that I ascended, except as one who sensed a sudden thought only after it appeared.

Original: È Bëatrice quella che sì scorge di bene in meglio, sì subitamente che l’atto suo per tempo non si sporge
Translate: Beatrice drives from a Heaven to the higher one so quickly, that her act is virtually instantaneous

Original: Quant’ esser convenia da sé lucente quel ch’era dentro al sol dov’ io entra’mi, non per color, ma per lume parvente
Translate: The lights of the blessed who were inside the Heaven of the Sun had to be really shining, because I distinguished them even if they were not of different color

Original: Perch’ io lo ’ngegno e l’arte e l’uso chiami, sì nol direi che mai s’imaginasse
Translate: As much as I invoke my ingenuity, art and experience, I couldn't describe all this to make it an accomplished idea.

Original: ma creder puossi e di veder si brami
Translate: however you can believe and therefore you have to want to see it

Original: E se le fantasie nostre son basse a tanta altezza, non è maraviglia
Translate: And if our language is so inadequate to such a high matter, don't be surprised

Original: ché sopra ’l sol non fu occhio ch’andasse
Translate: in fact no human eye has ever seen a light more intense than that of the Sun

Original: Tal era quivi la quarta famiglia de l’alto Padre, che sempre la sazia, mostrando come spira e come figlia
Translate: Here was thus presented the fourth host of the blessed, which the Father satisfied continually showing him the mystery of the Trinity

Original: E Bëatrice cominciò
Translate: And Beatrice started

Original: «Ringrazia, ringrazia il Sol de li angeli, ch’a questo sensibil t’ha levato per sua grazia»
Translate: "Thank you, thank the sun of angels who by his grace raised you to this material Sun"

Original: Cor di mortal non fu mai sì digesto a divozione e a rendersi a Dio con tutto ’l suo gradir cotanto presto,
Translate: The heart of a man was never so well disposed to devotion and so ready to make himself to God with all his gratitude,

Original: come a quelle parole mi fec’ io
Translate: as I was at those words

Original: e sì tutto ’l mio amore in lui si mise, che Bëatrice eclissò ne l’oblio
Translate: and my love turned to Him so much that he totally forgot about Beatrice

Original: Non le dispiacque
Translate: She didn't mind.

Original: ma sì se ne rise, che lo splendor de li occhi suoi ridenti mia mente unita in più cose divise
Translate: But he smiled, so that the splendour of his joyful eyes caused my mind to divide among many things.

Original: Io vidi più folgór vivi e vincenti far di noi centro e di sé far corona, più dolci in voce che in vista lucenti
Translate: I saw several vivid and shining lights more than the Sun surrounding us like a crown, of which we were the center, singing softer than they were bright

Original: così cinger la figlia di Latona vedem talvolta, quando l’aere è pregno, sì che ritenga il fil che fa la zona
Translate: so, sometimes, we see the Moon surrounded by a halo, when the air is humid and holds the lunar ray forming a band

Original: Ne la corte del cielo, ond’ io rivegno, si trovan molte gioie care e belle tanto che non si posson trar del regno
Translate: In the court of Paradise, from where I return, there are many beautiful and precious jewels, so much so that you cannot take away from that kingdom

Original: e ’l canto di quei lumi era di quelle
Translate: and the song of those lights was one of these jewels

Original: chi non s’impenna sì che là sù voli, dal muto aspetti quindi le novelle
Translate: Who can't fly up there doesn't expect me to describe him, like a mute can't bring the news

Original: Poi, sì cantando, quelli ardenti soli si fuor girati intorno a noi tre volte,
Translate: After those burning suns, singing like that, they made three laps,

Original: come stelle vicine a’ fermi poli, donne mi parver, non da ballo sciolte, ma che s’arrestin tacite,
Translate: As stars near the heavenly poles, they seemed to me to be women who are still dancing and who stop in silence,

Original: ascoltando fin che le nove note hanno ricolte
Translate: Listening until they hear the music that gets the dance back

Original: E dentro a l’un senti’ cominciar
Translate: And inside one of those lights I heard

Original: «Quando lo raggio de la grazia, onde s’accende verace amore e che poi cresce amando, multiplicato in te tanto resplende,
Translate: "For the ray of divine grace, from which the true love is kindled, which then, loving, continues to grow, shines forth multiplied in you,

Original: che ti conduce su per quella scala u’ sanza risalir nessun discende
Translate: seeing that he leads you up that ladder from which no one descends without going up

Original: qual ti negasse il vin de la sua fiala per la tua sete, in libertà non fora se non com’ acqua ch’al mar non si cala
Translate: If anyone denied you the wine of his vial to quench your thirst, he would not act in freedom just like a water that would not come down from the mountain to the sea.

Original: Tu vuo’ saper di quai piante s’infiora questa ghirlanda che ’ntorno vagheggia la bella donna ch’al ciel t’avvalora
Translate: You want to know what flowers this wreath is formed of that contemplates all around the beautiful woman who leads you to Heaven

Original: Io fui de li agni de la santa greggia che Domenico mena per cammino u’ ben s’impingua se non si vaneggia
Translate: I was one of the lambs of the holy flock that St Dominic leads along the way, where spiritual goods are enriched if one does not deviate from the rule

Original: Questi che m’è a destra più vicino, frate e maestro fummi,
Translate: He, who is immediately at my right hand, was a friar, and was my teacher.

Original: ed esso Alberto è di Cologna, e io Thomas d’Aquino
Translate: And this is Albert the Great of Cologne, and I am Thomas Aquinas.

Original: Se sì di tutti li altri esser vuo’ certo, di retro al mio parlar ten vien col viso girando su per lo beato serto
Translate: If you want to know the names of everyone else, follow my words by sliding your gaze down the lights of this blessed crown

Original: Quell’ altro fiammeggiare esce del riso di Grazïan, che l’uno e l’altro foro aiutò sì che piace in paradiso
Translate: That other flaming light is produced by the smile of Francesco Graziano, who helped the one and the other law in such a way that he likes Paradise

Original: L’altro ch’appresso addorna il nostro coro, quel Pietro fu che con la poverella offerse a Santa Chiesa suo tesoro
Translate: The other who after him embellished our army, was that Peter Lombardo who offered the Holy Church all his possessions as the poor woman of the Gospel

Original: La quinta luce, ch’è tra noi più bella, spira di tale amor, che tutto ’l mondo là giù ne gola di saper novella
Translate: The fifth light, which is the most beautiful among us, is the breath of such love that the whole world desires to know its destiny

Original: entro v’è l’alta mente u’ sì profondo saver fu messo, che, se ’l vero è vero, a veder tanto non surse il secondo
Translate: Inside is the high mind where a knowledge so deep was infused that, if the Scriptures tell the truth, there was no wiser man than him.

Original: Appresso vedi il lume di quel cero che giù in carne più a dentro vide l’angelica natura e ’l ministero
Translate: Nearby you see the light of that candle that when he was alive he saw more depth than any other the nature and function of the angels

Original: Ne l’altra piccioletta luce ride quello avvocato de’ tempi cristiani del cui latino Augustin si provide
Translate: In the other light smaller laughs that lawyer of Christian times whose work in Latin made use of Saint Augustine

Original: Or se tu l’occhio de la mente trani di luce in luce dietro a le mie lode, già de l’ottava con sete rimani
Translate: Now, if you make the eye of your mind flow from light to light behind my words, it remains for you to find out who the eighth light is.

Original: Per vedere ogne ben dentro vi gode l’anima santa che ’l mondo fallace fa manifesto a chi di lei ben ode
Translate: Inside you enjoy the holy soul that shows the fallacy of the world to those who read his works well, for now he sees the highest good

Original: Lo corpo ond’ ella fu cacciata giace giuso in Cieldauro
Translate: The body from which it was torn lies on Earth in the basilica of St. Peter in Heaven of Gold

Original: ed essa da martiro e da essilio venne a questa pace
Translate: and his soul came to this peace from martyrdom and from earthly exile

Original: Vedi oltre fiammeggiar l’ardente spiro d’Isidoro, di Beda e di Riccardo, che a considerar fu più che viro
Translate: Besides you see the burning spirit of Isidoro of Seville, of Venerable Beda, of Riccardo of San Vittore burning, which in the contemplation of God was more than a man

Original: Questi onde a me ritorna il tuo riguardo, è ’l lume d’uno spirto che ’n pensieri gravi a morir li parve venir tardo
Translate: And this, from which your gaze returns upon me, is the light of a spirit that was oppressed by grave thoughts, so much so that death seemed late to him.

Original: essa è la luce etterna di Sigieri, che, leggendo nel Vico de li Strami, silogizzò invidïosi veri»
Translate: It is the eternal light of Sigieri of Brabant, who, practicing the teaching in the Straw Road to Paris, demonstrated the doctrinal truths that aroused envy against him.

Original: Indi, come orologio che ne chiami ne l’ora che la sposa di Dio surge a mattinar lo sposo perché l’ami,
Translate: At that point, like a clock that, at the hour when the Church rises, calls her to recite the morning to Christ so that he still loves her,

Original: che l’una parte e l’altra tira e urge, tin tin sonando con sì dolce nota, che ’l ben disposto spirto d’amor turge
Translate: in which one side pulls and the other pushes , tinking so sweetly that it fills with love the spirit well disposed

Original: così vid’ ïo la gloriosa rota muoversi e render voce a voce in tempra e in dolcezza ch’esser non pò nota se non colà dove gioir s’insempra
Translate: So I saw that glorious crown of spirits moving and singing with a harmony and a melody so sweet that one cannot understand it, except in Paradise where joy becomes eternal

Original: O insensata cura de’ mortali, quanto son difettivi silogismi quei che ti fanno in basso batter l’ali
Translate: O crazy desire of men, how fallacious are the reasonings that cause you to turn down.

Original: Chi dietro a iura e chi ad amforismi sen giva, e chi seguendo sacerdozio, e chi regnar per forza o per sofismi,
Translate: Who followed the legal studies, who the doctors, who dedicated himself to the priesthood, who tried to reign by violence or deception,

Original: e chi rubare e chi civil negozio, chi nel diletto de la carne involto s’affaticava e chi si dava a l’ozio, quando,
Translate: who stole, who dedicated himself to political affairs, who let himself go to fleshly pleasures, who to idleness, when I,

Original: da tutte queste cose sciolto, con Bëatrice m’era suso in cielo cotanto glorïosamente accolto
Translate: free from all these flattery, I was received with Beatrice in Heaven in such a glorious way

Original: Poi che ciascuno fu tornato ne lo punto del cerchio in che avanti s’era, fermossi, come a candellier candelo
Translate: And it came to pass, when every light was returned to the place of the crown where it was before, that it stood, like the candle of a lampstand.

Original: E io senti’ dentro a quella lumera che pria m’avea parlato, sorridendo incominciar, faccendosi più mera
Translate: And I heard that within that light which he had spoken to me before, the blessed began to speak again, because when he smiled he became brighter.

Original: «Così com’ io del suo raggio resplendo, sì, riguardando ne la luce etterna, li tuoi pensieri onde cagioni apprendo
Translate: "For I shine from the ray of eternal light, looking into it, I see where your uncertainties come from.

Original: Tu dubbi, e hai voler che si ricerna in sì aperta e ’n sì distesa lingua lo dicer mio, ch’al tuo sentir si sterna, ove dinanzi dissi
Translate: You have doubts, and you want me to explain to you in an open and clear speech what I said before, so that it is understandable to your intelligence, when I just said,

Original: “U’ ben s’impingua”, e là u’ dissi
Translate: "Where you get rich in spiritual goods" and when I said,

Original: “Non nacque il secondo”
Translate: "Not another equal was born."

Original: e qui è uopo che ben si distingua
Translate: and here it is necessary to make a distinction

Original: La provedenza, che governa il mondo con quel consiglio nel quale ogne aspetto creato è vinto pria che vada al fondo,
Translate: Providence, which guides the world with the wisdom in which the sight of every creature is lost before reaching the bottom,

Original: però che andasse ver’ lo suo diletto la sposa di colui ch’ad alte grida disposò lei col sangue benedetto,
Translate: that the bride of Him who married her might go to her beloved, with her blessed blood,

Original: in sé sicura e anche a lui più fida, due principi ordinò in suo favore, che quinci e quindi le fosser per guida
Translate: And she was sure of herself, and more faithful to him, and set two princes in her behalf, to guide her on one side and on the other.

Original: L’un fu tutto serafico in ardore
Translate: One was as ardent as the Seraphim

Original: l’altro per sapïenza in terra fue di cherubica luce uno splendore
Translate: the other for his wisdom on Earth was a splendor of light like the Cherubim

Original: De l’un dirò, però che d’amendue si dice l’un pregiando, qual ch’om prende, perch’ ad un fine fur l’opere sue
Translate: I will speak only of the first, for praising one of the two is as if we were talking about both, for their works had the same end.

Original: Intra Tupino e l’acqua che discende del colle eletto dal beato Ubaldo,
Translate: Between the river Topino and Chiascio, which flows from Mount Ausciano where Blessed Ubaldo put his hermitage,

Original: fertile costa d’alto monte pende, onde Perugia sente freddo e caldo da Porta Sole
Translate: slopes the fertile coast of a high mountain, from which Perugia feels the cold and the heat from the side of Porta Sole

Original: e di rietro le piange per grave giogo Nocera con Gualdo
Translate: and on the opposite side weep, because in a more disadvantageous position, Nocera Umbra and Gualdo Tadino

Original: Di questa costa, là dov’ ella frange più sua rattezza, nacque al mondo un sole, come fa questo talvolta di Gange
Translate: From this coast, at the point where it becomes less steep, a Sun was born for the world as this sometimes comes from the Ganges

Original: Però chi d’esso loco fa parole, non dica Ascesi, ché direbbe corto, ma Orïente, se proprio dir vuole
Translate: So, whoever speaks of this place, do not call it "Assisi," for he would say little, but call it "Orient," if he really wants to talk about it

Original: Non era ancor molto lontan da l’orto, ch’el cominciò a far sentir la terra de la sua gran virtute alcun conforto
Translate: He was not yet far from his birth, when Francis began to reflect on Earth his luminous virtue

Original: ché per tal donna, giovinetto, in guerra del padre corse, a cui, come a la morte, la porta del piacer nessun diserra
Translate: For when he was yet young, he fought with his father for a woman to whom no man would join, as if she were death.

Original: e dinanzi a la sua spirital corte et coram patre le si fece unito
Translate: and in front of the episcopal court and in the presence of her father he joined her in marriage

Original: poscia di dì in dì l’amò più forte
Translate: afterward, he loved her more and more every day

Original: Questa, privata del primo marito, millecent’ anni e più dispetta e scura fino a costui si stette sanza invito
Translate: She, deprived of her first husband, had remained alone for more than a thousand hundred years, despised by all, until Francis

Original: né valse udir che la trovò sicura con Amiclate, al suon de la sua voce, colui ch’a tutto ’l mondo fé paura
Translate: He did not serve them that men should hear that Caesar, who feared the whole world, found poverty secure at the sound of his own voice, along with Shepherd Amiclate.

Original: né valse esser costante né feroce, sì che, dove Maria rimase giuso, ella con Cristo pianse in su la croce
Translate: And neither did she need to be faithful and proud, to the extent that, when Mary stood at the foot of the cross, she wept with the bridegroom Christ.

Original: Ma perch’ io non proceda troppo chiuso, Francesco e Povertà per questi amanti prendi oramai nel mio parlar diffuso
Translate: But so that I do not speak too darkly, you mean in all my speech that these lovers were Francis and the Poverty

Original: La lor concordia e i lor lieti sembianti, amore e maraviglia e dolce sguardo facieno esser cagion di pensier santi
Translate: Their harmony, their joyful appearance, love, wonder, and their sweet gaze produced holy thoughts in others.

Original: tanto che ’l venerabile Bernardo si scalzò prima, e dietro a tanta pace corse e, correndo, li parve esser tardo
Translate: to the point that the Venerable Bernard of Quintavalle was the first to take off his shoes and ran after that peace and, while running, seemed to him to be slow

Original: Oh ignota ricchezza
Translate: O unknown wealth

Original: oh ben ferace
Translate: or fertile good

Original: Scalzasi Egidio, scalzasi Silvestro dietro a lo sposo, sì la sposa piace
Translate: Egidio and Silvestro also take off their shoes and follow the bridegroom, so much like the bride

Original: Indi sen va quel padre e quel maestro con la sua donna e con quella famiglia che già legava l’umile capestro
Translate: Then the father and the teacher went away with his wife and his family, who had already girded his hips with the humble girdle.

Original: Né li gravò viltà di cuor le ciglia per esser fi’ di Pietro Bernardone, né per parer dispetto a maraviglia
Translate: And the cowardice of mind did not let his gaze down, being the son of Peter Bernardone, nor to be so humble as to arouse wonder.

Original: ma regalmente sua dura intenzione ad Innocenzio aperse, e da lui ebbe primo sigillo a sua religïone
Translate: But he revealed to Pope Innocent III his strict Rule with a royal attitude, and from him he had the first endorsement of his Order.

Original: Poi che la gente poverella crebbe dietro a costui, la cui mirabil vita meglio in gloria del ciel si canterebbe,
Translate: And after the poor followers increased behind Francis, whose admirable life would be better singing to the glory of Paradise,

Original: di seconda corona redimita fu per Onorio da l’Etterno Spiro la santa voglia d’esto archimandrita
Translate: the holy will of this shepherd was crowned by the Holy Spirit with a second crown, through Pope Honorius third

Original: E poi che, per la sete del martiro, ne la presenza del Soldan superba predicò Cristo e li altri che ’l seguiro,
Translate: And after, out of the desire of martyrdom, he preached Christ and his disciples in the haughty presence of the Sultan of Egypt,

Original: e per trovare a conversione acerba troppo la gente e per non stare indarno, redissi al frutto de l’italica erba,
Translate: and after he had found those peoples reluctant to conversion and not to be there in vain, he had returned to Italy,

Original: nel crudo sasso intra Tevero e Arno da Cristo prese l’ultimo sigillo, che le sue membra due anni portarno
Translate: on Mount Verna between Tiber and Arno received from Christ the last seal, which his body carried for two years

Original: Quando a colui ch’a tanto ben sortillo piacque di trarlo suso a la mercede ch’el meritò nel suo farsi pusillo,
Translate: When God, who had destined him for such a good, pleased to call him to Paradise to the reward he had earned in making himself humble,

Original: a’ frati suoi, sì com’ a giuste rede, raccomandò la donna sua più cara, e comandò che l’amassero a fede
Translate: And he commended his dearest wife to his brethren, as to her rightful heirs, and commanded them to love her by keeping her faithful.

Original: e del suo grembo l’anima preclara mover si volle, tornando al suo regno, e al suo corpo non volle altra bara
Translate: And from the womb of Poverty his illustrious soul moved, going back to Paradise, and to his body he wanted no coffin other than the bare earth.

Original: Pensa oramai qual fu colui che degno collega fu a mantener la barca di Pietro in alto mar per dritto segno
Translate: At this point you can understand who was the worthy colleague of Francis in keeping the ship of the Church in the right course, on the high seas

Original: e questo fu il nostro patrïarca
Translate: and this was our patriarch

Original: per che qual segue lui, com’ el comanda, discerner puoi che buone merce carca
Translate: And he who follows him according to his Rule, can only carry good goods.

Original: Ma ’l suo pecuglio di nova vivanda è fatto ghiotto, sì ch’esser non puote che per diversi salti non si spanda
Translate: But his flock has become greedy with new foods , so it is inevitable that it disperses in different pastures

Original: e quanto le sue pecore remote e vagabunde più da esso vanno, più tornano a l’ovil di latte vòte
Translate: And the more the sheep turn away from them, the more poor of milk they return to the fold.

Original: Ben son di quelle che temono ’l danno e stringonsi al pastor
Translate: Of course, there are some who fear the damage and cling to the shepherd,

Original: ma son sì poche, che le cappe fornisce poco panno
Translate: but they are so few that it takes little cloth to pack their hoods

Original: Or, se le mie parole non son fioche, se la tua audïenza è stata attenta,
Translate: Now, if my words aren't dark, if you've listened carefully,

Original: se ciò ch’è detto a la mente revoche,
Translate: If you call back to your mind what I said before,

Original: in parte fia la tua voglia contenta, perché vedrai la pianta onde si scheggia,
Translate: in part your wish will be satisfied, because you will see where the corruption of the Dominican Order originates,

Original: e vedra’ il corrègger che argomenta “U’ ben s’impingua, se non si vaneggia”»
Translate: and you will understand the correction that argues, "Where you get rich spiritually, if you don't deviate from the Rule."

Original: Sì tosto come l’ultima parola la benedetta fiamma per dir tolse, a rotar cominciò la santa mola
Translate: As soon as the blessed light uttered the last word, the first crown began to rotate

Original: e nel suo giro tutta non si volse prima ch’un’altra di cerchio la chiuse, e moto a moto e canto a canto colse
Translate: And he didn't make a full turn, until a second crown surrounded it, according his own motion and his own song to that of the other.

Original: canto che tanto vince nostre muse, nostre serene in quelle dolci tube, quanto primo splendor quel ch’e’ refuse
Translate: a song that wins our Museums and our Sirens in those sweet musical instruments, as much as the direct ray surpasses in splendor that reflected

Original: Come si volgon per tenera nube due archi paralelli e concolori,
Translate: As two concentric rainbows and with the same colors arc in a thin cloud,

Original: quando Iunone a sua ancella iube,
Translate: when Juno sends his Iride handmaiden to Earth

Original: nascendo di quel d’entro quel di fori, a guisa del parlar di quella vaga ch’amor consunse come sol vapori,
Translate: For the outer one is the reflection of the inner one, just as the sound of the nymph Eco, which was consumed by love as a vapour is by the sun.

Original: e fanno qui la gente esser presaga, per lo patto che Dio con Noè puose, del mondo che già mai più non s’allaga
Translate: And how rainbows reassure men that there will be no second Flood, for the covenant between God and Noah.

Original: così di quelle sempiterne rose volgiensi circa noi le due ghirlande, e sì l’estrema a l’intima rispuose
Translate: So the two crowns of those eternal lights revolved around us, and the outer one was in perfect harmony with the inner one.

Original: Poi che ’l tripudio e l’altra festa grande, sì del cantare e sì del fiammeggiarsi luce con luce gaudïose e blande,
Translate: After the joy and great feast of singing and bright glow, made each other by those lights full of happiness and charity,

Original: insieme a punto e a voler quetarsi, pur come li occhi ch’al piacer che i move conviene insieme chiudere e levarsi
Translate: they stopped at the same moment and for a concerted will, just like the eyes that, obeying the pleasure, open and close simultaneously

Original: del cor de l’una de le luci nove si mosse voce, che l’ago a la stella parer mi fece in volgermi al suo dove
Translate: from within one of the new lights came a voice, which led me to turn towards it like the needle of the compass toward the Polar Star

Original: e cominciò
Translate: and began

Original: «L’amor che mi fa bella mi tragge a ragionar de l’altro duca per cui del mio sì ben ci si favella
Translate: "The charity that embellishes me moves me to speak of the other Christian leader, for whom here is spoken so well of my

Original: Degno è che, dov’ è l’un, l’altro s’induca
Translate: It's right that we talk about one, if we talk about the other.

Original: sì che, com’ elli ad una militaro, così la gloria loro insieme luca
Translate: so that, because they fought together, their glory may shine in unison.

Original: L’essercito di Cristo, che sì caro costò a rïarmar, dietro a la ’nsegna si movea tardo, sospeccioso e raro,
Translate: The army of Christ, which was rearmed at such a high price, moved behind the slow signs, with hesitation and little number,

Original: quando lo ’mperador che sempre regna provide a la milizia, ch’era in forse, per sola grazia, non per esser degna
Translate: when the emperor who reigns forever provided the militia that was in danger, not that it might be worthy of it but by his grace

Original: e, come è detto, a sua sposa soccorse con due campioni, al cui fare, al cui dire lo popol disvïato si raccorse
Translate: And, as Thomas said, he helped his bride with two champions, whose deeds and words caused the people who were disbanded to repent.

Original: In quella parte ove surge ad aprire Zefiro dolce le novelle fronde di che si vede Europa rivestire,
Translate: In that part of Europe where the zephyric wind comes to give birth to the new branches that then green the continent,

Original: non molto lungi al percuoter de l’onde dietro a le quali, per la lunga foga,
Translate: not far from the coasts bathed by the Ocean, behind which, after a long journey

Original: lo sol talvolta ad ogne uom si nasconde,
Translate: the sun sometimes sets,

Original: siede la fortunata Calaroga sotto la protezion del grande scudo in che soggiace il leone e soggioga
Translate: rises the lucky city of Calaruega, under the protection of the coat of arms of Castile in which the lion stands below and above the tower

Original: dentro vi nacque l’amoroso drudo de la fede cristiana, il santo atleta benigno a’ suoi e a’ nemici crudo
Translate: there was born the loving vassal of the Christian Faith, the holy defender of the Church, benevolent with hers and cruel with her enemies

Original: e come fu creata, fu repleta sì la sua mente di viva vertute che, ne la madre, lei fece profeta
Translate: and as soon as his mind was created, it was immediately filled with lively virtue, which led his mother to have a prophetic dream before he was born.

Original: Poi che le sponsalizie fuor compiute al sacro fonte intra lui e la Fede, u’ si dotar di mutüa salute,
Translate: After the wedding was celebrated at the baptismal fountain between him and the Faith, where they gave each other salvation,

Original: la donna che per lui l’assenso diede, vide nel sonno il mirabile frutto ch’uscir dovea di lui e de le rede
Translate: The woman who made him a godmother saw in a dream the marvelous fruit that was to be produced by him and his heirs.

Original: e perché fosse qual era in costrutto, quinci si mosse spirito a nomarlo del possessivo di cui era tutto
Translate: And so that his name might correspond to his character, from here came an inspiration to call him possessive, to whom he belonged totally.

Original: Domenico fu detto
Translate: He was baptized Domenico

Original: e io ne parlo sì come de l’agricola che Cristo elesse a l’orto suo per aiutarlo
Translate: and I speak of him as the peasant whom Christ chose as a helper in his garden.

Original: Ben parve messo e famigliar di Cristo
Translate: He looked just like an envoy and a servant of Christ

Original: che ’l primo amor che ’n lui fu manifesto, fu al primo consiglio che diè Cristo
Translate: For the first love that was seen in him was turned to the first counsel given by Christ.

Original: Spesse fïate fu tacito e desto trovato in terra da la sua nutrice, come dicesse
Translate: Many times his nurse found him awake and on the ground, as if saying,

Original: ‘Io son venuto a questo’
Translate: 'I was born for this.'

Original: Oh padre suo veramente Felice
Translate: Oh, how happy the father was.

Original: oh madre sua veramente Giovanna, se, interpretata, val come si dice
Translate: Oh, how much the mother was Joan, if the interpretation of her name is correct

Original: Non per lo mondo, per cui mo s’affanna di retro ad Ostïense e a Taddeo,
Translate: Not for earthly goods, so we are busy behind the canonical law manuals of Ostiense and Taddeo,

Original: ma per amor de la verace manna in picciol tempo gran dottor si feo
Translate: but for the sake of divine wisdom, in a short time he became a great expert in theology

Original: tal che si mise a circüir la vigna che tosto imbianca, se ’l vignaio è reo
Translate: so much so that he immediately began to guard the vineyard of Christ, which soon becomes dry if the vinemaker neglects his duty

Original: E a la sedia che fu già benigna più a’ poveri giusti, non per lei, ma per colui che siede, che traligna,
Translate: And to the pontifical throne, which was once more benevolent to the righteous poor, not by his own error but by that of the pope, who deviates from the right path,

Original: non dispensare o due o tre per sei, non la fortuna di prima vacante, non decimas, quae sunt pauperum Dei, addimandò,
Translate: asked not to give a third or half of the goods to the poor, not to occupy the first empty ecclesiastical benefit, not the tithes, which are of the poor of God,

Original: ma contro al mondo errante licenza di combatter per lo seme del qual ti fascian ventiquattro piante
Translate: but permission to fight the heresies in the name of that seed from which the twenty-four plants that now surround you are born

Original: Poi, con dottrina e con volere insieme, con l’officio appostolico si mosse quasi torrente ch’alta vena preme
Translate: Then, with doctrine and will, obtained papal approval, he moved like a stream flowing from a high source

Original: e ne li sterpi eretici percosse l’impeto suo, più vivamente quivi dove le resistenze eran più grosse
Translate: and his strong strength struck the heretical dung, with greater strength where there was greater stamina.

Original: Di lui si fecer poi diversi rivi onde l’orto catolico si riga, sì che i suoi arbuscelli stan più vivi
Translate: From him were born later other streams that irrigate the garden of the Church, so that its plants are revived

Original: Se tal fu l’una rota de la biga in che la Santa Chiesa si difese e vinse in campo la sua civil briga,
Translate: If a wheel of the chariot with which the Holy Church defended itself and won its internal battle against the heresies was such,

Original: ben ti dovrebbe assai esser palese l’eccellenza de l’altra, di cui Tomma dinanzi al mio venir fu sì cortese
Translate: You should easily understand the excellence of the other, about which Thomas spoke so politely before my arrival

Original: Ma l’orbita che fé la parte somma di sua circunferenza, è derelitta, sì ch’è la muffa dov’ era la gromma
Translate: But the groove drawn from the top of the wheel is now abandoned, so much so that there is mold where before there was gromma

Original: La sua famiglia, che si mosse dritta coi piedi a le sue orme, è tanto volta, che quel dinanzi a quel di retro gitta
Translate: His followers, who before followed with their feet the footsteps of Francis, are now so deviant that they walk backwards.

Original: e tosto si vedrà de la ricolta de la mala coltura, quando il loglio si lagnerà che l’arca li sia tolta
Translate: and soon we will see the harvest of this bad crop, when the loam will complain not to be put in the barn

Original: Ben dico, chi cercasse a foglio a foglio nostro volume, ancor troveria carta u’ leggerebbe “I’ mi son quel ch’i’ soglio”
Translate: I state, however, that if someone scrolls through the entire volume of our paper, they will still find pages in which they read "I am what I must be"

Original: ma non fia da Casal né d’Acquasparta, là onde vegnon tali a la scrittura, ch’uno la fugge e altro la coarta
Translate: but it will not be the case of Ubertino da Casale or Matthew of Acquasparta, from where they come from such friars that one flees from the Franciscan Rule, the other stiffens it

Original: Io son la vita di Bonaventura da Bagnoregio, che ne’ grandi offici sempre pospuosi la sinistra cura
Translate: I am the soul of Bonaventura from Bagnoregio, who in the high positions that I have held I always put in the background the cure for worldly goods

Original: Illuminato e Augustin son quici, che fuor de’ primi scalzi poverelli che nel capestro a Dio si fero amici
Translate: Here are Illuminated by Rieti and Augustine from Assisi, who were among the first followers of Francis who went barefoot in poverty, becoming friends of God in the Franciscan girdle

Original: Ugo da San Vittore è qui con elli, e Pietro Mangiadore e Pietro Spano, lo qual giù luce in dodici libelli
Translate: Ugo da San Vittore is here with them, and Pietro Mangiadore and Pietro da Lisbon, who shines on Earth in the twelve booklets he wrote

Original: Natàn profeta e ’l metropolitano Crisostomo e Anselmo e quel Donato ch’a la prim’ arte degnò porre mano
Translate: There are the prophet Nathan and the metropolitan John Chrysostom, Anselm of Aosta and that Helium Donatus who wrote a grammar treatise

Original: Rabano è qui, e lucemi dallato il calavrese abate Giovacchino di spirito profetico dotato
Translate: Here is Rabano Mauro, and he who shines by my side is the Calabrian Abbot Joachim of Flower, endowed with prophetic abilities

Original: Ad inveggiar cotanto paladino mi mosse l’infiammata cortesia di fra Tommaso e ’l discreto latino
Translate: He moved me to praise such a paladin of the Church the ardent courtesy of St Thomas, and his elegant speech

Original: e mosse meco questa compagnia»
Translate: And he moved me and these other souls to come here.

Original: Imagini, chi bene intender cupe quel ch’i’ or vidi
Translate: Who wants to understand well what I saw, images,

Original: "e ritegna l’image, mentre ch’io dico, come ferma rupe",
Translate: "and as I speak, keep the image fixed in his mind, like a rock."

Original: quindici stelle che ’n diverse plage lo ciel avvivan di tanto sereno che soperchia de l’aere ogne compage
Translate: fifteen stars that at different points of the sky illuminate him in such a way as to overcome every nebulae

Original: imagini quel carro a cu’ il seno basta del nostro cielo e notte e giorno,
Translate: images then the Chariot of the Bear Major, to which the space of our pole is sufficient for day and night motion,

Original: sì ch’al volger del temo non vien meno
Translate: so that at the turn of its rudder it never sets

Original: imagini la bocca di quel corno che si comincia in punta de lo stelo a cui la prima rota va dintorno,
Translate: picture the lower part of that horn that has the vertex at the tip of the axis around which the Primo Mobile rotates,

Original: aver fatto di sé due segni in cielo, qual fece la figliuola di Minoi allora che sentì di morte il gelo
Translate: as if they had formed two crowns in heaven, like that in which the daughter of Minos, near death, was transmuted.

Original: e l’un ne l’altro aver li raggi suoi, e amendue girarsi per maniera che l’uno andasse al primo e l’altro al poi
Translate: and images that these two crowns, concentric, rotate so that each goes in the opposite direction

Original: e avrà quasi l’ombra de la vera costellazione e de la doppia danza che circulava il punto dov’ io era
Translate: and will have almost a shadow of the true constellation and the double dance surrounding the spot where I was

Original: poi ch’è tanto di là da nostra usanza, quanto di là dal mover de la Chiana si move il ciel che tutti li altri avanza
Translate: in fact that show transcends so much the things of the world, as the slow flow of Chiana is surpassed by the Primo Mobile, the fastest Heaven of all

Original: Lì si cantò non Bacco, non Peana, ma tre persone in divina natura, e in una persona essa e l’umana
Translate: There he was not chanting to the Bacchus or Apollos gods, but to the three people of the Trinity and to the dual nature of Christ.

Original: Compié ’l cantare e ’l volger sua misura
Translate: The song and the dance of the blessed took place

Original: e attesersi a noi quei santi lumi, felicitando sé di cura in cura
Translate: and those holy lights turned to us, joyful to pass from one cure to another.

Original: Ruppe il silenzio ne’ concordi numi poscia la luce in che mirabil vita del poverel di Dio narrata fumi,
Translate: After breaking the silence of those blessed concordants was the light that had previously told me the wonderful life of the poor man of God,

Original: e disse
Translate: and said,

Original: «Quando l’una paglia è trita, quando la sua semenza è già riposta, a batter l’altra dolce amor m’invita
Translate: When some of the ears were threshed and the seeds placed in the barn, God's sweet love invites me to thresh the other side

Original: Tu credi che nel petto onde la costa si trasse per formar la bella guancia il cui palato a tutto ’l mondo costa,
Translate: You believe that in the breast of Adam, from where the rib was taken to create the beautiful cheek whose palate cost humanity original sin,

Original: e in quel che, forato da la lancia, e prima e poscia tanto sodisfece,
Translate: and in the breast of Christ who, pierced by the spear, redeemed all men lived before and after by the same original sin,

Original: che d’ogne colpa vince la bilancia, quantunque a la natura umana lece aver di lume, tutto fosse infuso da quel valor che l’uno e l’altro fece
Translate: All wisdom that is lawful to human nature was infused, by God himself who created one and the other.

Original: e però miri a ciò ch’io dissi suso, quando narrai che non ebbe ’l secondo lo ben che ne la quinta luce è chiuso
Translate: and therefore marvel at what I said before, when I explained that the blessed shut up in the fifth light did not have another like him.

Original: Or apri li occhi a quel ch’io ti rispondo, e vedräi il tuo credere e ’l mio dire nel vero farsi come centro in tondo
Translate: Now, listen carefully to what I will explain to you, and you will see that your conviction and my words are part of the same truth.

Original: Ciò che non more e ciò che può morire non è se non splendor di quella idea che partorisce, amando, il nostro Sire
Translate: What is incorruptible and what is corruptible is nothing but a reflection of that Idea which our Lord, loving, generates with the Holy Spirit

Original: ché quella viva luce che sì mea dal suo lucente, che non si disuna da lui né da l’amor ch’a lor s’intrea,
Translate: because that bright light that emanates from the one who generates it, that does not disunite from Him or from the Holy Spirit who fits as a third among them,

Original: per sua bontate il suo raggiare aduna, quasi specchiato, in nove sussistenze, etternalmente rimanendosi una
Translate: for his goodness gathers his rays in the nine angelic choirs, as mirroring himself, remaining eternally one person

Original: Quindi discende a l’ultime potenze giù d’atto in atto, tanto divenendo, che più non fa che brevi contingenze
Translate: From here he descends to the material creatures, from Heaven to Heaven, reducing himself to the point that he produces only ephemeral things

Original: e queste contingenze essere intendo le cose generate, che produce con seme e sanza seme il ciel movendo
Translate: and I mean that these ephemeral things are the things generated, that Heaven by their motion create with seed or without

Original: La cera di costoro e chi la duce non sta d’un modo
Translate: The matter of these creatures and the heavenly influence are not equal

Original: e però sotto ’l segno idëale poi più e men traluce
Translate: and therefore they reflect to a greater or lesser extent the divine idea that seals them

Original: Ond’ elli avvien ch’un medesimo legno, secondo specie, meglio e peggio frutta
Translate: This is why it happens that trees of the same species bear fruit in a better and worse way.

Original: e voi nascete con diverso ingegno
Translate: and you men are born with different dispositions

Original: Se fosse a punto la cera dedutta e fosse il cielo in sua virtù supprema, la luce del suggel parrebbe tutta
Translate: If matter were the best possible and Heaven exercised its virtue to the highest degree, then the divine light would appear perfectly

Original: ma la natura la dà sempre scema, similemente operando a l’artista ch’a l’abito de l’arte ha man che trema
Translate: but nature presents matter always in an imperfect way, operating like the artist who has a trembling hand while exercising his art

Original: Però se ’l caldo amor la chiara vista de la prima virtù dispone e segna, tutta la perfezion quivi s’acquista
Translate: Therefore, if the Holy Spirit imprints the light of divine power, then the created thing is fully perfect

Original: Così fu fatta già la terra degna di tutta l’animal perfezïone
Translate: Thus the Earth was created worthy of all the perfection of the animated beings

Original: così fu fatta la Vergine pregna
Translate: so the Virgin was put pregnant

Original: sì ch’io commendo tua oppinïone, che l’umana natura mai non fue né fia qual fu in quelle due persone
Translate: So I approve of your opinion, that human nature was never perfect, nor will it ever be perfect, as in those two people.

Original: Or s’i’ non procedesse avanti più,
Translate: Now, if I didn't say anything else,

Original: ‘Dunque, come costui fu sanza pare?’
Translate: 'So, how can it be that Solomon was unparalleled?'

Original: comincerebber le parole tue
Translate: You'd start to say

Original: Ma perché paia ben ciò che non pare, pensa chi era, e la cagion che ’l mosse, quando fu detto “Chiedi”, a dimandare
Translate: But that this truth might be clearly raised up, he thought who it was, and what reason moved him to ask for wisdom when God invited him to ask what he wanted.

Original: Non ho parlato sì, che tu non posse ben veder ch’el fu re, che chiese senno acciò che re sufficïente fosse
Translate: I have not spoken so that you cannot understand that he was king, and that he asked for wisdom to carry out his office as ruler in a proper manner.

Original: non per sapere il numero in che enno li motor di qua sù, o se necesse con contingente mai necesse fenno
Translate: not to know the number of angels, or whether a necessary premise and a contingent have ever produced a necessary consequence

Original: non si est dare primum motum esse, o se del mezzo cerchio far si puote trïangol sì ch’un retto non avesse
Translate: not to know if a first motion is permissible not generated by another motion, or if in a semicircle you can write a triangle not rectangular

Original: Onde, se ciò ch’io dissi e questo note, regal prudenza è quel vedere impari in che lo stral di mia intenzion percuote
Translate: Then, if you think of this and of what I said before, behold, that unparalleled wisdom which I intended to understand is nothing but the wisdom of a king.

Original: e se al “surse” drizzi li occhi chiari, vedrai aver solamente respetto ai regi, che son molti, e ’ buon son rari
