Translate: And if you think about when I said "surse," you'll understand that I just wanted to refer to the kings, which are many, while the good kings are rare

Original: Con questa distinzion prendi ’l mio detto
Translate: Interpret my words with these distinctions

Original: e così puote star con quel che credi del primo padre e del nostro Diletto
Translate: And so they agree perfectly with what you believe of the first father and our beloved.

Original: E questo ti sia sempre piombo a’ piedi, per farti mover lento com’ uom lasso e al sì e al no che tu non vedi
Translate: And this always induces you to proceed with the feet of lead, with the caution of those who walk slowly and tired, when you judge of something that you cannot comprehend

Original: ché quelli è tra li stolti bene a basso, che sanza distinzione afferma e nega ne l’un così come ne l’altro passo
Translate: For he who affirms or denies one thing without thought is foolish, both in one case and in another.

Original: perch’ elli ’ncontra che più volte piega l’oppinïon corrente in falsa parte, e poi l’affetto l’intelletto lega
Translate: and it often happens that current opinion pushes towards a false conviction, and then love for one's own idea prevents the intellect from reasoning

Original: Vie più che ’ndarno da riva si parte, perché non torna tal qual e’ si move, chi pesca per lo vero e non ha l’arte
Translate: Not only in vain but also with damage he leaves the shore who goes fishing for the truth and is not capable of it, because he does not return to the condition with which he left

Original: E di ciò sono al mondo aperte prove Parmenide, Melisso e Brisso e molti, li quali andaro e non sapëan dove
Translate: And this in the world is shown by Parmenides, Melissus, and Brison, who went without knowing where they were going.

Original: sì fé Sabellio e Arrio e quelli stolti che furon come spade a le Scritture in render torti li diritti volti
Translate: So did Sabellius and Arius and those fools who were like swords to the Scriptures, deforming their regular faces.

Original: Non sien le genti, ancor, troppo sicure a giudicar, sì come quei che stima le biade in campo pria che sien mature
Translate: The nations, moreover, are not too hasty to judge, like the one who calculates the value of the crops when they are not yet ripe in the field.

Original: ch’i’ ho veduto tutto ’l verno prima lo prun mostrarsi rigido e feroce, poscia portar la rosa in su la cima
Translate: For I have seen the plum all winter long, dry and barren, and then in spring make a rose blossom on its branch.

Original: e legno vidi già dritto e veloce correr lo mar per tutto suo cammino, perire al fine a l’intrar de la foce
Translate: and I saw a ship proceed fast and fast along its course, and then sink at the entrance to the port.

Original: Non creda donna Berta e ser Martino, per vedere un furare, altro offerere, vederli dentro al consiglio divino
Translate: Don't believe woman Berta and Ser Martino that if they see a man stealing and another making pious offerings, they are already judged by God

Original: ché quel può surgere, e quel può cadere»
Translate: in fact the first can be saved, the other can end up damned

Original: Dal centro al cerchio, e sì dal cerchio al centro movesi l’acqua in un ritondo vaso, secondo ch’è percosso fuori o dentro
Translate: The water in a round pot moves from the center to the edge and vice versa, depending on whether the pot is hit outside or inside

Original: ne la mia mente fé sùbito caso questo ch’io dico, sì come si tacque la glorïosa vita di Tommaso,
Translate: This thing that I say suddenly came to my mind, as soon as the glorious soul of St Thomas was silent,

Original: per la similitudine che nacque del suo parlare e di quel di Beatrice, a cui sì cominciar, dopo lui, piacque
Translate: because of the similarity between his words and those of Beatrice, to whom he liked to start speaking after him.

Original: «A costui fa mestieri, e nol vi dice né con la voce né pensando ancora, d’un altro vero andare a la radice
Translate: "This one, even though he does not tell you with the voice or formulate the thought, serves to go to the root of another truth.

Original: Diteli se la luce onde s’infiora vostra sustanza, rimarrà con voi etternalmente sì com’ ell’ è ora
Translate: Tell him if the light of which your soul beautifies will remain with you for eternity, with the same splendor

Original: e se rimane, dite come, poi che sarete visibili rifatti, esser porà ch’al veder non vi nòi»
Translate: and if he remains, tell him how, after he has clothed you with your body, it will not harm your sight.

Original: Come, da più letizia pinti e tratti, a la fïata quei che vanno a rota levan la voce e rallegrano li atti,
Translate: As sometimes those who dance in circles, driven by greater joy, raise their voices and make their gestures more joyful,

Original: così, a l’orazion pronta e divota, li santi cerchi mostrar nova gioia nel torneare e ne la mira nota
Translate: So those holy crowns showed new happiness to that ready and devoted prayer of Beatrice, turning and singing admirably.

Original: Qual si lamenta perché qui si moia per viver colà sù, non vide quive lo refrigerio de l’etterna ploia
Translate: Those who complain that one dies on Earth to live in Heaven have not seen in this place the refreshment of eternal rain.

Original: Quell’ uno e due e tre che sempre vive e regna sempre in tre e ’n due e ’n uno, non circunscritto,
Translate: That God who is one and triune and lives always and reigns in this Trinity, not circumscribed

Original: e tutto circunscrive, tre volte era cantato da ciascuno di quelli spirti con tal melodia, ch’ad ogne merto saria giusto muno
Translate: And so as to limit all things, it was sung three times by those spirits with such a melody that it would be the right reward to all merit.

Original: E io udi’ ne la luce più dia del minor cerchio una voce modesta, forse qual fu da l’angelo a Maria, risponder
Translate: And I heard in the brightest light of the inner crown a modest voice, perhaps similar to that of the archangel Gabriel to Mary in the Annunciation, which answered,

Original: Se la gente ch’al mondo più traligna non fosse stata a Cesare noverca, ma come madre a suo figlio benigna, tal fatto è fiorentino e cambia e merca, che si sarebbe vòlto a Simifonti, là dove andava l’avolo a la cerca
Translate: If the people in the world who deviated most from the rules had not been stepmothers to the emperor, but had been a loving mother to their son, certain new Florentines who wanted to change currencies and to haggle would have remained at Semifonte, where their ancestors went to ask for alms.

Original: sariesi Montemurlo ancor de’ Conti
Translate: Montemurlo would still be Conti

Original: sarieno i Cerchi nel piovier d’Acone, e forse in Valdigrieve i Buondelmonti
Translate: The Circles would still be in the Pleasure of Acone, and perhaps the Buondelmonti would remain in the Val di Greve

Original: Sempre la confusion de le persone principio fu del mal de la cittade, come del vostro il cibo che s’appone
Translate: The mingling of the people has always caused the evil of the cities, as the addition of food to other undigested is a source of evil.

Original: e cieco toro più avaccio cade che cieco agnello
Translate: and a blind bull falls faster than a blind lamb

Original: e molte volte taglia più e meglio una che le cinque spade
Translate: and often one sword cuts more and better than five swords together

Original: Se tu riguardi Luni e Orbisaglia come sono ite,
Translate: If you consider how Luni and Orbisaglia fell into ruins,

Original: e come se ne vanno di retro ad esse Chiusi e Sinigaglia,
Translate: And as they go after them, Chiusi and Senigallia,

Original: udir come le schiatte si disfanno non ti parrà nova cosa né forte, poscia che le cittadi termine hanno
Translate: It will not seem like something unheard of or hard to believe to feel how the houses are decaying, since even the cities have an end

Original: Le vostre cose tutte hanno lor morte, sì come voi
Translate: The earthly things are all mortal, just like you.

Original: ma celasi in alcuna che dura molto, e le vite son corte
Translate: This is less visible to me in some things that last very long, while human life is much shorter.

Original: E come ’l volger del ciel de la luna cuopre e discuopre i liti sanza posa, così fa di Fiorenza la Fortuna
Translate: And as the Moon with its phases covers and uncovers the shores, so the Fortune does with the fate of Florence

Original: per che non dee parer mirabil cosa ciò ch’io dirò de li alti Fiorentini onde è la fama nel tempo nascosa
Translate: So it mustn't seem strange what I'm going to say about the great Florentine families, whose fame has been erased from time

Original: Io vidi li Ughi e vidi i Catellini, Filippi, Greci, Ormanni e Alberichi, già nel calare, illustri cittadini
Translate: I saw the Ughi and the Catellini, the Philippi, the Greeks, the Ormanni and the Hotels which were illustrious citizens, even then when they declined

Original: e vidi così grandi come antichi, con quel de la Sannella, quel de l’Arca, e Soldanieri e Ardinghi e Bostichi
Translate: And I saw anciently powerful families, the Sannellas, the Arks, the Soldiers, the Ardings, and the Bosticians.

Original: Sovra la porta ch’al presente è carca di nova fellonia di tanto peso che tosto fia iattura de la barca,
Translate: At the door that today is charged with the new fellonia , so heavy that soon it will be the misfortune of the whole boat ,

Original: erano i Ravignani, ond’ è disceso il conte Guido e qualunque del nome de l’alto Bellincione ha poscia preso
Translate: The Ravignani lived, from which Count Guido descended, and whoever later took the name from Bellincione.

Original: Quel de la Pressa sapeva già come regger si vuole, e avea Galigaio dorata in casa sua già l’elsa e ’l pome
Translate: The family of the Pressa already knew how to rule, and the Galigai had already in the house the hilt and the handle of the golden sword

Original: Grand’ era già la colonna del Vaio, Sacchetti, Giuochi, Fifanti e Barucci e Galli e quei ch’arrossan per lo staio
Translate: The coat of arms of the Vaio was already famous, as well as the Bags, the Giuochi, the Fifanti, the Barucci, the Gauls and those who blush for the fraud of the Staio

Original: Lo ceppo di che nacquero i Calfucci era già grande, e già eran tratti a le curule Sizii e Arrigucci
Translate: The stock from which the Calfuccis were born was already large, and the Sizi and Arrigucci were already led to political office.

Original: Oh quali io vidi quei che son disfatti per lor superbia
Translate: Oh, how powerful they were then those who were destroyed by their pride

Original: e le palle de l’oro fiorian Fiorenza in tutt’ i suoi gran fatti
Translate: and the coat of arms of the golden balls made Florence illustrious in all the illustrious feats

Original: Così facieno i padri di coloro che, sempre che la vostra chiesa vaca, si fanno grassi stando a consistoro
Translate: So did the ancestors of those who now take advantage of the fact that the bishop's seat is vacant.

Original: L’oltracotata schiatta che s’indraca dietro a chi fugge, e a chi mostra ’l dente o ver la borsa, com’ agnel si placa,
Translate: The heartbreaking family who unleashes after those who flee, as they soothe like a lamb before those who show their teeth or purse,

Original: già venìa sù, ma di picciola gente
Translate: was already powerful but had humble origins

Original: sì che non piacque ad Ubertin Donato che poï il suocero il fé lor parente
Translate: For to Ubertino Donati it pleased him not that his father-in-law had related him to them.

Original: Già era ’l Caponsacco nel mercato disceso giù da Fiesole, e già era buon cittadino Giuda e Infangato
Translate: The Caponsacchi had already come down from Fiesole and lived in Mercato Vecchio, and had already become citizens of the Judas and the Muds.

Original: Io dirò cosa incredibile e vera
Translate: I'm gonna say something incredible even though it's true.

Original: nel picciol cerchio s’entrava per porta che si nomava da quei de la Pera
Translate: In the ancient wall circle you entered through the gate that took its name from the Della Pera

Original: Ciascun che de la bella insegna porta del gran barone il cui nome e ’l cui pregio la festa di Tommaso riconforta,
Translate: All those who gave themselves the beautiful sign of the great Baron, whose name and honor is celebrated on the day of St Thomas,

Original: da esso ebbe milizia e privilegio
Translate: And they had the charge of him, and the privilege of a knight:

Original: avvegna che con popol si rauni oggi colui che la fascia col fregio
Translate: even though today one who adorns her with the gold frieze is parting for the people.

Original: Già eran Gualterotti e Importuni
Translate: The Gualterotti and the Importuni were already present.

Original: e ancor saria Borgo più quïeto, se di novi vicin fosser digiuni
Translate: and Borgo Santi Apostoli would be quieter if he had not purchased new neighbors

Original: La casa di che nacque il vostro fleto, per lo giusto disdegno che v’ha morti e puose fine al vostro viver lieto,
Translate: The house from which your misfortunes were born, because of the righteous disdain that brought you to ruin and put an end to your joyful life,

Original: era onorata, essa e suoi consorti
Translate: She was honored with her consorts

Original: o Buondelmonte, quanto mal fuggisti le nozze süe per li altrui conforti
Translate: O Buondelmonte, how evil did you escape the wedding, following the counsel of others?

Original: Molti sarebber lieti, che son tristi, se Dio t’avesse conceduto ad Ema la prima volta ch’a città venisti
Translate: If God had drowned you in Emah, the first time you came to the city, many who are sad today would be glad.

Original: Ma conveniesi a quella pietra scema che guarda ’l ponte, che Fiorenza fesse vittima ne la sua pace postrema
Translate: But it was destined that Florence would make you a victim, in his last period of peace, at that fragment of statue next to the bridge.

Original: Con queste genti, e con altre con esse, vid’ io Fiorenza in sì fatto riposo, che non avea cagione onde piangesse
Translate: I saw Florence with these and other families in such peace, that there were no reasons for weeping or mourning

Original: Con queste genti vid’io glorïoso e giusto il popol suo,
Translate: with these families I saw the Florentine people so glorious and righteous

Original: tanto che ’l giglio non era ad asta mai posto a ritroso, né per divisïon fatto vermiglio»
Translate: so much that the lily had never been dragged into the dust with the rod overturned, nor had it yet become red by internal divisions.

Original: Qual venne a Climenè, per accertarsi di ciò ch’avëa incontro a sé udito, quei ch’ancor fa li padri ai figli scarsi
Translate: Like the one who still causes his fathers not to be condescending, he went to Climene to have reassurances about what he had heard against himself,

Original: tal era io, e tal era sentito e da Beatrice e da la santa lampa che pria per me avea mutato sito
Translate: so was I, and so was I perceived both by Beatrice and by the holy light that had previously changed position for me

Original: Per che mia donna «Manda fuor la vampa del tuo disio», mi disse,
Translate: Therefore my woman, "Manifest thy desire," she said to me,

Original: «sì ch’ella esca segnata bene de la interna stampa
Translate: so that it is expressed according to your thoughts

Original: non perché nostra conoscenza cresca per tuo parlare, ma perché t’ausi a dir la sete, sì che l’uom ti mesca»
Translate: not because we need your words to know him, but that you may become accustomed to manifesting your desires, so that they may be fulfilled.

Original: «O cara piota mia che sì t’insusi, che, come veggion le terrene menti non capere in trïangol due ottusi,
Translate: "O my dear forefather, who raises you to such an extent that, as earthly minds see that in a triangle there cannot be two dull corners,

Original: così vedi le cose contingenti anzi che sieno in sé, mirando il punto a cui tutti li tempi son presenti
Translate: So you see the contingent things before they happen, looking at the point where he is an eternal present.

Original: mentre ch’io era a Virgilio congiunto su per lo monte che l’anime cura e discendendo nel mondo defunto,
Translate: while I was led by Virgil, going up the mountain that purifies souls and descending into the world of the dead,

Original: dette mi fuor di mia vita futura parole gravi, avvegna ch’io mi senta ben tetragono ai colpi di ventura
Translate: I was told serious words about my future life, even though I am well prepared to bear the blows of misfortune.

Original: per che la voglia mia saria contenta d’intender qual fortuna mi s’appressa
Translate: So I want to know what destiny awaits me.

Original: ché saetta previsa vien più lenta»
Translate: In fact, an expected arrow arrives more slowly.

Original: Così diss’ io a quella luce stessa che pria m’avea parlato
Translate: So I said to the same light that he had spoken to me before.

Original: e come volle Beatrice, fu la mia voglia confessa
Translate: and my desire was expressed, just as Beatrice wanted.

Original: Né per ambage, in che la gente folle già s’inviscava pria che fosse anciso l’Agnel di Dio che le peccata tolle,
Translate: not with crooked words, in which the Gentiles became intertwined long before the Lamb of God, who took away the sins of the world, was crucified,

Original: ma per chiare parole e con preciso latin rispuose quello amor paterno, chiuso e parvente del suo proprio riso
Translate: but with clear words and clear speech that loving father answered me, wrapped and shining in the light of his smile

Original: «La contingenza, che fuor del quaderno de la vostra matera non si stende, tutta è dipinta nel cospetto etterno
Translate: The contingent events, which do not extend outside your earthly world, are all painted in the mind of God

Original: necessità però quindi non prende se non come dal viso in che si specchia nave che per torrente giù discende
Translate: but they are not necessary for this, as is not the fact that a boat descends the current just because someone observes it

Original: Da indi, sì come viene ad orecchia dolce armonia da organo, mi viene a vista il tempo che ti s’apparecchia
Translate: From there comes to me the time that prepares for you, as the sweet harmony of an organ comes to the ear

Original: Qual si partio Ipolito d’Atene per la spietata e perfida noverca, tal di Fiorenza partir ti convene
Translate: You will inevitably leave Florence, as Ippolito left Athens because of the ruthless and wicked stepmother

Original: Questo si vuole e questo già si cerca, e tosto verrà fatto a chi ciò pensa là dove Cristo tutto dì si merca
Translate: This is what one wants and seeks to carry it out, and it will soon be accomplished, by those who think of this where Christ is commodified every day.

Original: La colpa seguirà la parte offensa in grido, come suol
Translate: The blame will be placed on the defeated part through fame, as usual

Original: ma la vendetta fia testimonio al ver che la dispensa
Translate: But punishment will make the truth clear to all.

Original: Tu lascerai ogne cosa diletta più caramente
Translate: You will leave everything you love the most

Original: e questo è quello strale che l’arco de lo essilio pria saetta
Translate: and this is the penalty that exile makes you try first

Original: Tu proverai sì come sa di sale lo pane altrui, e come è duro calle lo scendere e ’l salir per l’altrui scale
Translate: You will feel how bitter the bread of others is, and how hard it is to go up and down the stairs of others.

Original: E quel che più ti graverà le spalle, sarà la compagnia malvagia e scempia con la qual tu cadrai in questa valle
Translate: And what will be most annoying to you will be the evil and crazy company with which you will have to share the exile

Original: che tutta ingrata, tutta matta ed empia si farà contr’ a te
Translate: For she shall become all ungrateful, and stupid, and unjust against thee.

Original: ma, poco appresso, ella, non tu, n’avrà rossa la tempia
Translate: But shortly afterwards, it will be them and not you who have red temples

Original: Di sua bestialitate il suo processo farà la prova
Translate: What will happen to them will prove their madness

Original: sì ch’a te fia bello averti fatta parte per te stesso
Translate: so that it may have been good for you to be separated from it.

Original: Lo primo tuo refugio e ’l primo ostello sarà la cortesia del gran Lombardo che ’n su la scala porta il santo uccello
Translate: Your first refuge and your first abode will be the courtesy of the great Lombard, who carries the sacred bird on the ladder of his coat of arms.

Original: ch’in te avrà sì benigno riguardo, che del fare e del chieder, tra voi due, fia primo quel che tra li altri è più tardo
Translate: He will have so kind regard for you, that between you two favors will precede the demands, contrary to what happens

Original: Con lui vedrai colui che ’mpresso fue, nascendo, sì da questa stella forte, che notabili fier l’opere sue
Translate: Together with him you will know what, at birth, was so influenced by this planet that its exploits will be extraordinary

Original: Non se ne son le genti ancora accorte per la novella età, ché pur nove anni son queste rote intorno di lui torte
Translate: People haven't noticed yet because of his young age, because these Heavens have only revolved around him nine years

Original: ma pria che ’l Guasco l’alto Arrigo inganni, parran faville de la sua virtute in non curar d’argento né d’affanni
Translate: But before the Guasco deceives the high Arrigo VII of Luxembourg, he will show sparks of its value in the carelessness of money and trouble

Original: Le sue magnificenze conosciute saranno ancora, sì che ’ suoi nemici non ne potran tener le lingue mute
Translate: His deeds shall be known to all, so that his enemies shall not deny them.

Original: A lui t’aspetta e a’ suoi benefici
Translate: Trust him and his benefits

Original: per lui fia trasmutata molta gente, cambiando condizion ricchi e mendici
Translate: Thanks to him many people will change condition, both beggars and rich

Original: e portera’ne scritto ne la mente di lui, e nol dirai»
Translate: And thou shalt bring these things into his account in his memory, which thou shalt not report.

Original: e disse cose incredibili a quei che fier presente
Translate: and said things that will be unbelievable even to those who see them in person

Original: Poi giunse
Translate: Then he added

Original: «Figlio, queste son le chiose di quel che ti fu detto
Translate: Son, these are the explanations of what was told you.

Original: ecco le ’nsidie che dietro a pochi giri son nascose
Translate: Here are the pitfalls that await you within a few years

Original: Non vo’ però ch’a’ tuoi vicini invidie, poscia che s’infutura la tua vita vie più là che ’l punir di lor perfidie»
Translate: But I do not want you to hold a grudge against your fellow citizens, for your life is bound to last far beyond the punishment that awaits their perfidy.

Original: Poi che, tacendo, si mostrò spedita l’anima santa di metter la trama in quella tela ch’io le porsi ordita,
Translate: After, keeping silent, the holy soul showed that he had completed the plot in that canvas of which to place the warp,

Original: io cominciai, come colui che brama, dubitando, consiglio da persona che vede e vuol dirittamente e ama
Translate: I began, as he who has a doubt and desires counsel from a person who sees, wants and loves according to righteousness.

Original: «Ben veggio, padre mio, sì come sprona lo tempo verso me, per colpo darmi tal, ch’è più grave a chi più s’abbandona
Translate: "I see well, my father, that time moves fast towards me to give me such a blow, that it is all the more serious the more one abandons himself to it

Original: per che di provedenza è buon ch’io m’armi, sì che, se loco m’è tolto più caro, io non perdessi li altri per miei carmi
Translate: Therefore it is necessary for me to take good care of myself, so that, if I am removed from the place dearest to me, I will not lose others because of my verses.

Original: Giù per lo mondo sanza fine amaro, e per lo monte del cui bel cacume li occhi de la mia donna mi levaro,
Translate: Down in the infinitely bitter world , and along the mountain from whose beautiful top my woman's eyes lifted me up ,

Original: e poscia per lo ciel, di lume in lume, ho io appreso quel che s’io ridico, a molti fia sapor di forte agrume
Translate: And afterwards in Paradise, from Heaven to Heaven, I have learned things that, if I tell them, they will have an unpleasant taste for many.

Original: e s’io al vero son timido amico, temo di perder viver tra coloro che questo tempo chiameranno antico»
Translate: and if I am a shy friend of the truth, I fear that I am not able to live among those who will call this time ancient,

Original: La luce in che rideva il mio tesoro ch’io trovai lì, si fé prima corusca, quale a raggio di sole specchio d’oro
Translate: The light in which my treasure shone, which I found there, at first became shining, like a mirror of gold struck by the sun.

Original: indi rispuose
Translate: then answered

Original: «Coscïenza fusca o de la propria o de l’altrui vergogna pur sentirà la tua parola brusca
Translate: A guilty conscience for one's own fault or others will certainly feel your words as unpleasant

Original: Ma nondimen, rimossa ogne menzogna, tutta tua visïon fa manifesta
Translate: Yet, removing all lies, make manifest all that you have seen,

Original: e lascia pur grattar dov’ è la rogna
Translate: And let him that has the filth be scratched.

Original: Ché se la voce tua sarà molesta nel primo gusto, vital nodrimento lascerà poi, quando sarà digesta
Translate: For your voice, if it be uncomfortable at the first taste, then when it is assimilated it will leave a vital nourishment.

Original: Questo tuo grido farà come vento, che le più alte cime più percuote
Translate: This cry of yours will be like a wind that strikes the highest peaks,

Original: e ciò non fa d’onor poco argomento
Translate: And this is no small cause for honor.

Original: Però ti son mostrate in queste rote, nel monte e ne la valle dolorosa pur l’anime che son di fama note,
Translate: Therefore in these heavens, in Purgatory, and in the painful valley of Hell, only the souls that are very famous are shown to you,

Original: che l’animo di quel ch’ode, non posa né ferma fede per essempro ch’aia la sua radice incognita e ascosa,
Translate: For the soul of him that heareth does not hear, and does not believe an example which hath its hidden and unknown root,

Original: né per altro argomento che non paia»
Translate: nor to another argument that is not fully evident

Original: Già si godeva solo del suo verbo quello specchio beato, e io gustava lo mio, temprando col dolce l’acerbo
Translate: Now the blessed had only his words, and I of them which I had heard, attenuating the harshness with sweetness.

Original: e quella donna ch’a Dio mi menava disse
Translate: And that woman who led me to God said,

Original: «Muta pensier
Translate: Don't shoot yourself down,

Original: pensa ch’i’ sono presso a colui ch’ogne torto disgrava»
Translate: He thinks that I am near to the One who repairs all unrighteousness.

Original: Io mi rivolsi a l’amoroso suono del mio conforto
Translate: I turned to her who comforted me with the loving sound of her voice.

Original: e qual io allor vidi ne li occhi santi amor, qui l’abbandono
Translate: and I cannot describe here the love that I saw then in his holy eyes

Original: non perch’ io pur del mio parlar diffidi, ma per la mente che non può redire sovra sé tanto, s’altri non la guidi
Translate: not only because I do not trust my expressive abilities, but because my memory cannot return to remember so much, if it is not supported by God

Original: Tanto poss’ io di quel punto ridire, che, rimirando lei, lo mio affetto libero fu da ogne altro disire,
Translate: All I can say about that moment is that, looking at Beatrice, my affection was free from any other desire,

Original: fin che ’l piacere etterno, che diretto raggiava in Bëatrice, dal bel viso mi contentava col secondo aspetto
Translate: until the eternal beauty of God, which radiant directly in Beatrice, was reflected toward me from his beautiful face

Original: Vincendo me col lume d’un sorriso, ella mi disse
Translate: By winning me with the light of his smile, Beatrice told me

Original: «Volgiti e ascolta
Translate: "Voltage and Listen"

Original: ché non pur ne’ miei occhi è paradiso»
Translate: For Paradise is not only in my eyes.

Original: Come si vede qui alcuna volta l’affetto ne la vista, s’elli è tanto, che da lui sia tutta l’anima tolta,
Translate: As sometimes on Earth you see affection in your gaze, if this is such that the whole soul is taken from him,

Original: così nel fiammeggiar del folgór santo, a ch’io mi volsi, conobbi la voglia in lui di ragionarmi ancora alquanto
Translate: so in the glow of that holy light that I turned to I realized how much the blessed still wanted to speak to me a little

Original: El cominciò
Translate: He began

Original: «In questa quinta soglia de l’albero che vive de la cima e frutta sempre e mai non perde foglia,
Translate: In this fifth heaven of the tree, which receives life from the top, it always fructifies and never loses the leaves,

Original: spiriti son beati, che giù, prima che venissero al ciel, fuor di gran voce, sì ch’ogne musa ne sarebbe opima
Translate: There are blessed spirits who on Earth, before they died, had great fame, to the point that they could be great museums.

Original: Però mira ne’ corni de la croce
Translate: Therefore observe in the side arms of the cross

Original: quello ch’io nomerò, lì farà l’atto che fa in nube il suo foco veloce»
Translate: the spirit that I will appoint, will perform the act that makes the lightning in the cloud,

Original: Io vidi per la croce un lume tratto dal nomar Iosuè, com’ el si feo
Translate: I saw that, when Joshua was appointed, a light arose for the cross in unison,

Original: né mi fu noto il dir prima che ’l fatto
Translate: so that listening and seeing happened at the same time

Original: E al nome de l’alto Macabeo vidi moversi un altro roteando, e letizia era ferza del paleo
Translate: And to the name of the noble Maccabeus I saw another light moving around on itself, and the joy was the whip that made the top move.

Original: Così per Carlo Magno e per Orlando due ne seguì lo mio attento sguardo, com’ occhio segue suo falcon volando
Translate: So, to the names of Charlemagne and Orlando, my attentive gaze followed two others, like the eye that follows the flight of its own hunting falcon

Original: Poscia trasse Guiglielmo e Rinoardo e ’l duca Gottifredi la mia vista per quella croce, e Ruberto Guiscardo
Translate: Then Guglielmo d'Orange and Rinoardo and Goffredo di Buglione attracted my view along that cross, and so Roberto Guiscardo

Original: Indi, tra l’altre luci mota e mista, mostrommi l’alma che m’avea parlato qual era tra i cantor del cielo artista
Translate: Later, having moved to meet the other lights, the soul that had spoken to me showed me worthy artist among those singers of the sky

Original: Io mi rivolsi dal mio destro lato per vedere in Beatrice il mio dovere, o per parlare o per atto, segnato
Translate: I turned to my right hand so that Beatrice would show me my duty, expressed in her words or in her gestures.

Original: e vidi le sue luci tanto mere, tanto gioconde, che la sua sembianza vinceva li altri e l’ultimo solere
Translate: and I saw his eyes so shining, so full of joy, that his appearance surpassed in beauty whatever else he usually had and the last one I had seen

Original: E come, per sentir più dilettanza bene operando, l’uom di giorno in giorno s’accorge che la sua virtute avanza,
Translate: And like man, feeling a greater joy in doing good, day by day he realizes to increase his own virtue,

Original: sì m’accors’ io che ’l mio girare intorno col cielo insieme avea cresciuto l’arco, veggendo quel miracol più addorno
Translate: So I realized that my turning around with Heaven had become wider, seeing that the beauty of Beatrice had increased.

Original: E qual è ’l trasmutare in picciol varco di tempo in bianca donna, quando ’l volto suo si discarchi di vergogna il carco,
Translate: And as a pale-colored woman quickly regains her appearance, when her face loses the redness of shame,

Original: tal fu ne li occhi miei, quando fui vòlto, per lo candor de la temprata stella sesta, che dentro a sé m’avea ricolto
Translate: So it was in my eyes, when I turned, by the whiteness of the tempered sixth star, that he had received me within himself.

Original: Io vidi in quella giovïal facella lo sfavillar de l’amor che lì era segnare a li occhi miei nostra favella
Translate: And I saw in the star of Jupiter the souls that were in it, and that were glowing, forming letters that were in my sight.

Original: E come augelli surti di rivera, quasi congratulando a lor pasture, fanno di sé or tonda or altra schiera,
Translate: And as birds flying from a river, almost rejoicing at each other of the meal consumed, gather in circles or in other forms,

Original: sì dentro ai lumi sante creature volitando cantavano, e faciensi or D, or I, or L in sue figure
Translate: So inside those lights the holy souls would sing, and they would now look like a 'D', now a 'I' or a 'L'

Original: Prima, cantando, a sua nota moviensi
Translate: At first, singing, they moved to the rhythm of their song

Original: poi, diventando l’un di questi segni, un poco s’arrestavano e taciensi
Translate: then, turning into one of these signs, they stopped and kept quiet a little

Original: O diva Pegasëa che li ’ngegni fai glorïosi e rendili longevi,
Translate: O divine Pegasea, who do glorious ingenious things and make them long,

Original: ed essi teco le cittadi e ’ regni,
Translate: And because of you they do the same with cities and kingdoms,

Original: illustrami di te, sì ch’io rilevi le lor figure com’ io l’ho concette
Translate: Give me your inspiration, so that I remember those figures as I saw them.

Original: paia tua possa in questi versi brevi
Translate: shine in these few verses all your power

Original: Mostrarsi dunque in cinque volte sette vocali e consonanti
Translate: So thirty-five letters were shown in all, between vowels and consonants.

Original: e io notai le parti sì, come mi parver dette
Translate: And I wrote down the letters mentally, as it seemed to me that they were written.

Original: ‘DILIGITE IUSTITIAM’, primai fur verbo e nome di tutto ’l dipinto
Translate: 'Love righteousness' were the verb and the name that first appeared in all the figure

Original: ‘QUI IUDICATIS TERRAM’, fur sezzai
Translate: 'You who judge the Earth' were the last

Original: Poscia ne l’emme del vocabol quinto rimasero ordinate
Translate: Later they stopped in the emme of the fifth word,

Original: sì che Giove pareva argento lì d’oro distinto
Translate: in such a way that Jupiter, of silver colour, stood out of their golden splendor

Original: E vidi scendere altre luci dove era il colmo de l’emme, e lì quetarsi cantando, credo, il ben ch’a sé le move
Translate: And I saw other lights come down to the top of the 'M', and stand there singing, I believe, in honor of God who draws them to Him.

Original: Poi, come nel percuoter d’i ciocchi arsi surgono innumerabili faville, onde li stolti sogliono agurarsi,
Translate: Then, as by hitting the fiery locks, there are many fairy tales, from which fools are used to draw wishes,

Original: resurger parver quindi più di mille luci e salir, qual assai e qual poco, sì come ’l sol che l’accende sortille
Translate: It seemed that more than a thousand lights rose, some more and others less, depending on how the sun had decided that had lit them.

Original: e quïetata ciascuna in suo loco, la testa e ’l collo d’un’aguglia vidi rappresentare a quel distinto foco
Translate: And I saw that each one, when he stood in the appointed place, formed the head and neck of an eagle in that splendor that stood out.

Original: Quei che dipinge lì, non ha chi ’l guidi
Translate: He who paints there has no guide,

Original: ma esso guida, e da lui si rammenta quella virtù ch’è forma per li nidi
Translate: but it is He himself who guides, and from Him one recognizes that virtue which is form for beings in nests.

Original: L’altra bëatitudo, che contenta pareva prima d’ingigliarsi a l’emme, con poco moto seguitò la ’mprenta
Translate: The other lights of the blessed, which before seemed happy to form the heraldic lily from the 'M', with small movements completed the figure of the eagle

Original: O dolce stella, quali e quante gemme mi dimostraro che nostra giustizia effetto sia del ciel che tu ingemme
Translate: O sweet star, which and how many gems showed me that our human righteousness is the product of Heaven that you embellish

Original: Per ch’io prego la mente in che s’inizia tuo moto e tua virtute, che rimiri ond’ esce il fummo che ’l tuo raggio vizia
Translate: So I pray the mind in which your virtue and your motion begin, to observe where the smoke that obscures your ray comes from.

Original: sì ch’un’altra fïata omai s’adiri del comperare e vender dentro al templo che si murò di segni e di martìri
Translate: so that one may again be angry at the market inside the Temple, which was built with miracles and martyrdom.

Original: O milizia del ciel cu’ io contemplo, adora per color che sono in terra tutti svïati dietro al malo essemplo
Translate: O army of Heaven that I contemplate, pray for those who, on Earth, are misled by the bad example of the popes

Original: Già si solea con le spade far guerra
Translate: There used to be war with swords.

Original: ma or si fa togliendo or qui or quivi lo pan che ’l pïo Padre a nessun serra
Translate: but now it is done by taking away from this and from that bread which God denies to no man.

Original: Ma tu che sol per cancellare scrivi, pensa che Pietro e Paulo, che moriro per la vigna che guasti, ancor son vivi
Translate: But you who write only to erase, think that St Peter and St Paul, who died by the vineyard that you corrupt, are still alive

Original: Ben puoi tu dire
Translate: Of course you can say

Original: «I’ ho fermo ’l disiro sì a colui che volle viver solo e che per salti fu tratto al martiro,
Translate: "I desire only the one who wanted to live in the desert and who was led to martyrdom with a dance,

Original: ch’io non conosco il pescator né Polo»
Translate: so that I don't know the fisherman or Polo

Original: Parea dinanzi a me con l’ali aperte la bella image che nel dolce frui liete facevan l’anime conserte
Translate: The beautiful image that was formed by happy souls in God's sweet vision appeared before me with spread wings

Original: parea ciascuna rubinetto in cui raggio di sole ardesse sì acceso, che ne’ miei occhi rifrangesse lui
Translate: Each of the souls looked like a ruby struck by a ray of sunshine, so bright that it reflected the light in my eyes.

Original: E quel che mi convien ritrar testeso, non portò voce mai, né scrisse incostro, né fu per fantasia già mai compreso
Translate: And what I must now describe was never uttered by voice, nor written with ink, nor ever conceived by human imagination.

Original: ch’io vidi e anche udi’ parlar lo rostro, e sonar ne la voce e «io» e «mio», quand’ era nel concetto e ‘noi’ e ‘nostro’
Translate: For I also saw and heard the beak of the eagle, which spoke, and said with his voice, and my voice, saying, in reality, We are and ours.

Original: E cominciò
Translate: And it started.

Original: «Per esser giusto e pio son io qui essaltato a quella gloria che non si lascia vincere a disio
Translate: For being righteous and devoted in life, I am here exalted to that glory which is not overcome by any mortal desire.

Original: e in terra lasciai la mia memoria sì fatta, che le genti lì malvage commendan lei, ma non seguon la storia»
Translate: And on earth I left such a remembrance, that even evil men praise him, even though they do not follow him.

Original: Così un sol calor di molte brage si fa sentir, come di molti amori usciva solo un suon di quella image
Translate: As from many embers a single heat emanates, so from the many souls of that image came a single sound

Original: Ond’ io appresso
Translate: Then I said,

Original: «O perpetüi fiori de l’etterna letizia, che pur uno parer mi fate tutti vostri odori,
Translate: "O everlasting flowers of eternal bliss, which make me look like one perfume all that emanates,

Original: solvetemi, spirando, il gran digiuno che lungamente m’ha tenuto in fame, non trovandoli in terra cibo alcuno
Translate: Break with the breath of your voice the severe fast that made me starve for a long time, finding no food on Earth to satisfy him

Original: Ben so io che, se ’n cielo altro reame la divina giustizia fa suo specchio, che ’l vostro non l’apprende con velame
Translate: I know that divine justice is reflected in Heaven in another angelic hierarchy, but your Heaven sees it without any impediment

Original: Sapete come attento io m’apparecchio ad ascoltar
Translate: You know how I am ready to listen carefully

Original: sapete qual è quello dubbio che m’è digiun cotanto vecchio»
Translate: know what is the ancient doubt that has provoked this lasting fasting of mine?

Original: Quasi falcone ch’esce del cappello, move la testa e con l’ali si plaude, voglia mostrando e faccendosi bello,
Translate: Like a falcon, when he frees himself from the hood, he moves his head and bangs his wings, manifesting his desire to fly and become beautiful,

Original: vid’ io farsi quel segno, che di laude de la divina grazia era contesto, con canti quai si sa chi là sù gaude
Translate: So I saw that eagle made up of the praises of divine grace, singing so that only who is up there can understand

Original: Poi cominciò
Translate: Then it started.

Original: «Colui che volse il sesto a lo stremo del mondo, e dentro ad esso distinse tanto occulto e manifesto,
Translate: He who drew with the compass the boundaries of the Universe and distinguished in it the things visible and invisible,

Original: non poté suo valor sì fare impresso in tutto l’universo, che ’l suo verbo non rimanesse in infinito eccesso
Translate: He could not put his value anywhere, without his Word remaining infinitely superior to human abilities.

Original: E ciò fa certo che ’l primo superbo, che fu la somma d’ogne creatura, per non aspettar lume, cadde acerbo
Translate: And of this is proof that the first sinner of pride, who was the most perfect of all creatures, was cast down from Heaven for not having waited for the light of divine grace

Original: e quinci appar ch’ogne minor natura è corto recettacolo a quel bene che non ha fine e sé con sé misura
Translate: And from here it is understood that every creature inferior to him can certainly not contain in himself that good which has no limit and is the only measure of itself

Original: Dunque vostra veduta, che convene esser alcun de’ raggi de la mente di che tutte le cose son ripiene,
Translate: Therefore your sight, which is nothing but one of the rays of God's mind that is present in all things,

Original: non pò da sua natura esser possente tanto, che suo principio discerna molto di là da quel che l’è parvente
Translate: cannot by its nature be so strong as to see its principle, which is far beyond the abilities of its senses

Original: Però ne la giustizia sempiterna la vista che riceve il vostro mondo, com’ occhio per lo mare, entro s’interna
Translate: For this reason the sensitive view of human beings penetrates into divine justice like the eye in the sea

Original: che, ben che da la proda veggia il fondo, in pelago nol vede
Translate: And it, though it seeth from the shore, seeth it no more in the high sea.

Original: e nondimeno è li, ma cela lui l’esser profondo
Translate: and of course it is present, but the depth conceals it

Original: Lume non è, se non vien dal sereno che non si turba mai
Translate: There is no real light, for the human mind, if it does not come from that serenity that is never blurred

Original: anzi è tenèbra od ombra de la carne o suo veleno
Translate: every other is dark, or spoiled by the senses, or attracted to error

Original: Assai t’è mo aperta la latebra che t’ascondeva la giustizia viva, di che facei question cotanto crebra
Translate: Now the den that hid divine justice from you has been opened to you, which raised such frequent doubts in you.

Original: ché tu dicevi
Translate: In fact, you used to say,

Original: “Un uom nasce a la riva de l’Indo, e quivi non è chi ragioni di Cristo né chi legga né chi scriva
Translate: "A man is born on the banks of the Indus and here no one speaks or teaches or writes about Christ

Original: e tutti suoi voleri e atti buoni sono, quanto ragione umana vede, sanza peccato in vita o in sermoni
Translate: but all his desires and deeds are virtuous, as much as human reason can judge, without any sin in deeds or words.

Original: Muore non battezzato e sanza fede
Translate: He dies without baptism and without faith

Original: ov’ è questa giustizia che ’l condanna?
Translate: What justice is it that condemns him?

Original: ov’ è la colpa sua, se ei non crede?”
Translate: What's your fault, if you don't think?

Original: Or tu chi se’, che vuo’ sedere a scranna, per giudicar di lungi mille miglia con la veduta corta d’una spanna?
Translate: "Now who are you, who want to stand up to judge and rule a thousand miles away, with the view that barely reaches a span?

Original: Certo a colui che meco s’assottiglia, se la Scrittura sovra voi non fosse, da dubitar sarebbe a maraviglia
Translate: Surely the one who makes subtle reasonings about me might doubt in a surprising way, if there were not Sacred Scripture above you.

Original: Oh terreni animali
Translate: Oh, earthly creatures.

Original: oh menti grosse
Translate: Oh, gross lies.

Original: La prima volontà, ch’è da sé buona, da sé, ch’è sommo ben, mai non si mosse
Translate: The first will, which is good in itself, has never moved from itself that is the highest good

Original: Cotanto è giusto quanto a lei consuona
Translate: All that conforms to it is right.

Original: nullo creato bene a sé la tira, ma essa, radïando, lui cagiona»
Translate: No created good attracts it to itself, but it is it, irradiating grace, which determines it.

Original: Quale sovresso il nido si rigira poi c’ha pasciuti la cicogna i figli, e come quel ch’è pasto la rimira
Translate: As the stork, having fed her little ones, flies over the nest, and as the storks, having eaten, observe it,

Original: cotal si fece, e sì leväi i cigli, la benedetta imagine, che l’ali movea sospinte da tanti consigli
Translate: So he made the holy image that moved the wings of so many blessed, and I looked up toward it.

Original: Roteando cantava, e dicea
Translate: He would sing, and he would say,

Original: «Quali son le mie note a te, che non le ’ntendi, tal è il giudicio etterno a voi mortali»
Translate: "As you do not understand the song I speak to you, so the divine judgment is unknowable to you mortals."

Original: Poi si quetaro quei lucenti incendi de lo Spirito Santo ancor nel segno che fé i Romani al mondo reverendi, esso ricominciò
Translate: After those holy lights, full of the Holy Spirit, stopped and came back to depict the sign that made the Romans worthy of respect for the world, it began again.

Original: «A questo regno non salì mai chi non credette ’n Cristo, né pria né poi ch’el si chiavasse al legno
Translate: In this kingdom he never ascended who did not believe in Christ, before or after his crucifixion.

Original: Ma vedi
Translate: But you see...

Original: molti gridan “Cristo, Cristo”,
Translate: many cry out "Christ, Christ,"

Original: che saranno in giudicio assai men prope a lui, che tal che non conosce Cristo
Translate: And the Day of Judgment shall be far less near unto Him than he that hath never known Him.

Original: e tai Cristian dannerà l’Etïòpe, quando si partiranno i due collegi, l’uno in etterno ricco e l’altro inòpe
Translate: And these Christians shall be condemned by the Ethiopian, when the two hosts shall be divided, one eternally rich, and the other wretched.

Original: Che poran dir li Perse a’ vostri regi, come vedranno quel volume aperto nel qual si scrivon tutti suoi dispregi?
Translate: What will the Persians say to your kings, when they see that book in which all wrongdoing is written open?

Original: Lì si vedrà, tra l’opere d’Alberto, quella che tosto moverà la penna, per che ’l regno di Praga fia diserto
Translate: There you will see, among the works of Alberto, the one that will soon be noted and for which the kingdom of Prague will be destroyed

Original: Lì si vedrà il duol che sovra Senna induce, falseggiando la moneta, quel che morrà di colpo di cotenna
Translate: There you will see the pain that it causes over the Seine, coining false coin, the one who will die from the blow of a boar

Original: Lì si vedrà la superbia ch’asseta, che fa lo Scotto e l’Inghilese folle, sì che non può soffrir dentro a sua meta
Translate: There you will see the pride that feeds the thirst for power and that makes the kings of Scotland and England mad, who can't stand to be within their borders

Original: Vedrassi la lussuria e ’l viver molle di quel di Spagna e di quel di Boemme, che mai valor non conobbe né volle
Translate: You will see the lust and vicious life of the king of Spain and the king of Bohemia, who never knew nor wanted any value

Original: Vedrassi al Ciotto di Ierusalemme segnata con un i la sua bontate, quando ’l contrario segnerà un emme
Translate: It will be seen, with regard to the Zoppo of Jerusalem, that his good deeds will be marked with an 'I' and evil deeds with an emme

Original: Vedrassi l’avarizia e la viltate di quei che guarda l’isola del foco, ove Anchise finì la lunga etate
Translate: You will see the greed and cowardice of the one who rules the island of fire where Anchise died

Original: e a dare ad intender quanto è poco, la sua scrittura fian lettere mozze, che noteranno molto in parvo loco
Translate: And to prove his evildoing, his evildoing shall be written down with abbreviated letters, to write many things in little space.

Original: E parranno a ciascun l’opere sozze del barba e del fratel, che tanto egregia nazione e due corone han fatte bozze
Translate: And the unworthy works of his uncle and his brother, who dishonor such a noble house and two crowns, will be evident to all.

Original: E quel di Portogallo e di Norvegia lì si conosceranno, e quel di Rascia che male ha visto il conio di Vinegia
Translate: And there will be known the kings of Portugal and Norway, and that of Serbia who saw with its damage the Venetian currency

Original: Oh beata Ungheria, se non si lascia più malmenare
Translate: Oh happy Hungary, if you don't let yourself be badly governed anymore

Original: e beata Navarra, se s’armasse del monte che la fascia
Translate: and happy Navarra, if only he used as a weapon the mountains that bind her

Original: E creder de’ ciascun che già, per arra di questo, Niccosïa e Famagosta per la lor bestia si lamenti e garra,
Translate: And everyone must believe, as an advance of this, that already the island of Cyprus complains and sorrows for the beast that governs it,

Original: che dal fianco de l’altre non si scosta»
Translate: which does not differ much from the other examples

Original: Quando colui che tutto ’l mondo alluma de l’emisperio nostro sì discende, che ’l giorno d’ogne parte si consuma,
Translate: When he who illuminates the whole world sets from our hemisphere, so that the day disappears in all parts,

Original: lo ciel, che sol di lui prima s’accende, subitamente si rifà parvente per molte luci, in che una risplende
Translate: the sky, which before is lit with light, immediately becomes shining again for many stars, in which is reflected that of the sun

Original: e questo atto del ciel mi venne a mente, come ’l segno del mondo e de’ suoi duci nel benedetto rostro fu tacente
Translate: and this thing came to my mind as soon as the symbol of the world and its leaders kept silent in the blessed beak

Original: però che tutte quelle vive luci, vie più lucendo, cominciaron canti da mia memoria labili e caduci
Translate: in fact, all those shining lights, becoming brighter, began songs destined to disappear from my memory

Original: O dolce amor che di riso t’ammanti, quanto parevi ardente in que’ flailli, ch’avieno spirto sol di pensier santi
Translate: O sweet love that enlightens you of your smile, as you seemed burning in those sweet sounds that were pervaded only by a spirit of holy thoughts

Original: Poscia che i cari e lucidi lapilli ond’ io vidi ingemmato il sesto lume puoser silenzio a li angelici squilli,
Translate: After the precious and shining gems of which I saw dotted the sixth Heaven ceased those angelic rings,

Original: udir mi parve un mormorar di fiume che scende chiaro giù di pietra in pietra, mostrando l’ubertà del suo cacume
Translate: It seemed to me that I heard the murmuring of a river that descends to the valley of the earth, of stone in stone, showing the abundance of water on its top.

Original: E come suono al collo de la cetra prende sua forma, e sì com’ al pertugio de la sampogna vento che penètra,
Translate: And how the sound is formed on the handle of the harp, and how you feel the breath of air entering the hole of the paw,

Original: così, rimosso d’aspettare indugio, quel mormorar de l’aguglia salissi su per lo collo, come fosse bugio
Translate: So, putting an end to all delay, the murmuring of the eagle went up his neck, as if this were pierced.

Original: Fecesi voce quivi, e quindi uscissi per lo suo becco in forma di parole, quali aspettava il core ov’ io le scrissi
Translate: Here he turned into a voice, and came out through the beak in the form of separate words, which my heart, where I noted them, waited.

Original: «La parte in me che vede e pate il sole ne l’aguglie mortali»,
Translate: The part of me that in mortal eagles sees and endures the sun,

Original: incominciommi,
Translate: started him

Original: «or fisamente riguardar si vole, perché d’i fuochi ond’ io figura fommi, quelli onde l’occhio in testa mi scintilla, e’ di tutti lor gradi son li sommi
Translate: Now it shall be fixed by thee with attention: for of all the souls of which those that shine in my eye are the most worthy of all the blessed.

Original: Colui che luce in mezzo per pupilla, fu il cantor de lo Spirito Santo, che l’arca traslatò di villa in villa
Translate: He who shines in the midst as the pupil was the singer of the Holy Spirit, who carried the Holy Ark from city to city

Original: ora conosce il merto del suo canto, in quanto effetto fu del suo consiglio, per lo remunerar ch’è altrettanto
Translate: He now knows the merit of his song, for it was the effect of his will, because of the bliss which is commensurate with it.

Original: Dei cinque che mi fan cerchio per ciglio, colui che più al becco mi s’accosta, la vedovella consolò del figlio
Translate: Of the five blessed who make up the circle that makes me an eyelash, he that is nearest to my beak consoled the widow in the righteousness of her son.

Original: ora conosce quanto caro costa non seguir Cristo, per l’esperïenza di questa dolce vita e de l’opposta
Translate: now know how expensive it is not to follow Christ, for he has experienced both life in Heaven and that in Hell

Original: E quel che segue in la circunferenza di che ragiono, per l’arco superno, morte indugiò per vera penitenza
Translate: And the blessed who follows him in the circle of which I speak, in the high part, delayed his death with a true penance

Original: ora conosce che ’l giudicio etterno non si trasmuta, quando degno preco fa crastino là giù de l’odïerno
Translate: now knows that eternal judgment is not changed, when the prayer of a worthy soul, on Earth, postpones what has already been uttered

Original: L’altro che segue, con le leggi e meco, sotto buona intenzion che fé mal frutto, per cedere al pastor si fece greco
Translate: The other coming after, on the basis of a good intention that then gave bad fruit, to leave the shepherd became Greek

Original: ora conosce come il mal dedutto dal suo bene operar non li è nocivo, avvegna che sia ’l mondo indi distrutto
Translate: Now he sees that the evil of his good deeds has not harmed him, though the world has been ruined.

Original: E quel che vedi ne l’arco declivo, Guiglielmo fu, cui quella terra plora che piagne Carlo e Federigo vivo
Translate: And he that seeth in the descending bow was King William the Good, which is sorry of those lands which are now ruled by the living Charles II of Anjou and Frederick II of Aragon.

Original: ora conosce come s’innamora lo ciel del giusto rege, e al sembiante del suo fulgore il fa vedere ancora
Translate: He now knows that Heaven appreciates a righteous king, and he still shows it with the splendor of his appearance.

Original: Chi crederebbe giù nel mondo errante che Rifëo Troiano in questo tondo fosse la quinta de le luci sante?
Translate: Who in the wandering world could believe that the Trojan Rifeo was the fifth of the holy lights?

Original: Ora conosce assai di quel che ’l mondo veder non può de la divina grazia, ben che sua vista non discerna il fondo»
Translate: Now he knows much more than what men know of divine grace, even though his gaze cannot reach it in depth.

Original: Quale allodetta che ’n aere si spazia prima cantando, e poi tace contenta de l’ultima dolcezza che la sazia,
Translate: Like the lark that first flies in the air, singing and then silent, pleasing the last sweetness of the song that gives her satisfaction,

Original: tal mi sembiò l’imago de la ’mprenta de l’etterno piacere, al cui disio ciascuna cosa qual ell’ è diventa
Translate: so it seemed to me the image of the divine imprint, for whose desire everything becomes as it is

Original: E avvegna ch’io fossi al dubbiar mio lì quasi vetro a lo color ch’el veste, tempo aspettar tacendo non patio,
Translate: And even though I, doubting, was like a glass that takes on the color of what it covers, I could not stand to wait silently,

Original: ma de la bocca, «Che cose son queste?», mi pinse con la forza del suo peso
Translate: But out of the mouth, "What is all this?" he went out with the force of doubt.

Original: per ch’io di coruscar vidi gran feste
Translate: Then I saw the blessed shining for the joy of answering me.

Original: Poi appresso, con l’occhio più acceso, lo benedetto segno mi rispuose per non tenermi in ammirar sospeso
Translate: Soon afterward, with an even brighter eye, the blessed sign answered me, that I should not be stunned in my astonishment.

Original: «Io veggio che tu credi queste cose perch’ io le dico, ma non vedi come
Translate: "I see that you believe these things because I tell you, but you don't understand the reason.

Original: sì che, se son credute, sono ascose
Translate: in that world, though believed, they are dark

Original: Fai come quei che la cosa per nome apprende ben, ma la sua quiditate veder non può se altri non la prome
Translate: You do as the one who understands the thing from the name that indicates it, but he doesn't mean the substance if someone else doesn't explain it to him.

Original: Regnum celorum vïolenza pate da caldo amore e da viva speranza, che vince la divina volontate
Translate: The Kingdom of Heaven endures the violence that comes from the warm love of charity and from living hope, that overcomes the divine will

Original: non a guisa che l’omo a l’om sobranza, ma vince lei perché vuole esser vinta, e, vinta, vince con sua beninanza
Translate: not as a man who overcomes another, but overcomes it, because it wants to be overcome, and once overcome, it overcomes with its goodness.

Original: La prima vita del ciglio e la quinta ti fa maravigliar, perché ne vedi la regïon de li angeli dipinta
Translate: The first and fifth souls that make up the eyelash make you wonder, for you see that they dwell in the region of angels.

Original: D’i corpi suoi non uscir, come credi, Gentili, ma Cristiani, in ferma fede quel d’i passuri e quel d’i passi piedi
Translate: They did not come out, as you believe, from their bodies, but Christians, I believe in the future martyrdom of Christ and Trajan in that already happened

Original: Ché l’una de lo ’nferno, u’ non si riede già mai a buon voler, tornò a l’ossa
Translate: For the first rose out of hell, from where one never returns to a good will, he returned to the bones.

Original: e ciò di viva spene fu mercede
Translate: and this was the reward of a living hope

Original: di viva spene, che mise la possa ne’ prieghi fatti a Dio per suscitarla, sì che potesse sua voglia esser mossa
Translate: of a living hope, that in prayers addressed to God put the strength to resurrect him, so that his will would be converted to better desire

Original: L’anima glorïosa onde si parla, tornata ne la carne, in che fu poco, credette in lui che potëa aiutarla
Translate: The glorious soul of which I speak, returned to the flesh, in which he remained little, believed in Him who could help her.

Original: e credendo s’accese in tanto foco di vero amor, ch’a la morte seconda fu degna di venire a questo gioco
Translate: and, believing, he was kindled in such an ardour of authentic charity, that after he died for the second time he was worthy to ascend to this bliss.

Original: L’altra, per grazia che da sì profonda fontana stilla, che mai creatura non pinse l’occhio infino a la prima onda,
Translate: The other, by virtue of the divine grace that flows from a source so deep that never could a creature penetrate the gaze to the source,

Original: tutto suo amor là giù pose a drittura
Translate: He put all his love in righteousness

Original: per che, di grazia in grazia, Dio li aperse l’occhio a la nostra redenzion futura
Translate: so that, by multiplying grace, God opened his eyes to our future Redemption

Original: ond’ ei credette in quella, e non sofferse da indi il puzzo più del paganesmo
Translate: therefore he believed in it, and from that time on he could not stand the stink of paganism,

Original: e riprendiene le genti perverse
Translate: and by criticizing the perverse followers

Original: Quelle tre donne li fur per battesmo che tu vedesti da la destra rota, dinanzi al battezzar più d’un millesmo
Translate: Those three women whom thou sawest on the right wheel of the chariot gave him baptism more than a thousand years before it was established.

Original: O predestinazion, quanto remota è la radice tua da quelli aspetti che la prima cagion non veggion tota
Translate: O predestination, how far your origin is from those gazes that certainly cannot see God in its entirety

Original: E voi, mortali, tenetevi stretti a giudicar
Translate: And you, men, be careful in judging

Original: ché noi, che Dio vedemo, non conosciamo ancor tutti li eletti
Translate: For we who see God do not yet know the exact number of the elect.

Original: ed ènne dolce così fatto scemo, perché il ben nostro in questo ben s’affina,
Translate: and our lack of knowledge is so sweet for us, that our joy is refined.

Original: che quel che vole Iddio, e noi volemo»
Translate: and we only want what is willed by God.

Original: Così da quella imagine divina, per farmi chiara la mia corta vista, data mi fu soave medicina
Translate: So that divine image, to lighten my imperfect sight, gave me a sweet medicine

Original: E come a buon cantor buon citarista fa seguitar lo guizzo de la corda, in che più di piacer lo canto acquista,
Translate: And as a good guitarist accompanies with the sound of the strings the good singer, which increases the pleasantness of the singing,

Original: sì, mentre ch’e’ parlò, sì mi ricorda ch’io vidi le due luci benedette, pur come batter d’occhi si concorda, con le parole mover le fiammette
Translate: so, as she spoke, I remember seeing the two blessed lights, as the blinking of the eyes happens simultaneously, with the words moving the flames

Original: Già eran li occhi miei rifissi al volto de la mia donna, e l’animo con essi, e da ogne altro intento s’era tolto
Translate: My eyes were now fixed on the face of my woman, and with them my soul, devoid of any other interest.

Original: E quella non ridea
Translate: And she wasn't smiling.

Original: ma «S’io ridessi», mi cominciò,
Translate: But if I smiled, he began to tell me,

Original: «tu ti faresti quale fu Semelè quando di cener fessi
Translate: You'd become what Seed became when it was incinerated.

Original: ché la bellezza mia, che per le scale de l’etterno palazzo più s’accende,
Translate: in fact my beauty, which increases as we ascend the stairs of the eternal palace,

Original: com’ hai veduto,
Translate: As you've seen,

Original: quanto più si sale, se non si temperasse, tanto splende, che ’l tuo mortal podere, al suo fulgore, sarebbe fronda che trono scoscende
Translate: If it were not temperate, it would shine to such an extent that your mortal sight, at its brightness, would be a branch struck down by lightning.

Original: Noi sem levati al settimo splendore, che sotto ’l petto del Leone ardente raggia mo misto giù del suo valore
Translate: We ascended to the seventh Heaven, which under the fiery constellation of Leo spreads its influence on the Earth mixed with that of the constellation itself.

Original: Ficca di retro a li occhi tuoi la mente, e fa di quelli specchi a la figura che ’n questo specchio ti sarà parvente»
Translate: Now look with extreme attention and make your mind a mirror with which to observe the spectacle of this Heaven.

Original: Qual savesse qual era la pastura del viso mio ne l’aspetto beato quand’ io mi trasmutai ad altra cura,
Translate: Who knew the bliss of my gaze when I stared at Beatrice, when I went by to observe something else,

Original: conoscerebbe quanto m’era a grato ubidire a la mia celeste scorta, contrapesando l’un con l’altro lato
Translate: He would know how pleased I was to obey my heavenly guidance, balancing one and the other.

Original: Dentro al cristallo che ’l vocabol porta, cerchiando il mondo, del suo caro duce sotto cui giacque ogne malizia morta,
Translate: Inside Heaven which, turning around the Earth, bears the name of the god under whom all evil was cut off,

Original: di color d’oro in che raggio traluce vid’ io uno scaleo eretto in suso tanto, che nol seguiva la mia luce
Translate: I saw a gilded and shining scale of the rays of the Sun rising upward, so that I could not see the end of it.

Original: Vidi anche per li gradi scender giuso tanti splendor, ch’io pensai ch’ogne lume che par nel ciel, quindi fosse diffuso
Translate: I also saw so many lights coming down the ladder, to the point that I thought that every star in the sky would spread in it.

Original: E come, per lo natural costume, le pole insieme, al cominciar del giorno, si movono a scaldar le fredde piume
Translate: And like the grey ravens, because of their natural habit, at dawn they move to warm their cold feathers,

Original: poi altre vanno via sanza ritorno, altre rivolgon sé onde son mosse, e altre roteando fan soggiorno
Translate: Then some go away without coming back, others go back to the point where they started, still others swing in the same place,

Original: tal modo parve me che quivi fosse in quello sfavillar che ’nsieme venne, sì come in certo grado si percosse
Translate: So it seemed to me that it was the movement of those glittering lights, as soon as they reached a step of the ladder.

Original: E quel che presso più ci si ritenne, si fé sì chiaro, ch’io dicea pensando
Translate: And he that stood nearest us, became so bright that I thought among myself,

Original: ‘Io veggio ben l’amor che tu m’accenne
Translate: 'I see well the love that you manifest to me

Original: Ma quella ond’ io aspetto il come e ’l quando del dire e del tacer, si sta
Translate: But she from whom I look to suggest me when to speak and when to shut up, does nothing

Original: ond’ io, contra ’l disio, fo ben ch’io non dimando’
Translate: so I, even against my wish, do well not to ask.

Original: Per ch’ella, che vedëa il tacer mio nel veder di colui che tutto vede, mi disse
Translate: Then she, who saw the reasons for my silence in the mind of the One who sees everything, said to me,

Original: «Solvi il tuo caldo disio»
Translate: "Shut up your ardent desire"

Original: E io incominciai
Translate: And I started

Original: «La mia mercede non mi fa degno de la tua risposta
Translate: My credit doesn't make me worthy of your answer

Original: ma per colei che ’l chieder mi concede, vita beata che ti stai nascosta dentro a la tua letizia,
Translate: but in the name of the one who grants me to ask, O blessed soul that you hide within your own joy,

Original: fammi nota la cagion che sì presso mi t’ha posta
Translate: Tell me why you came near me.

Original: e dì perché si tace in questa rota la dolce sinfonia di paradiso, che giù per l’altre suona sì divota»
Translate: and tell me why in this Heaven you do not hear the sweet symphony of Paradise that plays so devoutly in the other inferiors.

Original: «Tu hai l’udir mortal sì come il viso», rispuose a me
Translate: Thou hast the mortal hearing as the sight, and remarried me.

Original: «onde qui non si canta per quel che Bëatrice non ha riso
Translate: That's why you don't sing here, for the same reason that Beatrice didn't smile

Original: Giù per li gradi de la scala santa discesi tanto sol per farti festa col dire e con la luce che mi ammanta
Translate: I went down the steps of the holy stairs only to celebrate your presence, with words and with the light that surrounds me

Original: né più amor mi fece esser più presta,
Translate: I was no longer solicited for a particular affection for you

Original: ché più e tanto amor quinci sù ferve, sì come il fiammeggiar ti manifesta
Translate: For the higher the love of souls is equal or greater than mine, as their splendor shows thee.

Original: Ma l’alta carità, che ci fa serve pronte al consiglio che ’l mondo governa, sorteggia qui sì come tu osserve»
Translate: But high charity, which makes us ready to obey the judgment of God who rules the world, assigns us tasks as you observe.

Original: «Io veggio ben», diss’ io,
Translate: "I see well," I said.

Original: «sacra lucerna, come libero amore in questa corte basta a seguir la provedenza etterna
Translate: O holy light, as the free love in this Heaven is sufficient to carry out the will of eternal Providence

Original: ma questo è quel ch’a cerner mi par forte, perché predestinata fosti sola a questo officio tra le tue consorte»
Translate: But that is exactly what I find difficult to understand, because you alone have been assigned to this particular task compared to other souls.

Original: Né venni prima a l’ultima parola, che del suo mezzo fece il lume centro, girando sé come veloce mola
Translate: I didn't have time to say the last word, that light began to rotate horizontally on its axis like a quick millstone

Original: poi rispuose l’amor che v’era dentro
Translate: then the love that was in it answered

Original: «Luce divina sopra me s’appunta, penetrando per questa in ch’io m’inventro,
Translate: "The light of God penetrates into me, through this light within which I am wrapped,

Original: la cui virtù, col mio veder congiunta, mi leva sopra me tanto, ch’i’ veggio la somma essenza de la quale è munta
Translate: whose virtue, together with my intellectual vision, exalts me so much above me that I see the supreme essence from which it comes

Original: Quinci vien l’allegrezza ond’ io fiammeggio
Translate: From here comes the joy of which I shine

Original: per ch’a la vista mia, quant’ ella è chiara, la chiarità de la fiamma pareggio
Translate: For my brightness equals my vision of God, as much as it is bright.

Original: Ma quell’ alma nel ciel che più si schiara, quel serafin che ’n Dio più l’occhio ha fisso,
Translate: But that soul in Heaven that is most enlightened by God, that Seraphim who most places his eye in God,

Original: a la dimanda tua non satisfara,
Translate: couldn't answer your question,

Original: però che sì s’innoltra ne lo abisso de l’etterno statuto quel che chiedi, che da ogne creata vista è scisso
Translate: For that which thou askest is so much within the abyss of divine judgment that it is very far from the gaze of every creature.

Original: E al mondo mortal, quando tu riedi, questo rapporta, sì che non presumma a tanto segno più mover li piedi
Translate: And when you return to Earth, bring this message, so that men do not presume to understand something so unknowable

Original: La mente, che qui luce, in terra fumma
Translate: The human mind, which here is illuminated, on Earth is blurred

Original: onde riguarda come può là giù e quel che non pote perché ’l ciel l’assumma»
Translate: So, look how he could do what he can't do down there even when he's welcomed into Heaven.

Original: Sì mi prescrisser le parole sue, ch’io lasciai la quistione e mi ritrassi a dimandarla umilmente chi fue
Translate: So they commanded me his words, to the extent that I forsook the matter, and I merely asked humbly who he was.

Original: «Tra ’ due liti d’Italia surgon sassi, e non molto distanti a la tua patria,
Translate: There are mountains between the two coasts of Italy, not far from your homeland,

Original: tanto che’ troni assai suonan più bassi, e fanno un gibbo che si chiama Catria,
Translate: so high that the thunders fall much lower, and form a summit called Catria,

Original: di sotto al quale è consecrato un ermo, che suole esser disposto a sola latria»
Translate: below which is consecrated a hermitage that is usually reserved for the worship of God.

Original: Così ricominciommi il terzo sermo
Translate: So began his third speech

Original: e poi, continuando, disse
Translate: and then, continuing, he said,

Original: «Quivi al servigio di Dio mi fe’ sì fermo, che pur con cibi di liquor d’ulivi lievemente passava caldi e geli,
Translate: Here I dedicated myself to the service of God with such dedication, that I easily spent summers and winters eating secular foods,

Original: contento ne’ pensier contemplativi
Translate: contenting myself with the contemplation of the divine mysteries

Original: Render solea quel chiostro a questi cieli fertilemente
Translate: At one time that convent was used to yield an abundant harvest of souls to these Heavens

Original: e ora è fatto vano, sì che tosto convien che si riveli
Translate: And now it is empty, to the point that it will soon be revealed.

Original: In quel loco fu’ io Pietro Damiano, e Pietro Peccator fu’ ne la casa di Nostra Donna in sul lito adriano
Translate: In that place I was Pier Damiani, and instead I was Pietro Peccatore in the church of Santa Maria di Ravenna in port, on the Adriatic shore

Original: Poca vita mortal m’era rimasa, quando fui chiesto e tratto a quel cappello, che pur di male in peggio si travasa
Translate: I had little left to live when I was called to wear that hat that today passes from an unworthy individual to a worse one

Original: Venne Cefàs e venne il gran vasello de lo Spirito Santo, magri e scalzi, prendendo il cibo da qualunque ostello
Translate: St Peter and St Paul, skinny and barefoot, went and preached begging for food from whomever gave it to him.

Original: Or voglion quinci e quindi chi rincalzi li moderni pastori e chi li meni, tanto son gravi, e chi di rietro li alzi
Translate: Now modern shepherds want servants to support them on both sides and carry them, so heavy, and lift them up from behind

Original: Cuopron d’i manti loro i palafreni, sì che due bestie van sott’ una pelle
Translate: With their coats they cover the horses, so that two beasts are covered with the same skin.

Original: oh pazienza che tanto sostieni»
Translate: Oh, how great is the patience you have?

Original: A questa voce vid’ io più fiammelle di grado in grado scendere e girarsi, e ogne giro le facea più belle
Translate: At these words I saw so many flaming lights descending along the steps of the ladder and rotating, and at each turn their beauty grew.

Original: Dintorno a questa vennero e fermarsi, e fero un grido di sì alto suono, che non potrebbe qui assomigliarsi
Translate: They stopped around the light of Pier Damiani, and issued a loud cry, such that it could not be described

Original: né io lo ’ntesi, sì mi vinse il tuono
Translate: And I didn't understand the meaning of it, so I was deafened by the thunder.

Original: Oppresso di stupore, a la mia guida mi volsi, come parvol che ricorre sempre colà dove più si confida
Translate: Overwhelmed by amazement, I turned to my guidance as a child running to her in whom she confided more

Original: e quella, come madre che soccorre sùbito al figlio palido e anelo con la sua voce, che ’l suol ben disporre, mi disse
Translate: and Beatrice, like a mother who comes to the aid of her pale and yearning son with her voice, who usually succeeds in comforting him, said to me,

Original: «Non sai tu che tu se’ in cielo? e non sai tu che ’l cielo è tutto santo, e ciò che ci si fa vien da buon zelo?
Translate: Do you not know that you are in Heaven and that it is all holy, so what you do here comes from a just zeal?

Original: Come t’avrebbe trasmutato il canto, e io ridendo, mo pensar lo puoi, poscia che ’l grido t’ha mosso cotanto
Translate: Now you are able to understand how they would reduce your singing and my smile, since the cry has troubled you so much

Original: nel qual, se ’nteso avessi i prieghi suoi, già ti sarebbe nota la vendetta che tu vedrai innanzi che tu muoi
Translate: and if you had understood the prayer contained in it, you would know the divine vengeance that you will see before you die.

Original: La spada di qua sù non taglia in fretta né tardo, ma’ ch’al parer di colui che disïando o temendo l’aspetta
Translate: The sword of Paradise strikes neither too early nor too late, except in the opinion of the one who waits for it, with desire or fear.

Original: Ma rivolgiti omai inverso altrui
Translate: But now turn your attention to something else,

Original: ch’assai illustri spiriti vedrai, se com’ io dico l’aspetto redui»
Translate: For thou shalt see many illustrious spirits, if, as I say unto thee, thou bringest thy gaze unto them.

Original: Come a lei piacque, li occhi ritornai, e vidi cento sperule che ’nsieme più s’abbellivan con mutüi rai
Translate: I turned my eyes, carrying out his commandments, and saw a hundred spheres beautifying one another with light rays.

Original: Io stava come quei che ’n sé repreme la punta del disio, e non s’attenta di domandar, sì del troppo si teme
Translate: I was like the one who suppresses the covetousness of desire, and dare not ask to not be too annoying

Original: e la maggiore e la più luculenta di quelle margherite innanzi fessi, per far di sé la mia voglia contenta
Translate: and the greatest and brightest of those gems came forward, to satisfy my desire to know her.

Original: Poi dentro a lei udi’
Translate: Then I heard in it
