Original: e quello avea la fiamma più sincera cui men distava la favilla pura, credo, però che più di lei s’invera
Translate: and the circle that had the brightest flame was the one closest to the bright spot, because - I think - it nourished more of its truth.

Original: La donna mia, che mi vedea in cura forte sospeso, disse
Translate: My woman, who saw me tormented by a strong doubt, said,

Original: «Da quel punto depende il cielo e tutta la natura
Translate: From that point depends the Heaven and the Universe interior

Original: Mira quel cerchio che più li è congiunto
Translate: Look at that circle that's closer to him.

Original: e sappi che ’l suo muovere è sì tosto per l’affocato amore ond’ elli è punto»
Translate: and know that his movement is so fast because of the burning love that stimulates him

Original: E io a lei
Translate: And I to her.

Original: «Se ’l mondo fosse posto con l’ordine ch’io veggio in quelle rote, sazio m’avrebbe ciò che m’è proposto
Translate: If the universe had the same order as I see in those circles, what I was told would satisfy me.

Original: ma nel mondo sensibile si puote veder le volte tanto più divine, quant’ elle son dal centro più remote
Translate: but in the sensitive world it can be seen that the heavenly spheres are all the more perfect the farther away they are from Earth

Original: Onde, se ’l mio disir dee aver fine in questo miro e angelico templo che solo amore e luce ha per confine,
Translate: Therefore, if I must satisfy all my desire for knowledge in this wonderful and angelic temple which has only love and light as its border,

Original: udir convienmi ancor come l’essemplo e l’essemplare non vanno d’un modo, ché io per me indarno a ciò contemplo»
Translate: It is necessary that I understand why the copy and the pattern are discordant, as I vainly try to solve the question of the

Original: «Se li tuoi diti non sono a tal nodo sufficïenti, non è maraviglia
Translate: If your fingers aren't able to untie this knot, no wonder

Original: tanto, per non tentare, è fatto sodo»
Translate: to this point it is narrow, since no one has ever tried to unravel it.

Original: Così la donna mia
Translate: So my woman

Original: poi disse
Translate: then added

Original: «Piglia quel ch’io ti dicerò, se vuo’ saziarti
Translate: "Listen to what I will tell you, if you want to be satisfied,

Original: e intorno da esso t’assottiglia
Translate: and sharpen your mind on my words

Original: Li cerchi corporai sono ampi e arti secondo il più e ’l men de la virtute che si distende per tutte lor parti
Translate: The celestial spheres, which are physical bodies, are large or small depending on the greater or lesser virtue that extends in all their parts

Original: Maggior bontà vuol far maggior salute
Translate: Greater good produces greater salvation,

Original: maggior salute maggior corpo cape, s’elli ha le parti igualmente compiute
Translate: Greater health corresponds to a larger body, if all its parts are perfectly completed

Original: Dunque costui che tutto quanto rape l’altro universo seco, corrisponde al cerchio che più ama e che più sape
Translate: Therefore, this that drags into its motion all that the Universe, corresponds to the circle endowed with greater love and wisdom

Original: per che, se tu a la virtù circonde la tua misura, non a la parvenza de le sustanze che t’appaion tonde,
Translate: And then, if you focus on virtue and not on the breadth of the substances that seem round to you,

Original: tu vederai mirabil consequenza di maggio a più e di minore a meno, in ciascun cielo, a süa intelligenza»
Translate: You will see as a marvelous consequence the fact that to greater virtue corresponds greater closeness between each Heaven and its intelligence.

Original: Come rimane splendido e sereno l’emisperio de l’aere, quando soffia Borea da quella guancia ond’ è più leno,
Translate: As the hemisphere of the atmosphere remains clear and serene, when Borea blows from that cheek from which a gentler wind blows,

Original: per che si purga e risolve la roffia che pria turbava, sì che ’l ciel ne ride con le bellezze d’ogne sua paroffia
Translate: through which every uncleanness that first troubled the sky is swept away, and this smiles with the beauty of all its parts.

Original: così fec’ïo, poi che mi provide la donna mia del suo risponder chiaro, e come stella in cielo il ver si vide
Translate: So I did, after my woman answered me with her clear speech, and the truth was seen as a star in heaven.

Original: E poi che le parole sue restaro, non altrimenti ferro disfavilla che bolle, come i cerchi sfavillaro
Translate: And after the end of his words, the circles glowed like a glowing iron blazing with sparks

Original: L’incendio suo seguiva ogne scintilla
Translate: Every spark followed the flaming circle,

Original: ed eran tante, che ’l numero loro più che ’l doppiar de li scacchi s’inmilla
Translate: and there were so many that their number exceeded more than twice the number of chess

Original: Io sentiva osannar di coro in coro al punto fisso che li tiene a li ubi, e terrà sempre, ne’ quai sempre fuoro
Translate: I heard 'Hosanna' sing from choir to choir, towards the fixed point that holds them and will always hold them in that position in which they always were

Original: E quella che vedëa i pensier dubi ne la mia mente, disse
Translate: And she that saw the doubtful thoughts in my mind said,

Original: «I cerchi primi t’hanno mostrato Serafi e Cherubi
Translate: The first circles showed you the Seraphim and the Cherubim

Original: Così veloci seguono i suoi vimi, per somigliarsi al punto quanto ponno
Translate: They follow their bond of love with God so quickly to make themselves as similar as they can to the central point.

Original: e posson quanto a veder son soblimi
Translate: and they can do it as their vision is the highest

Original: Quelli altri amori che ’ntorno li vonno, si chiaman Troni del divino aspetto, per che ’l primo ternaro terminonno
Translate: Those other angelic beings around him who, from their creation, closed the first hierarchy, are called thrones of the divine aspect.

Original: e dei saper che tutti hanno diletto quanto la sua veduta si profonda nel vero in che si queta ogne intelletto
Translate: and you must know that everyone has a joy commensurate with the depth of their vision of God, that truth in which every intellect is calmed.

Original: Quinci si può veder come si fonda l’esser beato ne l’atto che vede, non in quel ch’ama, che poscia seconda
Translate: From here you can see how bliss is founded in the fruition of the divine vision, and not in the love that is a consequent act

Original: e del vedere è misura mercede, che grazia partorisce e buona voglia
Translate: and the depth of that vision is the reward that is produced by grace and good will

Original: così di grado in grado si procede
Translate: So we proceed from one order to another.

Original: L’altro ternaro, che così germoglia in questa primavera sempiterna che notturno Arïete non dispoglia,
Translate: The second hierarchy, which sprout so in this eternal spring that autumn can never strip,

Original: perpetüalemente ‘Osanna’ sberna con tre melode, che suonano in tree ordini di letizia onde s’interna
Translate: sings for eternity 'Hosanna' in three melodies, resounding in the three orders full of joy that make it

Original: In essa gerarcia son l’altre dee
Translate: In this hierarchy are the other goddesses

Original: prima Dominazioni, e poi Virtudi
Translate: First the Dominations, then the Virtues,

Original: l’ordine terzo di Podestadi èe
Translate: Finally, the third order is of the Powers

Original: Poscia ne’ due penultimi tripudi Principati e Arcangeli si girano
Translate: Then in the third last and penultimate order they rotate Princes and Archangels

Original: l’ultimo è tutto d’Angelici ludi
Translate: the last is all of Holiday Angels

Original: Questi ordini di sù tutti s’ammirano, e di giù vincon sì, che verso Dio tutti tirati sono e tutti tirano
Translate: These orders all admire upward and draw to themselves the lower world, so that everyone is drawn to God and attracts the world to himself.

Original: E Dïonisio con tanto disio a contemplar questi ordini si mise, che li nomò e distinse com’ io
Translate: And Dionysius so eagerly looked upon these commandments, that he listed them, and appointed them as I did.

Original: Ma Gregorio da lui poi si divise
Translate: Gregory later turned away from him

Original: onde, sì tosto come li occhi aperse in questo ciel, di sé medesmo rise
Translate: so that, as soon as he saw this Heaven with his eyes, he laughed at himself

Original: E se tanto secreto ver proferse mortale in terra, non voglio ch’ammiri
Translate: And if a mortal on Earth could deal with such a deep matter, you shouldn't be surprised.

Original: ché chi ’l vide qua sù gliel discoperse con altro assai del ver di questi giri»
Translate: For it was revealed to Dionysius by him that saw it up here, and many other things of these commandments.

Original: Quando ambedue li figli di Latona, coperti del Montone e de la Libra, fanno de l’orizzonte insieme zona,
Translate: When both the sons of Latona, under the two constellations of Aries and Libra, make both belts of the horizon,

Original: quant’ è dal punto che ’l cenìt inlibra infin che l’uno e l’altro da quel cinto, cambiando l’emisperio, si dilibra,
Translate: how much time passes from the moment the zenith holds them in balance until the one in which they free themselves from the belt by changing hemisphere,

Original: tanto, col volto di riso dipinto, si tacque Bëatrice, riguardando fiso nel punto che m’avëa vinto
Translate: Just as time Beatrice remained silent and smiling, staring into the bright spot that had overwhelmed my vision

Original: Poi cominciò
Translate: Then it started.

Original: «Io dico, e non dimando, quel che tu vuoli udir, perch’ io l’ho visto là ’ve s’appunta ogne ubi e ogne quando
Translate: "I tell you and I don't ask you what you want to hear, because I have read it where every time and every place is concentrated.

Original: Non per aver a sé di bene acquisto, ch’esser non può, ma perché suo splendore potesse, risplendendo, dir “Subsisto”,
Translate: Not in order to increase one's good, which is impossible, but that his splendor might be reflected in other beings who said "I exist,"

Original: in sua etternità di tempo fore, fuor d’ogne altro comprender, come i piacque, s’aperse in nuovi amor l’etterno amore
Translate: God's eternal love multiplied in other loves, as he liked it, in his eternity out of time and space

Original: Né prima quasi torpente si giacque
Translate: That doesn't mean he was lying down inoperant before,

Original: ché né prima né poscia procedette lo discorrer di Dio sovra quest’ acque
Translate: For neither before nor after God hath spoken concerning these waters,

Original: Forma e materia, congiunte e purette, usciro ad esser che non avia fallo, come d’arco tricordo tre saette
Translate: Shape and matter, joined together and pure, created beings who had no imperfections, just as three arrows are struck by an arch with three strings.

Original: E come in vetro, in ambra o in cristallo raggio resplende sì, che dal venire a l’esser tutto non è intervallo,
Translate: And as the light beam shines through a transparent body, so that between its coming and the shining there is no interval of time,

Original: così ’l triforme effetto del suo sire ne l’esser suo raggiò insieme tutto sanza distinzïone in essordire
Translate: So God's triform creative act ran wild together in his being, without succession of time

Original: Concreato fu ordine e costrutto a le sustanze
Translate: The order and structure of the cosmos were concreated together

Original: e quelle furon cima nel mondo in che puro atto fu produtto
Translate: And those were the top of the world in which a pure act was produced.

Original: pura potenza tenne la parte ima
Translate: pure power occupied the lower part

Original: nel mezzo strinse potenza con atto tal vime, che già mai non si divima
Translate: in the middle, act and power were bound together by such a firm bond that it can never be loosed

Original: Ieronimo vi scrisse lungo tratto di secoli de li angeli creati anzi che l’altro mondo fosse fatto
Translate: St. Jerome wrote that angels were created many centuries before the creation of the sensitive world

Original: ma questo vero è scritto in molti lati da li scrittor de lo Spirito Santo, e tu te n’avvedrai se bene agguati
Translate: But the truth that I have spoken is written in more places than the Holy Scriptures, and you will understand it if you read it carefully.

Original: e anche la ragione il vede alquanto, che non concederebbe che ’ motori sanza sua perfezion fosser cotanto
Translate: and also reason can understand it, since it is not possible that the engines of Heaven existed for so long without reaching perfection, inoperose

Original: Or sai tu dove e quando questi amori furon creati e come
Translate: Now you know where, when and how these loves were created

Original: sì che spenti nel tuo disïo già son tre ardori
Translate: so that three of your desires have already been fulfilled

Original: Né giugneriesi, numerando, al venti sì tosto, come de li angeli parte turbò il suggetto d’i vostri alimenti
Translate: It would not come, counting, to the wind, as quickly as a part of the angels troubled the subject of your elements.

Original: L’altra rimase, e cominciò quest’ arte che tu discerni, con tanto diletto, che mai da circüir non si diparte
Translate: The other one has stayed and started this art that you perceive with so much pleasure that never goes far from observing

Original: Principio del cader fu il maladetto superbir di colui che tu vedesti da tutti i pesi del mondo costretto
Translate: The cause of the fall was the goddamn pride of the one you saw forced by all the burdens of the world.

Original: Quelli che vedi qui furon modesti a riconoscer sé da la bontate che li avea fatti a tanto intender presti
Translate: Those angels whom you see here, however, had the modesty of recognizing that they were created by divine goodness, endowed with such intelligence.

Original: per che le viste lor furo essaltate con grazia illuminante e con lor merto, si c’hanno ferma e piena volontate
Translate: therefore their vision of God was increased by enlightening grace and their merit, since they are endowed with firm and full will.

Original: e non voglio che dubbi, ma sia certo, che ricever la grazia è meritorio secondo che l’affetto l’è aperto
Translate: And I don't want you to doubt, but you have to be sure that receiving grace is a merit, commensurate with the will to obtain it.

Original: Omai dintorno a questo consistorio puoi contemplare assai, se le parole mie son ricolte, sanz’ altro aiutorio
Translate: By now you can understand for yourself many things about this assembly, certainly help, if you have understood my words well

Original: Ma perché ’n terra per le vostre scole si legge che l’angelica natura è tal, che ’ntende e si ricorda e vole, ancor dirò,
Translate: But since on Earth in your philosophical schools it is taught that angelic nature is such that it possesses intellect, will and memory, I will speak again,

Original: perché tu veggi pura la verità che là giù si confonde, equivocando in sì fatta lettura
Translate: that you may see the plain truth that is confused in the world by the misunderstandings of such teachings.

Original: Queste sustanze, poi che fur gioconde de la faccia di Dio, non volser viso da essa, da cui nulla si nasconde
Translate: These creatures, once they were joyful of the face of God, have no longer looked toward it, from which nothing is hidden.

Original: però non hanno vedere interciso da novo obietto, e però non bisogna rememorar per concetto diviso
Translate: therefore their vision is not interrupted by any new object, and therefore they do not need to remember concepts acquired at different times

Original: sì che là giù, non dormendo, si sogna, credendo e non credendo dicer vero
Translate: then on Earth you dream with your eyes open, saying incorrect things in good and bad faith

Original: ma ne l’uno è più colpa e più vergogna
Translate: But he that is in the bad faith is more ashamed, and more guilty.

Original: Voi non andate giù per un sentiero filosofando
Translate: You, philosophers on Earth, do not go one way

Original: tanto vi trasporta l’amor de l’apparenza e ’l suo pensiero
Translate: to this point you are carried by love and desire to appear

Original: E ancor questo qua sù si comporta con men disdegno che quando è posposta la divina Scrittura o quando è torta
Translate: And this, however, up here is tolerated with less disdain than when Sacred Scripture is neglected or deformed

Original: Non vi si pensa quanto sangue costa seminarla nel mondo e quanto piace chi umilmente con essa s’accosta
Translate: You do not think of the blood poured out to spread the word of God in the world, and how much it pleases those who join it with all humility.

Original: Per apparer ciascun s’ingegna e face sue invenzioni
Translate: Each one, to show off wisdom, is ingenious and produces inventions

Original: e quelle son trascorse da’ predicanti e ’l Vangelio si tace
Translate: and those are widely dealt with by preachers, who neglect the Gospel

Original: Un dice che la luna si ritorse ne la passion di Cristo e s’interpuose, per che ’l lume del sol giù non si porse
Translate: It is said that the moon turned around during the passion of Christ and interposed, because the light of the sun did not cast down

Original: e mente, ché la luce si nascose da sé
Translate: And speaketh falsely: for the light was darkened by itself.

Original: però a li Spani e a l’Indi come a’ Giudei tale eclissi rispuose
Translate: For such an eclipse was seen by the Spaniards and the Indians, as by the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

Original: Non ha Fiorenza tanti Lapi e Bindi quante sì fatte favole per anno in pergamo si gridan quinci e quindi
Translate: Florence doesn't have as many Lapi and Bindi as the fairy tales that every year cry out from the pulpit in every place

Original: sì che le pecorelle, che non sanno, tornan del pasco pasciute di vento, e non le scusa non veder lo danno
Translate: so that the ignorant sheep return from the pasture after feeding on the wind, and it is no excuse not to see their own damage

Original: Non disse Cristo al suo primo convento
Translate: Christ did not tell his early Apostles

Original: ‘Andate, e predicate al mondo ciance’
Translate: 'Go and preach to the world',

Original: ma diede lor verace fondamento
Translate: But he gave them a foundation of truth.

Original: e quel tanto sonò ne le sue guance, sì ch’a pugnar per accender la fede de l’Evangelio fero scudo e lance
Translate: and only that sounded in the cheeks of the Apostles, so that they used the Gospel as a shield and spears to fight and spread the faith

Original: Ora si va con motti e con iscede a predicare, e pur che ben si rida, gonfia il cappuccio e più non si richiede
Translate: Now the preachers perform themselves in mottos and stripes, and as long as they have raised up the rice they swell with pride and ask nothing else.

Original: Ma tale uccel nel becchetto s’annida, che se ’l vulgo il vedesse, vederebbe la perdonanza di ch’el si confida
Translate: But in the hood there is such a bird, that if it were seen by the people this would understand what the indulgences in which they hope are worth

Original: per cui tanta stoltezza in terra crebbe, che, sanza prova d’alcun testimonio, ad ogne promession si correrebbe
Translate: so on Earth has grown such stupidity that, without proof of any testimony, you run after every promise

Original: Di questo ingrassa il porco sant’ Antonio, e altri assai che sono ancor più porci, pagando di moneta sanza conio
Translate: With this Saint Anthony Abbot fattens the pig and many others who are even more swine, paying coins without mint

Original: Ma perché siam digressi assai, ritorci li occhi oramai verso la dritta strada, sì che la via col tempo si raccorci
Translate: But since we have gone very far with this digression, he takes his gaze back to the straight road, so that the way is traveled in a short time.

Original: Questa natura sì oltre s’ingrada in numero, che mai non fu loquela né concetto mortal che tanto vada
Translate: The nature of angels grows in number from one order to another, to the point that no human discourse or intellect can conceive of it

Original: e se tu guardi quel che si revela per Danïel, vedrai che ’n sue migliaia determinato numero si cela
Translate: And if thou consider that which is revealed by Daniel, thou shalt see that in the thousands of angels of which the number is spoken, it is hidden.

Original: La prima luce, che tutta la raia, per tanti modi in essa si recepe, quanti son li splendori a chi s’appaia
Translate: The light of God, that radiates all the angels, is received by them in a different way, for those who are the splendors to which it joins

Original: Onde, però che a l’atto che concepe segue l’affetto, d’amar la dolcezza diversamente in essa ferve e tepe
Translate: Therefore, since at the moment of God's vision love follows, the sweetness of this love is ardent and lukewarm in angels in a slightly different way

Original: Vedi l’eccelso omai e la larghezza de l’etterno valor, poscia che tanti speculi fatti s’ha in che si spezza,
Translate: See now the height and generosity of eternal value, since it is reflected in so many mirrors,

Original: uno manendo in sé come davanti»
Translate: while remaining the same as herself

Original: Forse semilia miglia di lontano ci ferve l’ora sesta, e questo mondo china già l’ombra quasi al letto piano,
Translate: about six thousand miles away, the noon burns, and this planet already casts its shadow cone on the plane of the horizon,

Original: quando ’l mezzo del cielo, a noi profondo, comincia a farsi tal, ch’alcuna stella perde il parere infino a questo fondo
Translate: when the atmosphere between us and the depth of the sky begins to become such that some stars become invisible

Original: e come vien la chiarissima ancella del sol più oltre, così ’l ciel si chiude di vista in vista infino a la più bella
Translate: And as the bright handmaid of the Sun goes forth, behold, the stars vanish from the sky, even to the brightest.

Original: Non altrimenti il trïunfo che lude sempre dintorno al punto che mi vinse,
Translate: In a similar way the triumph that always revolves festive around that luminous point that won my view,

Original: parendo inchiuso da quel ch’elli ’nchiude,
Translate: seeming enclosed by what it itself contains,

Original: a poco a poco al mio veder si stinse
Translate: Little by little he vanished at my sight

Original: per che tornar con li occhi a Bëatrice nulla vedere e amor mi costrinse
Translate: So seeing nothing again, and love moved me to turn my eyes again to Beatrice.

Original: Se quanto infino a qui di lei si dice fosse conchiuso tutto in una loda, poca sarebbe a fornir questa vice
Translate: If everything that has been said so far about you were enclosed in one praise, it would be insufficient for this task.

Original: La bellezza ch’io vidi si trasmoda non pur di là da noi, ma certo io credo che solo il suo fattor tutta la goda
Translate: The beauty of her that I saw turned into something not only beyond the human, but I believe for certain that only her Creator can fully enjoy her.

Original: Da questo passo vinto mi concedo più che già mai da punto di suo tema soprato fosse comico o tragedo
Translate: I admit that I am won from this point, much more than an author of medium or sublime style could be from a problematic aspect of the topic addressed

Original: ché, come sole in viso che più trema, così lo rimembrar del dolce riso la mente mia da me medesmo scema
Translate: in fact, as the sun in a weak sight, so the memory of his sweet smile makes my intellect faint.

Original: Dal primo giorno ch’i’ vidi il suo viso in questa vita, infino a questa vista, non m’è il seguire al mio cantar preciso
Translate: From the first day I saw Beatrice's face in this life, to this vision of her in Paradise, my song was never interrupted

Original: ma or convien che mio seguir desista più dietro a sua bellezza, poetando, come a l’ultimo suo ciascuno artista
Translate: But now it is inevitable that I desist from following his beauty, writing my verses, as an artist who has reached the extreme limit of his abilities

Original: Cotal qual io lascio a maggior bando che quel de la mia tuba, che deduce l’ardüa sua matera terminando, con atto e voce di spedito duce ricominciò
Translate: I leave this to a more important verse than those of my trumpet which, finishing its difficult matter, began again with the action and voice of a quick guide

Original: «Noi siamo usciti fore del maggior corpo al ciel ch’è pura luce
Translate: We came out of Heaven more extended to what is made of pure light

Original: luce intellettüal, piena d’amore
Translate: an intellectual light, full of love

Original: amor di vero ben, pien di letizia
Translate: a love of true good, full of joy

Original: letizia che trascende ogne dolzore
Translate: a joy that surpasses all sweetness

Original: Qui vederai l’una e l’altra milizia di paradiso, e l’una in quelli aspetti che tu vedrai a l’ultima giustizia»
Translate: Here you will see both the hosts of Paradise, and one of them with that aspect that you will see on Judgment Day.

Original: Come sùbito lampo che discetti li spiriti visivi, sì che priva da l’atto l’occhio di più forti obietti,
Translate: Like a sudden flash that disperses visual faculties, so it deprives the eye of the ability to see other objects,

Original: così mi circunfulse luce viva, e lasciommi fasciato di tal velo del suo fulgor, che nulla m’appariva
Translate: So I was enveloped with a very bright light, which bound me with such a veil with its brightness that I saw nothing else.

Original: «Sempre l’amor che queta questo cielo accoglie in sé con sì fatta salute, per far disposto a sua fiamma il candelo»
Translate: "The love that makes this Heaven quiet always welcomes the soul that enters with this greeting, to adapt the candle to its flame"

Original: Non fur più tosto dentro a me venute queste parole brievi, ch’io compresi me sormontar di sopr’ a mia virtute
Translate: These brief words had not yet come within me, that I understood that I was going beyond my natural faculties.

Original: e di novella vista mi raccesi tale, che nulla luce è tanto mera, che li occhi miei non si fosser difesi
Translate: and I acquired a new visual capacity, such that there is no light so intense that my eyes could not sustain it.

Original: e vidi lume in forma di rivera fulvido di fulgore, intra due rive dipinte di mirabil primavera
Translate: And I saw a light in the form of a river, of reddish splendor, between two banks adorned with beautiful spring flowers.

Original: Di tal fiumana uscian faville vive, e d’ogne parte si mettien ne’ fiori, quasi rubin che oro circunscrive
Translate: Out of this river were shining fairy tales, and they stood everywhere among the flowers, like rubies set in gold.

Original: poi, come inebrïate da li odori, riprofondavan sé nel miro gurge,
Translate: Then, as if they were intoxicated by the scent, they sank back into the wonderful gorgo.

Original: e s’una intrava, un’altra n’uscia fori
Translate: And if one went in, another went out immediately.

Original: «L’alto disio che mo t’infiamma e urge, d’aver notizia di ciò che tu vei, tanto mi piace più quanto più turge
Translate: The intense desire that now inflames you and pushes you, that is to know what is what you see, I like the more it fills you

Original: ma di quest’ acqua convien che tu bei prima che tanta sete in te si sazi»
Translate: But you must still drink of this water, before such a thirst is filled within you.

Original: così mi disse il sol de li occhi miei
Translate: So said Beatrice, the sun of my eyes.

Original: Anche soggiunse
Translate: And he added again

Original: «Il fiume e li topazi ch’entrano ed escono e ’l rider de l’erbe son di lor vero umbriferi prefazi
Translate: The river and the topaz that enter and go forth, and the beauty of the flowers are overshadowed previews of their real essence

Original: Non che da sé sian queste cose acerbe
Translate: Not that these things are in themselves imperfect,

Original: ma è difetto da la parte tua, che non hai viste ancor tanto superbe»
Translate: but there is a lack on your part, for you do not yet have the sight ready to observe such shows.

Original: Non è fantin che sì sùbito rua col volto verso il latte, se si svegli molto tardato da l’usanza sua,
Translate: A child, waking up much later than usual, does not suddenly run towards milk

Original: come fec’ io, per far migliori spegli ancor de li occhi, chinandomi a l’onda che si deriva perché vi s’immegli
Translate: As I did, to make my eyes better, bowing down to that river that floweth, that it may be better for you.

Original: e sì come di lei bevve la gronda de le palpebre mie, così mi parve di sua lunghezza divenuta tonda
Translate: And as soon as the hem of my eyelids drank of that vision, it seemed to me that the long river had become round.

Original: Poi, come gente stata sotto larve, che pare altro che prima, se si sveste la sembianza non süa in che disparve,
Translate: Then, as people who have worn masks and undressing like artifacts, appearing different from what they used to be,

Original: così mi si cambiaro in maggior feste li fiori e le faville, sì ch’io vidi ambo le corti del ciel manifeste
Translate: So the flowers and fairy tales turned into more festive images in my eyes, so that I saw both the courts of Heaven openly.

Original: O isplendor di Dio, per cu’ io vidi l’alto trïunfo del regno verace, dammi virtù a dir com’ ïo il vidi
Translate: O splendor of God, through whom I saw the high triumph of the true kingdom, grant me the virtue necessary to report my vision.

Original: Lume è là sù che visibile face lo creatore a quella creatura che solo in lui vedere ha la sua pace
Translate: Up there in the Empire there is a light that makes the Creator visible to that creature who finds his peace only in seeing Him

Original: E’ si distende in circular figura, in tanto che la sua circunferenza sarebbe al sol troppo larga cintura
Translate: This light stretches out in a circular figure, so much so that its circumference would be much wider than that of the Heaven of the Sun

Original: Fassi di raggio tutta sua parvenza reflesso al sommo del mobile primo, che prende quindi vivere e potenza
Translate: Everything you see of it is formed by a ray that is reflected on the concave surface of the Primo Mobile, which draws from it its motion and its virtue

Original: E come clivo in acqua di suo imo si specchia, quasi per vedersi addorno, quando è nel verde e ne’ fioretti opimo,
Translate: And as a hill is reflected in the water on its slopes, as if to be adorned when it has green herbs and lush flowers,

Original: sì, soprastando al lume intorno intorno, vidi specchiarsi in più di mille soglie quanto di noi là sù fatto ha ritorno
Translate: So, standing all around that light, I saw myself mirrored in more than a thousand steps than the blessed souls who returned up there.

Original: E se l’infimo grado in sé raccoglie sì grande lume, quanta è la larghezza di questa rosa ne l’estreme foglie
Translate: And if the lower step gathers in itself such a great light, how wide this rose must be in its outer petals

Original: La vista mia ne l’ampio e ne l’altezza non si smarriva, ma tutto prendeva il quanto e ’l quale di quella allegrezza
Translate: My sight was not lost because of the breadth and height of the rose, but fully perceived the quantity and quality of that cheerfulness.

Original: Presso e lontano, lì, né pon né leva
Translate: The proximity and distance, there, does not add or remove anything

Original: ché dove Dio sanza mezzo governa, la legge natural nulla rileva
Translate: in fact, where God directs, natural laws have no value

Original: Nel giallo de la rosa sempiterna, che si digrada e dilata e redole odor di lode al sol che sempre verna, qual è colui che tace e dicer vole, mi trasse Bëatrice, e disse
Translate: while I was silent though I wanted to speak, Beatrice led me to the center of the eternal rose, which pours down and extends and emanates a scent of praise to the sun that always makes spring, and she said to me,

Original: «Mira quanto è ’l convento de le bianche stole
Translate: "Look at the extent of the Council of White Stoles

Original: Vedi nostra città quant’ ella gira
Translate: See how big our city is

Original: vedi li nostri scanni sì ripieni, che poca gente più ci si disira
Translate: You see our seats so occupied that very few of them have remained free.

Original: E ’n quel gran seggio a che tu li occhi tieni per la corona che già v’è sù posta,
Translate: And in that great seat whereon thou stareest at the crown which is laid upon it,

Original: prima che tu a queste nozze ceni, sederà l’alma, che fia giù agosta, de l’alto Arrigo, ch’a drizzare Italia verrà in prima ch’ella sia disposta
Translate: Before you dine at this wedding, the soul of the High Arrigo will sit, who will be emperor on Earth and will come to straighten Italy before it is ready to welcome it.

Original: La cieca cupidigia che v’ammalia simili fatti v’ha al fantolino che muor per fame e caccia via la balia
Translate: The blind greed that seduces you has made you like the child who dies of hunger, and yet sends away the nurse

Original: E fia prefetto nel foro divino allora tal, che palese e coverto non anderà con lui per un cammino
Translate: And he will be a very skillful prefect, one who will not go with him on one path and act in a different way publicly and secretly.

Original: Ma poco poi sarà da Dio sofferto nel santo officio
Translate: But God will tolerate him little time in the holy office

Original: ch’el sarà detruso là dove Simon mago è per suo merto, e farà quel d’Alagna intrar più giuso»
Translate: in fact he will be pushed down where Simon the magician is already for his crimes, and will push even more deeply the pope of Anagni

Original: In forma dunque di candida rosa mi si mostrava la milizia santa che nel suo sangue Cristo fece sposa
Translate: So the holy host of the blessed whom Christ married with his blood was shown to me in the form of a white rose

Original: ma l’altra, che volando vede e canta la gloria di colui che la ’nnamora e la bontà che la fece cotanta,
Translate: But the other, who, flying, sees and sings the glory of God who fills her with love, and the goodness that made her so shining,

Original: sì come schiera d’ape che s’infiora una fïata e una si ritorna là dove suo laboro s’insapora,
Translate: like a swarm of bees that enters the flower and then returns to the hive where it transforms its work into honey,

Original: nel gran fior discendeva che s’addorna di tante foglie, e quindi risaliva là dove ’l süo amor sempre soggiorna
Translate: He descended into the rose of the blessed who is adorned with so many petals, and then went up where his love always resides.

Original: Le facce tutte avean di fiamma viva e l’ali d’oro, e l’altro tanto bianco, che nulla neve a quel termine arriva
Translate: Their faces were as red as the bright flame, and their wings were of gold, and their garments were so white that no snow could equal that whiteness.

Original: Quando scendean nel fior, di banco in banco porgevan de la pace e de l’ardore ch’elli acquistavan ventilando il fianco
Translate: And when they went down into the rose, they brought peace into all the seats, and the ardour, which they gained by flying.

Original: Né l’interporsi tra ’l disopra e ’l fiore di tanta moltitudine volante impediva la vista e lo splendore
Translate: Nor did the interposition between the summit and the flower of so many flying multitudes prevent sight and splendor

Original: ché la luce divina è penetrante per l’universo secondo ch’è degno, sì che nulla le puote essere ostante
Translate: For the light of God penetrates through the universe according to him who is worthy, so that nothing can hinder him.

Original: Questo sicuro e gaudïoso regno, frequente in gente antica e in novella, viso e amore avea tutto ad un segno
Translate: This peaceful and joyful kingdom, full of Blesseds of the Old and New Testaments, had its gaze and affection all turned toward the same direction.

Original: O trina luce che ’n unica stella scintillando a lor vista, sì li appaga
Translate: O light of the Trinity, that shining in a single star in their eyes pleases them so much,

Original: guarda qua giuso a la nostra procella
Translate: turn your gaze to the storms of the earthly world

Original: Se i barbari, venendo da tal plaga che ciascun giorno d’Elice si cuopra, rotante col suo figlio ond’ ella è vaga,
Translate: If the barbarians, coming from those regions which every day cover themselves with the Elice and which rotates with the son where it is wandering,

Original: veggendo Roma e l’ardüa sua opra, stupefaciensi, quando Laterano a le cose mortali andò di sopra
Translate: seeing Rome and its high monuments were stunned, when the Lateran surpassed all other human works

Original: ïo, che al divino da l’umano, a l’etterno dal tempo era venuto,
Translate: I, who had come to the divine dimension from the earthly world, to the dimension of the eternal from time

Original: e di Fiorenza in popol giusto e sano, di che stupor dovea esser compiuto
Translate: And from Florence to that just and upright people, what amazement I had to be full of

Original: Certo tra esso e ’l gaudio mi facea libito non udire e starmi muto
Translate: Surely that wonder and joy made me long to hear nothing, and to remain silent.

Original: E quasi peregrin che si ricrea nel tempio del suo voto riguardando,
Translate: And as a pilgrim resting after coming to the sanctuary the goal of his journey,

Original: e spera già ridir com’ ello stea, su per la viva luce passeggiando, menava ïo li occhi per li gradi,
Translate: and hope to be able to report back how it presents itself, so I would push my eyes down the steps,

Original: mo sù, mo giù e mo recirculando
Translate: now up, now down, and now turning them around.

Original: Vedëa visi a carità süadi, d’altrui lume fregiati e di suo riso, e atti ornati di tutte onestadi
Translate: I saw faces conformed to charity, illuminated by the light of God and his own joy, and with attitudes marked by the most decorous composure

Original: La forma general di paradiso già tutta mïo sguardo avea compresa, in nulla parte ancor fermato fiso
Translate: My gaze had embraced the aspect of all Paradise and had not yet stopped on a specific point.

Original: e volgeami con voglia rïaccesa per domandar la mia donna di cose di che la mente mia era sospesa
Translate: and I turned with renewed desire to ask my woman some things of which I had been in doubt in my mind

Original: Uno intendëa, e altro mi rispuose
Translate: I meant to do this, but he answered me something else.

Original: credea veder Beatrice e vidi un sene vestito con le genti glorïose
Translate: I thought I saw Beatrice and I saw an old man dressed in white like all the other blesseds.

Original: Diffuso era per li occhi e per le gene di benigna letizia, in atto pio quale a tenero padre si convene
Translate: From his eyes and cheeks he inspired a benevolent joy, with a godly attitude as he suited himself to a loving father.

Original: E «Ov’ è ella?», sùbito diss’ io
Translate: And where is she? I immediately said:

Original: Ond’ elli
Translate: And he answered

Original: «A terminar lo tuo disiro mosse Beatrice me del loco mio
Translate: Beatrice summoned me from my seat to fulfill your desire

Original: e se riguardi sù nel terzo giro dal sommo grado, tu la rivedrai nel trono che suoi merti le sortiro»
Translate: and if you look up, in the third step of the rose from above, you will see it in the seat that its merits have granted it.

Original: Sanza risponder, li occhi sù levai, e vidi lei che si facea corona reflettendo da sé li etterni rai
Translate: Without replying, I looked up and saw Beatrice crowned with a halo shining with divine rays.

Original: Da quella regïon che più sù tona occhio mortale alcun tanto non dista,
Translate: From that region of heaven where it thunders higher, a human eye is not so far away

Original: qualunque in mare più giù s’abbandona, quanto lì da Beatrice la mia vista
Translate: Even if it is in the deepest abyss of the sea, how far was the distance between my eyes and Beatrice?

Original: ma nulla mi facea, ché süa effige non discendëa a me per mezzo mista
Translate: But he didn't do anything to me, for his image didn't come to me by physical means.

Original: «O donna in cui la mia speranza vige, e che soffristi per la mia salute in inferno lasciar le tue vestige,
Translate: "O woman in whom my hope is strengthened, and who for my salvation you tolerated leaving your footsteps in Hell,

Original: di tante cose quant’ i’ ho vedute, dal tuo podere e da la tua bontate riconosco la grazia e la virtute
Translate: if I have been able to see so many things, I acknowledge that such grace and virtue is derived from your power and goodness.

Original: Tu m’hai di servo tratto a libertate per tutte quelle vie, per tutt’ i modi che di ciò fare avei la potestate
Translate: You brought me back to freedom on all those roads and in all those ways that you had the power to do this.

Original: La tua magnificenza in me custodi, sì che l’anima mia, che fatt’ hai sana, piacente a te dal corpo si disnodi»
Translate: Keep this gift of yours in me, so that my soul, which you have made whole, may be separated from the body in the way that you will like it.

Original: E ’l santo sene
Translate: And the old saint

Translate: "In order for you to accomplish it properly," he said,

Original: «il tuo cammino, a che priego e amor santo mandommi, vola con li occhi per questo giardino
Translate: Your journey, which is why prayer and holy love have sent me here, push your gaze along the rose

Original: Qual è colui che forse di Croazia viene a veder la Veronica nostra,
Translate: Like the pilgrim who may come from Croatia to see our Veronica,

Translate: who, because of the ancient insatiable hunger, speaks within the mind until it is shown

Translate: so was I observing the lively charity of Bernard who, on this earth, contemplating, tasted the divine peace

Original: «Figliuol di grazia, quest’ esser giocondo»,
Translate: Son of grace, this joyful essence

Original: cominciò elli,
Translate: started him

Original: «non ti sarà noto, tenendo li occhi pur qua giù al fondo
Translate: You won't be noticed if you keep your eyes fixed down here.

Original: ma guarda i cerchi infino al più remoto, tanto che veggi seder la regina cui questo regno è suddito e devoto»
Translate: But keep the circles farthest away, till he see in his seat the Queen to whom this kingdom is subject and devoted.

Original: Io levai li occhi
Translate: I looked up

Original: e come da mattina la parte orïental de l’orizzonte soverchia quella dove ’l sol declina,
Translate: And as in the morning the eastern part of the horizon surpasses in light that where the sun sets,

Original: così, quasi di valle andando a monte con li occhi, vidi parte ne lo stremo vincer di lume tutta l’altra fronte

Translate: And as on Earth, on the side where the rudder that Pheton did not know how to drive awaits, the sky lights up more, while on the sides the light tends to decrease,

Translate: So that peaceful flaming light glowed at the center, and on the sides the splendor subsided evenly.

Translate: And toward that point I saw more than a thousand festive angels, with their wings spread out, each one different for splendor and movement.

Original: Vidi a lor giochi quivi e a lor canti ridere una bellezza, che letizia era ne li occhi a tutti li altri santi
Translate: Here in their triumph and in their song I saw such beauty shining, which was a joy in the eyes of all the other saints.

Original: e s’io avessi in dir tanta divizia quanta ad imaginar, non ardirei lo minimo tentar di sua delizia
Translate: And if I had as much wealth of expression as I imagined, I wouldn't dare to describe his beauty.

Original: Bernardo, come vide li occhi miei nel caldo suo caler fissi e attenti, li suoi con tanto affetto volse a lei,
Translate: Bernardo, as soon as he saw that my eyes were fixed and attentive in his warmth, turned them toward her with such affection

Original: che ’ miei di rimirar fé più ardenti
Translate: who made mine even more eager to admire her

Original: Affetto al suo piacer, quel contemplante libero officio di dottore assunse, e cominciò queste parole sante
Translate: Affectionate to his pleasure, that contemplative took on the free role of doctor and began these holy words

Translate: "Colei who sits so beautiful at the feet of Mary, produced and opened the plague that Mary then healed and closed

Translate: Sarah, Rebekah, Judith, and the great-grandmother of the sinner who, out of remorse for sin committed, said, "Miserere mei,"

Original: puoi tu veder così di soglia in soglia giù digradar, com’ io ch’a proprio nome vo per la rosa giù di foglia in foglia
Translate: You can see down, step to step, as I name these Jewish women one by one

Original: E dal settimo grado in giù, sì come infino ad esso, succedono Ebree, dirimendo del fior tutte le chiome
Translate: And from the seventh order down, just as to it, follow other Jewish women, who divide all the petals of the rose

Translate: For according to the look with which faith looked upon Christ, they form a wall that separates the sacred stairs.

Original: Da questa parte onde ’l fiore è maturo di tutte le sue foglie, sono assisi quei che credettero in Cristo venturo
Translate: On this side wherein the flower hath all its leaves sitt those who believed in the coming Christ.

Original: da l’altra parte onde sono intercisi di vòti i semicirculi, si stanno quei ch’a Cristo venuto ebber li visi

Translate: And as on this side the glorious seat of the Queen of Heaven and the others below form this dividing line,

Translate: And under him, Francis, and Benedict, and Augustine, and others went out, even here from round about.

Original: Or mira l’alto proveder divino
Translate: Now observe God's High Providence

Original: ché l’uno e l’altro aspetto de la fede igualmente empierà questo giardino
Translate: For both believers, in Christ coming and coming, shall fill this garden in equal measure.

Original: E sappi che dal grado in giù che fiede a mezzo il tratto le due discrezioni,
Translate: And know that under the order which also divides the two divisions horizontally,

Original: per nullo proprio merito si siede, ma per l’altrui, con certe condizioni
Translate: He sits not for his own merit, but for that of others, under certain conditions.

Original: ché tutti questi son spiriti ascolti prima ch’avesser vere elezïoni
Translate: in fact all these spirits were dissolved before they had a choice with free will

Translate: You can easily understand it from childish faces and voices, if you look at them and listen to them with due attention

Original: Or dubbi tu e dubitando sili
Translate: Now you have a doubt, and doubting remains silent

Original: ma io discioglierò ’l forte legame in che ti stringon li pensier sottili
Translate: But I will loosen the bond in which your subtle thoughts are bound

Original: Dentro a l’ampiezza di questo reame casüal punto non puote aver sito, se non come tristizia o sete o fame
Translate: In the vastness of this holy kingdom there can be nothing random, just as there is no room for sadness, thirst or hunger

Original: ché per etterna legge è stabilito quantunque vedi, sì che giustamente ci si risponde da l’anello al dito

Original: e però questa festinata gente a vera vita non è sine causa intra sé qui più e meno eccellente
Translate: so these souls of children who died prematurely, not without reason sit at different heights

Original: le menti tutte nel suo lieto aspetto creando, a suo piacer di grazia dota diversamente
Translate: creating all souls in his joyful appearance endows them with a different degree of grace, as he pleases

Original: e qui basti l’effetto

Translate: And this is clearly stated in the Holy Scriptures by the example of the twins who, even in their mother's belly, were discordant among them.

Translate: In the early days of Humanity, for children to be saved, the innocence and faith of parents were sufficient

Translate: After the early years, it was necessary for innocent males to acquire virtue by circumcision

Translate: but after the time of grace came, without the perfect baptism of Christ innocent children remain confined in Limbo

Translate: See now in the face that most resembles Christ, for his splendour is the only one who can prepare you to see Christ.

Translate: that all that I had seen before did not pervade me with such admiration, nor did he ever show me such likeness to God.

Translate: And the angel that went down there first displeased his wings before her, singing 'Hail Mary, full of grace'

Translate: To that divine song he answered from all sides that court of Paradise, so that every face of the blessed became brighter.

Original: «O santo padre, che per me comporte l’esser qua giù, lasciando il dolce loco nel qual tu siedi per etterna sorte,

Original: Così ricorsi ancora a la dottrina di colui ch’abbelliva di Maria, come del sole stella mattutina

Original: Ed elli a me
Translate: And him to me

Translate: "Security and graciousness, all that may be in an angel and in a human soul, is all in him,

Original: e sì volem che sia, perch’ elli è quelli che portò la palma giuso a Maria,

Original: quando ’l Figliuol di Dio carcar si volse de la nostra salma
Translate: when the Son of God wanted to incarnate himself in our body

Translate: and in front of the oldest father of the family, Saint Lucy sits, who impelled your woman to help you, when you went back to the dark forest.

Translate: But because the human time to which you are subject runs away, we will stop here, like the good tailor who produces the garment according to how much cloth he has

Original: e drizzeremo li occhi al primo amore, sì che, guardando verso lui, penètri quant’ è possibil per lo suo fulgore
Translate: and we will turn our gaze to the first love, so that, looking towards Him, you may enter as far as possible into his splendour.

Translate: However, in order that you may not retreat by moving with your own strength and believing to advance, it is necessary to obtain grace with a prayer from the one who can help you

Original: e tu mi seguirai con l’affezione, sì che dal dicer mio lo cor non parti»
Translate: And thou shalt follow me with affection, that thou mayest not turn thine heart away from my words.

Original: E cominciò questa santa orazione

Original: «Vergine Madre, figlia del tuo figlio, umile e alta più che creatura, termine fisso d’etterno consiglio,
Translate: "O Virgin Mother, daughter of your own Son, the humblest and highest of all creatures, fixed term of divine wisdom,

Original: tu se’ colei che l’umana natura nobilitasti sì, che ’l suo fattore non disdegnò di farsi sua fattura
Translate: You are the one who has ennobled human nature so much that his Creator did not disdain to become his creature.

Original: Nel ventre tuo si raccese l’amore, per lo cui caldo ne l’etterna pace così è germinato questo fiore
Translate: In your womb the love between God and man was rekindled, thanks to whose ardour in eternal peace this flower has sprung up.

Original: Qui se’ a noi meridïana face di caritate, e giuso, intra ’ mortali, se’ di speranza fontana vivace

Translate: Woman, you are so great and you have so great value that, if one wants a grace and does not resort to your intercession, it is as if his desire wanted to fly without wings

Original: La tua benignità non pur soccorre a chi domanda, ma molte fïate liberamente al dimandar precorre

Original: In te misericordia, in te pietate, in te magnificenza, in te s’aduna quantunque in creatura è di bontate
Translate: In you are mercy, piety, liberality; in you is gathered all the goodness that can be found in a creature

Translate: Now this one, who from the depths of Hell to here has seen the condition all souls after death,

Original: E io, che mai per mio veder non arsi più ch’i’ fo per lo suo, tutti miei prieghi ti porgo,
Translate: And I, who have never desired to see God more than I long for him to see him, offer all my prayers to you.

Original: e priego che non sieno scarsi, perché tu ogne nube li disleghi di sua mortalità co’ prieghi tuoi,

Original: sì che ’l sommo piacer li si dispieghi
Translate: so that he may be shown the supreme bliss

Original: Ancor ti priego, regina, che puoi ciò che tu vuoli, che conservi sani, dopo tanto veder, li affetti suoi
Translate: Please also, O Queen, that you can get whatever you want, that you keep his feelings pure after such a vision

Original: Vinca tua guardia i movimenti umani
Translate: Your custody restrains human passions

Original: vedi Beatrice con quanti beati per li miei prieghi ti chiudon le mani»
Translate: see Beatrice and all the other blessed who join their hands in my prayer

Original: Li occhi da Dio diletti e venerati, fissi ne l’orator, ne dimostraro quanto i devoti prieghi le son grati
Translate: "The eyes loved and venerated by God, fixed in those of the speaker, showed us how pleasing godly prayers are to her.

Original: indi a l’etterno lume s’addrizzaro, nel qual non si dee creder che s’invii per creatura l’occhio tanto chiaro
Translate: therefore they turned to the eternal light of God, in which it is not necessary to believe that any other creature, human or angelic, can penetrate the gaze just as clearly

Original: E io ch’al fine di tutt’ i disii appropinquava, sì com’ io dovea, l’ardor del desiderio in me finii
Translate: And I, who approached the conclusion of all desires, as I had to do, exhausted in myself the ardour of my desire

Original: Bernardo m’accennava, e sorridea, perch’ io guardassi suso
Translate: Bernardo gave me a hint and smiled at me, that I might look up.

Original: ma io era già per me stesso tal qual ei volea
Translate: But I was already willing to do it myself, as he wanted.

Original: ché la mia vista, venendo sincera, e più e più intrava per lo raggio de l’alta luce che da sé è vera
Translate: For my sight, becoming clearer, penetrated more and more into the ray of high light, which is true of itself.

Original: Da quinci innanzi il mio veder fu maggio che ’l parlar mostra, ch’a tal vista cede, e cede la memoria a tanto oltraggio
Translate: From that moment on my vision was superior to how much I can express my language, which is inferior to what I saw, just as memory is insufficient to remember such an excess

Original: Qual è colüi che sognando vede, che dopo ’l sogno la passione impressa rimane, e l’altro a la mente non riede,
Translate: Like the one who sees something in a dream, and when he wakes up, he gets the impression in his soul and can't remember anything,

Original: cotal son io, ché quasi tutta cessa mia visïone, e ancor mi distilla nel core il dolce che nacque da essa
Translate: so am I, since almost all my vision has vanished from my memory, but in the heart is still present the sweetness that came from it

Original: Così la neve al sol si disigilla
Translate: So the footprints on the snow melt in the sun

Original: così al vento ne le foglie levi si perdea la sentenza di Sibilla
Translate: So the response of the Sibyl dispersed in the wind, written on the light leaves.

Original: O somma luce che tanto ti levi da’ concetti mortali, a la mia mente ripresta un poco di quel che parevi,
Translate: O supreme light, that raises you so much with respect to the human intellect, bring back to my mind a little of what you then appeared,

Original: e fa la lingua mia tanto possente, ch’una favilla sol de la tua gloria possa lasciare a la futura gente
Translate: and make my language so effective that I can leave to the posterity one spark of your glory

Original: ché, per tornare alquanto a mia memoria e per sonare un poco in questi versi, più si conceperà di tua vittoria
Translate: in fact, if I can remember something and represent it a little in these verses, you will be able to better understand your victory

Original: Io credo, per l’acume ch’io soffersi del vivo raggio, ch’i’ sarei smarrito, se li occhi miei da lui fossero aversi
Translate: I believe that I would have been lost if my eyes had turned away from the live ray of the divine mind, because of the radiance that struck me

Original: E’ mi ricorda ch’io fui più ardito per questo a sostener, tanto ch’i’ giunsi l’aspetto mio col valore infinito
Translate: I remember that for this reason I was braver to support his view, so much so that I pushed my gaze deeply into the infinite value

Original: Oh abbondante grazia ond’ io presunsi ficcar lo viso per la luce etterna, tanto che la veduta vi consunsi
Translate: Oh, bountiful grace for which I dared to stare into the eternal light, to the point that I brought my sight to the extreme limit of its capacity.

Original: Nel suo profondo vidi che s’interna, legato con amore in un volume, ciò che per l’universo si squaderna
Translate: In its depth I saw that everything that is dispersed in the Universe is contained, bound in a volume.

Original: sustanze e accidenti e lor costume quasi conflati insieme, per tal modo che ciò ch’i’ dico è un semplice lume
Translate: substances, hell and their bond, almost unified together, so that what I say is a glimmer of truth

Original: La forma universal di questo nodo credo ch’i’ vidi, perché più di largo, dicendo questo, mi sento ch’i’ godo
Translate: I think I've seen the universal form of this knot, because as I speak of it, I feel joy growing in me.

Original: Un punto solo m’è maggior letargo che venticinque secoli a la ’mpresa che fé Nettuno ammirar l’ombra d’Argo
Translate: A moment is for me oblivion greater than the twenty-five centuries that separate us from the undertaking of the Argonauts, so Neptune was amazed to see the shadow of the ship Argo

Original: Così la mente mia, tutta sospesa, mirava fissa, immobile e attenta, e sempre di mirar faceasi accesa
Translate: So my mind, all suspended, admired with a fixed, immobile and attentive gaze, gradually increasing the desire to observe

Original: A quella luce cotal si diventa, che volgersi da lei per altro aspetto è impossibil che mai si consenta
Translate: In front of that light one becomes such that it is impossible to want to divert one's gaze from it to look at something else

Original: però che ’l ben, ch’è del volere obietto, tutto s’accoglie in lei, e fuor di quella è defettivo ciò ch’è lì perfetto
Translate: For the good, which is the object of the will, is gathered in it all, and out of it that which is perfect there becomes defective.

Original: Omai sarà più corta mia favella, pur a quel ch’io ricordo, che d’un fante che bagni ancor la lingua a la mammella
Translate: By now my words will be insufficient to express my memories, more than those of a child who is still breastfed by the mother

Original: Non perché più ch’un semplice sembiante fosse nel vivo lume ch’io mirava, che tal è sempre qual s’era davante
Translate: Not because in the bright light that I looked at there was more than one aspect, which is always identical to what it was before,

Original: ma per la vista che s’avvalorava in me guardando, una sola parvenza, mutandom’ io, a me si travagliava
Translate: But by my sight that grew as I looked, at my inner changing, that one aspect was transformed in my eyes.

Original: Ne la profonda e chiara sussistenza de l’alto lume parvermi tre giri di tre colori e d’una contenenza
Translate: In the deep and luminous essence of God's light three circles appeared to me, of three different colors and equal dimensions.

Original: e l’un da l’altro come iri da iri parea reflesso, e ’l terzo parea foco che quinci e quindi igualmente si spiri
Translate: and the second seemed a reflection of the first, like a rainbow reflected by another, and the third looked like a flame blowing equally from the other two

Original: Oh quanto è corto il dire e come fioco al mio concetto
Translate: Oh, how insufficient my language is to express what I remember

Original: e questo, a quel ch’i’ vidi, è tanto, che non basta a dicer ‘poco’
Translate: And even this, compared to what I saw, is so small that it is not enough to say 'little'

Original: O luce etterna che sola in te sidi, sola t’intendi, e da te intelletta e intendente te ami e arridi
Translate: O everlasting light, which takes place only in yourself, which alone understandeth thee, and understood by thyself, and in the act of understanding thee, loves and darts of charity.

Original: Quella circulazion che sì concetta pareva in te come lume reflesso, da li occhi miei alquanto circunspetta,
Translate: That circle that seemed to be born from a reflection, after being long watched by my eyes,

Original: dentro da sé, del suo colore stesso, mi parve pinta de la nostra effige
Translate: It seemed to me that he had painted in it, of the same color, the human image

Original: per che ’l mio viso in lei tutto era messo
Translate: That's why I put all my gaze on her.

Original: Qual è ’l geomètra che tutto s’affige per misurar lo cerchio, e non ritrova, pensando, quel principio ond’ elli indige,
Translate: Like the geometry scholar, who ingenizes himself with all his forces to measure the circumference and does not find, thinking, that element of which it lacks,

Original: tal era io a quella vista nova
Translate: so was I before that extraordinary vision

Original: veder voleva come si convenne l’imago al cerchio e come vi s’indova
Translate: I wanted to understand how the human image was inscribed in the circle and how it was placed inside it.

Original: ma non eran da ciò le proprie penne
Translate: but my wings were not fit for such a flight

Original: se non che la mia mente fu percossa da un fulgore in che sua voglia venne
Translate: And my mind was struck by a lightning, and by it it was able to satisfy his desire.

Original: A l’alta fantasia qui mancò possa
Translate: My high imagination here lacked strength

Original: ma già volgeva il mio disio e ’l velle, sì come rota ch’igualmente è mossa, l’amor che move il sole e l’altre stelle
Translate: But now the divine love, which moves the Sun and the other stars, turned my desire and my will, like a wheel that is moved in a uniform and regular way.
